Title: Program Analyst
job description:
Duties
Summary
Strategy and Policy (S&P) is dedicated to safeguarding the health of all animal species critical to animal agriculture, facilitating trade in animals and animal products, and strengthening animal health infrastructures both nationally and internationally. You will be responsible for a range of unique administrative and program activities for the Associate Director, Assistant Directors, and staff to support the Center for Epidemiology and Animal Health, a unit of APHIS Veterinary Services.

Responsibilities
The duties described are for the full-performance level. At developmental grade levels, assignments will be of more limited scope, performed with less independence and limited complexity. The duties may include, but are not limited to:
Preparing a variety of routine reports related to program activities.
Analyzes and evaluates the methodology by which the work of the program is accomplished.
Maintaining current copies of all import protocols; maintaining a listing of all pending staff proposals and their status.
Serves as unit time keeper to verify the time and attendance of all personnel is accurate.
Makes detailed and complex travel arrangements, which may involve multiple travelers, varied sites and modes of travel, and travel to foreign destinations.
Tracks documents and other deliverables to ensure deadlines are met.
Reviewing, coding, entering, and manipulating information in special program tracking and logging systems.
Participates in preparations for meetings and conferences, preparing agendas and travel plans, conducting negotiations related to accommodations and/or facilities, and compiling briefing books etc.
The incumbent provides administrative and program assistance to the Associate Director, Assistant Director, or supervisor/program unit staff.
Travel Required
Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position.
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
9
Job family (Series)
0343 Management And Program Analysis
Similar jobs
Analysts, Program
Program Analysts
Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
You must be a US Citizen or US National.
Males born after 12/31/1959 must be Selective Service registered or exempt.
Subject to satisfactory adjudication of background investigation and/or fingerprint check.
Successful completion of one-year probationary period, unless previously served.
Direct Deposit: Per Public Law 104-134 all Federal employees are required to have federal payments made by direct deposit to their financial institution.
Successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit E-Verify at https://www.e-verify.gov/
Qualifications
Applicants must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of the announcement, including specialized experience and/or education, as defined below.

FOR THE GS-07 LEVEL: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience (equivalent to the GS-05 grade level) that may have been obtained in the private or public (local, county, state, Federal) sectors which demonstrates:
Manage the travel, time and attendance, and other administrative functions of a team.
Schedule and prepares materials for in person meetings or teleconferences.
Format written documents according to established standards.

OR 1 full year of graduate level education in Business Management, Business/Public Administration, Human Resources or in a related field.
OR Superior Academic Achievement: To qualify based on superior academic achievement, you must have completed the requirements for a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution AND must meet certain GPA requirements.

FOR THE GS-09 LEVEL: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience (equivalent to the GS-07 level) that may have been obtained in the private or public (local, county, state, Federal) sectors which demonstrates:
Research and analyze information related to complex administrative or program related topics.
Coordinates the response to requests for information under tight deadlines.
Writes or edits memorandum to inform senior leaders.

OR Master's or equivalent graduate degree in Business Management, Business/Public Administration, Human Resources or in a related field
OR 2 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree .
OR Equivalent combinations of education and experience are qualifying for this grade level.

TRANSCRIPTS are required if:
You are qualifying for the position based on education.
You are qualifying for this position based on a combination of experience and education.
You are qualifying for this position based on Superior Academic Achievement.
This education must have been successfully completed and obtained from an accredited school, college, or university
COMBINATION OF EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE AT THE GS-07 GRADE LEVEL: Applicants may have combinations of successfully completed education and specialized experience to meet total qualification requirements. The total percentages must equal at least 100 percent to qualify for that grade level.

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.
Education
Please see above for education qualification requirement information.
Additional information
Career Transition Assistance Plan (CTAP), Reemployment Priority List (RPL), or Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP): Visit the OPM website for information on how to apply as a CTAP, RPL, or ICTAP eligible. To exercise selection priority for this vacancy, CTAP/RPL/ICTAP candidates must meet the basic eligibility requirements and all selective factors. CTAP/ICTAP candidates must be rated and determined to be well qualified (or above) based on an evaluation of the competencies listed in the How You Will Be Evaluated section. When assessed through a score-based category rating method, CTAP/ICTAP applicants must receive a rating of at least 85 out of a possible 100.
First time hires to the federal government normally start at the lowest rate of the salary range for the grade selected.
This position is eligible for telework within the local commuting area of the duty location of the position. Employee participation is at the discretion of the supervisor.

How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
Applications will be evaluated in accordance with Office of Personnel Management's (OPM) Delegated Examining Procedures and USDA policy using category rating. Applicants who meet basic minimum qualifications will be placed in one of three categories: Best Qualified, Well Qualified, or Qualified. Within these categories, applicants eligible for veteran's preference will receive selection priority over non-veterans. Category placement will be determined based on applicants' quality of experience and the extent they possess the following knowledge, skills, and abilities (KSA) or competencies:
Administration and Management
Organizational Performance Analysis


Your application, including the online Assessment Questionnaire, will be reviewed to determine if you meet (a) minimum qualification requirements and (b) the resume supports the answers provided to the job-specific questions. Your resume must clearly support your responses to all the questions addressing experience and education relevant to this position. Those determined to be in the best qualified category will be referred to the selecting official for consideration.

Note: If, after reviewing your resume and/or supporting documentation, a determination is made that you have inflated your qualifications and or experience, your score may be adjusted to more accurately reflect your abilities, or you may be found ineligible. Please follow all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your rating. Providing inaccurate information on Federal documents could be grounds for non-selection or disciplinary action up to including removal from the Federal service.

To preview the application questionnaire, please visit: https://apply.usastaffing.gov/ViewQuestionnaire/10956119

Security clearance
Not Required
Drug test required
No

Moderate Risk (MR)
Trust determination process
Credentialing, Suitability/Fitness
Required Documents
Required Documents
The following documents are required for your applicant package to be complete. Our office cannot be responsible for incompatible software, your system failure or downtime, etc. Encrypted documents will not be accepted. Failure to submit required, legible documents may result in loss of consideration.
Resume that includes: 1) personal information such as name, address, contact information; 2) education; 3) detailed work experience related to this position as described in the major duties including work schedule, hours worked per week, dates of employment; title, series, grade (if applicable); 4) other qualifications; and 5) supervisors name and phone number for each work period listed and whether or not they may be contacted for reference checks.
If education is required or you are using education to qualify, you must submit a copy of your college transcripts. An unofficial copy is sufficient with the application if it includes your name and the necessary course information; however, if you are selected, you will be required to submit official transcripts prior to entering on duty. Education must have been successfully obtained from an accredited school, college or university. If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show that the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in an accredited U.S. education program. For further information, visit the following: Foreign Education Evaluation. All transcripts must be in English or include an English translation.
If claiming veterans' preference, you must submit a DD214, Certificate of Release from Active Duty, which shows dates of service and discharge under honorable conditions. If currently on active duty you must submit a certification of expected discharge or release from active duty service under honorable conditions within 120 days after the date the certification is submitted. The certification must be on the letterhead of the appropriate military branch and include the dates of military service. Veterans' preference must be verified prior to appointment. Without this documentation, you will not receive veteran's preference and your application will be evaluated based on the material(s) submitted.
If claiming 10-point veterans' preference you must provide the DD214 or certification requirements (see above bullet), plus the proof of entitlement of this preference as listed on the SF-15 Application for 10-point Veterans' Preference. The SF-15 should be included but is not required. Failure to submit these documents could result in the determination that there is insufficient documentation to support your claim for 10-point preference. For more information on veterans' preference visit FEDSHIREVETS
Surplus or displaced employees eligible for CTAP, RPL, or ICTAP priority must provide: proof of eligibility (RIF separation notice, notice of proposed removal for declining a transfer of function or directed reassignment to another commuting area, notice of disability annuity termination), SF-50 documenting separation (as applicable), last performance appraisal that is at least fully successful or its equivalent, and your most recent SF-50 noting position, grade level, and duty location with your application per 5 CFR 330.
Worker's Compensation Separation: Agency certification of inability to place employee AND Notification of Separation OR Separation SF-50.
Disability Annuity Termination: Notification from OPM of disability annuity termination AND Separation SF-50 of the last position held. Military Reserve or National Guard Technician Special Disability Retirement Annuity under 5 U.S.C. 8337(h) or 8456: Certification of special disability retirement annuity from a military department or National Guard Bureau AND Separation SF-50 of the last position held.

Title: Business Analyst
job description:
PCG is searching for an experienced Business Analysts to analyze enterprise wide business processes and or systems and providing actionable recommendations.

Compensation: $90,000 to $130,000 Annually
Benefits Offered: Medical, Dental, Life, 401K
Employment Type: Full-Time

IDEAL CANDIDATE

5-7 years of experience in end to end analysis including: requirement gathering, documentation, process modelling, current/future state analysis, implementation, and UAT test planning and execution
Superior leadership skills; drives project teams and stakeholders towards defined goals
Experience facilitating collaboration, understanding of business requirements, relationship building, and driving standard enterprise wide business processes

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILTIES

Interact with Project Sponsors, Owners, Project Team Members, Vendors, and Subject Matter Experts to understand the business problem that needs to be solved
Lead communication across various IT and business teams while coordinating analysis efforts
Perform stakeholder analysis, document business requirements; create traceability of business requirements to technical requirements, evaluate results
Collaborate with the project/program manager serving as the liaison between the project team and the IT team
Author UAT documentation deliverables (UAT Test Plan, UAT Test Results, and UAT Defect Log). Drive UAT execution and resolution of identified defects
Support Project Manager by tracking project progress, identifying risks, and communicating status to the business(es) and organizational leadership

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's Degree in a Computer Science, Business or related field
Ability to translate information and research into non-technical language as necessary to effectively communicate across teams
Ability to manage priorities, attention to detail, and ability to handle ambiguity
CBAP Certification

Title: Product Manager - Omnichannel Consumer Engagements
job description:
PRODUCT MANAGER, OMNICHANNEL CONSUMER ENGAGEMENT
About Us
We are committed to making a difference in human health. We do so by building products, services, and capabilities for solving complex problems using top tier teams, novel evidence generation, a curated set of tools and our partner ecosystem to enable faster hyper-personalized decisions to improve human health and wellness. We take a holistic relationship-first approach to innovating, integrating and designing solutions.
What You’ll Be Doing
We’re seeking an experienced Product Manager for Omnichannel Consumer Engagement to join our highly skilled and intelligent team working to design and implement a health technology strategy for businesses across the spectrum of start-up to enterprise. As an ideal candidate, you have deep knowledge, understanding and analytical skills within the CRM space, experience with omnichannel marketing and consumer engagements. You have successfully built SaaS based platforms and launched pilots. Your organizational, communication and relationship management skills are exceptional, you have a proven ability to work in a fast-paced start-up environment and are comfortable with ambiguity.
As a Product Manager you will be responsible for driving the product definition and feature prioritization, defining product requirements and helping to build the product roadmap. This role will require coordination across internal and external teams. You’ll work with customers, partners, and operational stakeholders to prioritize features and spearhead the definition of new capabilities through expertly crafted narratives and business requirements documents. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast paced environment, deal well with ambiguity, have technical expertise, and be willing to roll up their sleeves to dig into any project or problem. You must have a deep background in both Product Management and Software/Data Engineering. You are a self-starter, embody a growth mindset, and can collaborate effectively across our entire organization.
Key Responsibilities:
Own and execute the roadmap for your products – communicate both the business value and the technical rationale behind your product decisions.
Seek out and gather our internal stakeholder’s data and analytics needs across the company – translate and synthesize them into actionable products/product requirements.
Develop and execute sourcing strategies by analyzing data, supplier capabilities and business needs, assembling and presenting concise business cases, and oversee the implementation of team decisions.
Maintain laser focus on MVPs, iterative product development, and releasing immediate/tangible value to stakeholders and adjust frequently.
Manage project plans for on-time development and release – ensure that the software/data engineering teams are working on the right things at the right time.
Identify necessary reports, metrics, and analysis to measure the effectiveness and validate the success of completed projects.
Participate in Agile/Scrum teams – assist team in planning and execution of sprints, epic and story backlog refinement, and related operating mechanisms. You will work closely with a team of software/data engineers in the UAE.
Support internal and external audits by ensuring procurement processes were followed, data is recorded accurately, and related documents are stored
Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication - ensure that complex ideas, thoughts, and vision can be communicated simply and effectively. You are expected to thrive in a highly collaborative environment.
Create detailed product specifications to illustrate product functionality including business rules, flows and use cases.
Define and report on SLAs and KPIs
Participate in program oversight for issue and risk assessment; serve as an escalation point for resolving strategic program related issues
Must Have Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience
8+ years of Product Management or technical experience in a fast-paced company that delivers software.
6+ years of CRM experience
Proven track record of driving products from concept to launch and proficient knowledge of product management principles and best practices
Deep understanding of different integrations with CRM vendors
Implementation and deployment experience with Saas based platforms
Experience with performance management – defining and reporting on SLAs and KPIs
Excellent problem-solving skills. Proven ability to deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; think abstractly; learn, adapt and innovate.
Excellent oral and written communication skills. Proven ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical individuals.
Strong organizational and people skills, successful track record of coordinating between multiple project stakeholders, technical program managers, and software development teams.
Proven track record of learning by quick experimentation (and sometimes failure), and then scaling
Strategic vision experience including defining a comprehensive strategy and product road map, and gaining support from partners at all levels
Experience working with multiple cross-functional stakeholders and teams with multiple dependencies and constraints
Ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment
Confident working with GSuite and MS Office
Preferred Qualifications:
MS or MBA
Experience with multiple omnichannel CRM platforms/solutions.
Health Information Technology background
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to come up with creative solutions to ‘impossible-to-solve’ problems
History of developing business strategy in conjunction with senior leadership
Proficient with web services, online technologies, and user interface design
Entrepreneurial spirit with track record for delivering results in fast-moving environments
Understanding of integrations, API’s, transactional systems, and solutions architecture
Broad domain and technical knowledge related to analytics
Experience with Jira, Confluence and LucidCharts
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $150,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance

Day shift
Monday to Friday
Weekends

Bonus pay

Job is currently 100% remote due to Covid-19

omnichannel consumer engagement: 4 years (Required)
startup technology: 4 years (Preferred)

Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction

Title: Senior Product Manager
job description:
Requisition ID
req13991

Working Title
Senior Product Manager

Position Grade
14

Position Summary
The University of New Mexico’s Project ECHO has an amazing opportunity for a Sr. Product Manager to join our team! The selected individual will guide the development of features for a digital global platform to support COVID-19 relief efforts in Africa, SE Asia, and Latin America. You will work closely with our internal teams and global partners to identify successful teleECHO program elements and ultimately maximize the effectiveness of Project ECHO’s digital platform. In this role, Project ECHO will allow you to use your skills and experience to make a significant impact in improving lives around the world.
As a successful Sr. Product Manager, you will play an active role in collaborating with other product owners, UI/UX designers, project managers, and software developers to:
Work closely with various teams including the UI/UX, development, testing, and project management to clarify user needs, acceptance criteria, resolve issues and guide development work
Collaborate with UI/UX lead to create preliminary design concepts and engineering for implementation of the designs and iterates them
Actively participate in sprint planning and review session and daily stand-ups to ensure strategic goals are met and requirements satisfied
Consult with subject matter experts and end users to clarify features and their interoperability with current architecture
Lead workshops with key partners and stakeholders to gather, define, analyze and synthesize business and user needs and translate them into software requirements
Develop requirements in the form of user stories and acceptance criteria based on interviews, surveys, business process descriptions, need priorities, criticality of needed functionalities and workflow analysis
Responsible for communicating rollout plans, change management and training to key stakeholders
Develop overall plan for scoping, development and rollout of the solutions within a specific area and/or cross-functionally
ECHO Digital is a globally federated, multi-lingual platform that will be used by millions of users across the world. Using open APIs, we aim to integrate with government systems and national health registries to create systems change. The platform will enable a wide variety of use cases such as tracking and managing learning sessions and attendances, communicating and sharing between online communities, searching and discovery of experts and resources, and much more.
Project ECHO is a telemedicine and distance-learning program with partners all over the world. Work hours outside of normal business hours may be required. We are fortunate to have access to advanced technology, which will require some teleworking.
Project ECHO prides itself on being a values based organization. Our seven values include: Service to the Underserved, Demonopolize Knowledge, Mutual Trust and Respect, Teamwork, Excellence and Accountability, Innovation and Learning and Joy of Work. We strive to find individuals who can embrace and exemplify these values.
Project ECHO is committed to democratizing medical knowledge and getting best practice care to underserved people all over the world. We are funded in part by grants from the GE Foundation, the Helmsley Charitable Trust, the Bristol Myers Squibb Foundation, the Merck Foundation, Robert Wood and the US Government. We have received support from the NM Legislature and the New Mexico Department of Health.
Project ECHO's goal is to touch the lives of 1 billion people by 2025 and we are looking for mission-driven high performers who share similar values to join our team and help us achieve this goal.

Conditions of Employment

Minimum Qualifications
Successful completion of at least 60 college-level credit hours; at least 7 years of experience directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified.
Completed degree(s) from an accredited institution that are above the minimum education requirement may be substituted for experience on a year for year basis.

Preferred Qualifications
5+ years of experience working in product management, driving product design from ideation/conception stage to successfully launching customer-facing, enterprise and/or technical features and/or products
Comfortable working under ambiguity and using quantitative and/or qualitative information in decision making processes
Experience working cross-functionally with business/operations and/or technical (UX, software developers) stakeholders to foster collaboration and drive consensus among stakeholders.

Title: IT Product Owner
job description:
Hi,
We are looking for IT Product Owner position located at San Francisco, CA
This Position is W2 contract NO Vendor Please
Job Title: Product Owner
Location: San Francisco, CA
Duration: 1 year
Remote until SIP otherwise SFO
IMPORTANT TAKEAWAYS from my intake session with HM:
1) We are looking for A TRUE IT -PRODUCT OWNER. not just a business product owner but someone who is more technical that can own the product and deliver the technical solutions.
2) TOP 3 skills:
- Operational Data product experience (ie a data product that includes functionality and workflows that drive decision making and action) with high desire for experience on Palantir Foundry - experience with a similar tool or any related DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM or DISTRIBUTION MANAGEMENT SYSTEM or ELECTRIC MANAGEMENT SYSTEM or ENERGY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.
- Experience as a Product Owner in an Agile environment
- A proven desire to learn: this was stressed out by the HM. Someone who is highly inquisitive. hungry to learn, smart and humble.
3) The product is already built and now they are working on version 2.0. The product that they support is for PSPS (public safety power shutoffs) - emergency services during shutoff, mapping data that comes in and out of the website, database integration (e.g. California Emergency Services: to use during PSPS to get info who is shutting off, where is the shut off, status, customers affected, etc.)
Minimum Education/Skills:
Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science in related field or equivalent work experience
7+ years of related work experience
Experience as a team member or Product Owner of an agile development team
3+ years of experience working with Palantir Foundry or other big data analytics solutions
Desired Education / Skills:
5+ years of experience working as a Product Owner in an agile environment

Position Summary
The University of New Mexico’s Project ECHO has an exciting opportunity for you to join our global mission as a Business Analyst! If you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, with an organization that is making a change across the world, this is a great opportunity for you! You will work closely with our internal teams and global partners to identify the core of what makes teleECHO programs successful and translate this into functional requirements for the platform.
As a successful Business Analyst, you will collaborate with other product owners, UI/UX designers, product managers, and software developers to design services for our global users. You will play a critical role in:
Resolving issues and guiding development work on a daily basis. Working with the UI/UX, development, testing and project management teams to clarify user needs and acceptance criteria
Collaborating with UI/UX lead to create preliminary design concepts and engineering to implement the designs and iterate them
Leading workshops with key partners and stakeholders to gather, define, analyze and synthesize business and user needs and translate them into software requirements
Consulting with subject matter experts and end users to clarify features and their interoperability with current architecture
Synthesizing requirements gathered from multiple sources and document them in Jira and Confluence and support documentation with use cases, diagrams and workflows
Developing a plan for scoping, development and rollout of the solutions
Leading user testing and feedback gathering sessions to ensure that requirements are satisfied
Communicating with key stakeholders the rollout plans, change management and training
Project ECHO is a tele-mentoring and distance-learning program with partners all over the world. Work hours outside of normal business hours may be required. We are fortunate to have access to advanced technology, which will require some teleworking.
Project ECHO prides itself on being a values-based organization. Our seven values include: Service to the Underserved, Demonopolize Knowledge, Mutual Trust and Respect, Teamwork, Excellence and Accountability, Innovation and Learning and Joy of Work. We strive to find individuals who can embrace and exemplify these values.
We are funded in part by grants from the GE Foundation, the Helmsley Charitable Trust, the Bristol Myers Squibb Foundation, the Merck Foundation, and the US Government and has received support from the NM Legislature, the University of New Mexico, and the New Mexico Department of Health.
Project ECHO is growing exponentially, serving communities across the globe. By joining our team, you will be part of a movement that is leading the way in technology-based healthcare initiatives. Join our team and be a part of our goal to touch the lives of 1 billion people by 2025!

Title: Salesforce Product Owner
job description:
The Salesforce Product Owner position performs advanced (senior-level) business analysis work in support of the Texas Health Trace application on Health and Human Service Commission's (HHSC) Salesforce platform. This role works closely with business owners through the product planning, requirements definition, and delivery of cycles for Salesforce solutions and web-based enterprise-wide usage. The Product Owner is the bridge between the customer and the development team. Assists in the analysis of complex technical and business processes, identifying efficiencies and helping to prioritize needs. Coordinates the gathering, development, and documentation of all requirements. The Product Owner works in partnership with Information Technology (IT) and subject matter experts, helping customers realize business value.

This position works under limited supervision, with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment and is responsible for the creation and validation of system testing. The Salesforce Product Owner reports to the Manager of Product Management within HHSC Information Technology (IT) Administrative Applications department.

This position is for U.S. Citizens or residents only.


Essential Job Functions:
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.

Develops new features and maintains Salesforce application functionality, including Web Interfaces, Service-level integration, integration with other technologies and tools and deployment, as documented in a User Story. (30%)

Adherence to development team’s definition of done which includes technical documentation, unit testing, automated testing and user acceptance. (20%)

Provide technical input, analysis and design of Salesforce application functionality, including Web Interfaces, Service-level integration, integration with other technologies and tools and deployment, as documented in a User Story. (20%)

Provide technical oversight and mentorship to junior team-members. (20%)

Participates in Agile ceremonies as well as other required internal Agency meetings. Completes other job duties as required. (10%)


Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of laws, rules, and regulations relevant to IT in Texas.
Knowledge designing solutions in Salesforce, including capturing program area requirements, and design sessions to develop solution and implement in quick cycles.
Knowledge in developing Salesforce applications, including setting up governance, best practices, standards, change management processes, and incident management processes.
Knowledge in implementing Salesforce configuration changes, using development and testing environments for effective change management.
Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies.
Knowledge of applications development, data, security virtualization and prioritization.
Skill in defining end user stories including acceptance criteria as well as the definition of done.
Skill in using a PC and the following Microsoft software: Excel, Visio, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access, Word, and Project.
Skill in problem-solving, conflict resolution, and negotiation.
Skill in working collaboratively and cooperatively with colleagues, including building consensus.
Skill in breaking down tasks into sub-tasks and estimating required effort.
Ability to guide technology decisions relative to the Salesforce architecture and serve as subject matter expert and design resource to others.
Ability to implement and support large scale technically complex solutions and integration of Salesforce with other systems including, but not limited to, O365, SharePoint, PeopleSoft, and the IBM Identity Management software suite.
Ability to work independently and deliver results in an environment of broad, consultative management.
Ability to plan, organize, schedule, assign, and monitor completion of assigned initiatives.
Ability to present information to a variety of audiences, verbally and in writing, and to communicate clearly, concisely, and effectively.
Ability to adapt to change or modify behavior in response to changes in situations or priorities.

Registration or Licensure Requirements:


Initial Selection Criteria:
Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major coursework in business or a related field. Appropriate experience may be substituted for the required education on a year-for-year basis.

Minimum of 8 (eight) years of experience working on complex enterprise wide applications.
Minimum of 8 (eight) years of experience in an analysis role that required complex problem solving.
Minimum of 5 (five) years of Agile (both Scrum and Kanban).
Minimum of 5 (five) years of experience writing epics and user stories including acceptance criteria and the definition of done.
Minimum of 3 (three) years of experience with the Salesforce product.
Minimum of 3 (three) years of experience with Jira including administration.
Minimum of 1 (one) year of experience with deployment automation and CI/CD pipelines.
Experience with being a Product Owner for multiple Scrum teams.
Preferred experience in Database/Analytics Systems development and deployment experience, as well as front-end visualization.


Additional Information:
REQ #469130

This position is for U.S. Citizens or residents only.

MOS Code:
There are no direct military occupation(s) that relate to the responsibilities, and registration or licensure requirements for this position. All active duty, reservists, guardsmen, and veterans are encouraged to apply if they meet the qualifications for this position.

Title: Product Program and Retail Manager
job description:
About Us:
For over 100 years, we have helped girls develop the skills and confidence they need to blossom into their best selves. From our earliest badges in electricity, aeronautics, and natural sciences to today’s all girl robotics teams and cookie entrepreneurs, girls have challenged themselves through our skill-building opportunities, worked with inspiring role models and developed lifelong friendships.
The Product Program and Retail Manager works with staff and volunteers to ensure the success of the Girl Scouts of Alaska Cookie Program, Nut & Candy Program, the retail shop at the council office and all mobile pop-up stores. They oversee all aspects of the two annual product programs and all retail operations including supervision of the council store cashier. In conjunction with the product programs this position is also responsible for maintenance of Troop Bank Accounts.
You Are:
Committed to the policies and mission of the Girl Scout organization and willing to become a Girl Scout member.
Customer service oriented and able to work effectively with diverse populations.
A team player and able to work in a fast-paced, professional environment. Also able to multi-task and adjust to changing priorities.
A self-starter, seeking opportunities to support all departments.
Highly organized, dependable, and creative.
Able to work without taking leave during cookie season—possible nights and weekends during those months (January-April).
Able to lift and carry at least 35 lbs.
You Need:
2-4 years of marketing and/or sales management experience preferred.
Experience in budget management and volunteer management preferred.
Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively with diverse populations.
Proven ability to keep accurate and meticulous records, manage time effectively, work independently, and handle several projects at the same time.
Strong computer and technology skills. Must be proficient in Microsoft Office applications and also be adept at learning new, proprietary computer programs.
Girl Scouts of Alaska is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Agile Product Owner
job description:
Top skills/traits:
1. Certified Agile Product Owner
2. 3yrs experience
3. Jira Software Experience
4. Software Development experience (familiar with software development life cycle)
Essential Duties/Principal Responsibilities:
Leads the translation of software features into technical requirements (Features) and follow Agile Scrum based Software development.
Ensures there is ample room for the development team to do their work as their input is valued by the development team by creating and maintaining an appropriately prioritized backlog of user stories for implementation
Understands and coordinates feature backlog for all releases for the platform ?—? and their dependencies on each other.
Is well aware and able to articulate the phases of development of a product or feature
Collaborates with product architects and product management teams to translate business requirements into user stories for the development teams to implement

Be present in daily scrum, and retrospective meetings, apart from required presence in sprint planning and review meetings.
Define software release plan and scope with Solution leaders. Inspire and motivate the development teams to deliver innovative and exciting solutions with an appropriate sense of urgency
Act as an ambassador for the product internally and externally, and as the primary technical contact for queries related to the product

Proven track record of managing successful product launches throughout its lifecycle
Agile Methodology software development experience required

Able to conduct interviews and gather various stakeholder feedback to determine most appropriate feature to add to a new or existing product

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Skilled at working collaboratively and effectively with cross functional teams in a matrix organization
Strong problem solving skills
High degree of confidence and experienced presenter

Title: Product Manager
job description:
LOCATION: Remote – US Based APPROVED BY: Human Resources
CLASSIFICATION: Exempt APPROVED BY DATE: 9/1/2019
EMPLOYEE TYPE: Full-time
REPORTS TO: Vice President, Product & Implementation
SUMMARY
Responsible for coordinating people and processes to ensure iWorkGlobal’s projects are delivered on time and produce the desired results. Will define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements and conduct quality assurance of iWorkGlobal’s technology products and features.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
The following reflects management’s definition of essential functions for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Management may assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons.
PROJECT MANAGEMENT
Apply project management methodologies and tools in software development life-cycles to effectively reflect business models’ and requirements’ goals as well as implementation of software technology and services.
Develop detailed project plans that can be effectively tracked and reported.
Manage changes to projects’ scope, timelines, resources, and budget while keeping business objectives in mind.
Analyze reports and serve as a liaison between management and technical and service teams.
Functions as main channel of communication with team members, internal and external customers, and client representatives to review timelines, resource requirements, application requirements, and tasks; meets face to face with clients as needed using own judgement and subject matter expert skills and offers and implements solutions.
Train internal and external users on software as needed.
Measure project performance and perform risk management to identify project risks and issues, using appropriate tools and techniques, and creates and implements a resolution plan to correct and keep the project plan on track.
Report on projects’ status and escalate to management as needed.
BUSINESS ANALYTICS
Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements.
Gather and elicit business requirements by interviewing customers, stakeholders, reviewing existing business documentation, and documenting existing processes and systems.
Define reporting and alerting requirements.
Own and develop relationships with partners, clients, vendors, working with them to optimize and enhance our technology and integrations.
Help design, document, and maintain system processes.
Report on common sources of technical issues or questions and make recommendations to the product team.
Communicate key insights and findings to the product team.
Continually evaluate and communicate ways to improve monitoring, discover issues, and deliver better value and service to our team members, clients, partners, and workers.
QUALITY ASSURANCE
Collaborate with technical and product team to develop effective strategies and test plans for product releases.
Execute UAT (User Acceptance Test) cases and analyze results for product releases.
Create UAT logs to document testing results and defects of product releases.
Report bugs and errors for product releases.
Investigate and diagnose quality issues, track down components, and recommend corrective actions.
Verify reports and data to track and flag quality concerns and improvements.
Conduct regression / post-release/ post-implementation testing.
Work with cross-functional teams to ensure quality throughout the software development lifecycle.
Work with organization members to audit, identify quality problems and improve operational processes.
Write, maintain, and disseminate quality manuals, user guides, and other documentation.
Performs other duties as assigned by manager.
QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in project management and business analysis with software development projects in a cross functional environment.
Ability to manage multiple projects/teams simultaneously.
Experience in dealing directly with business stakeholders.
Experience in QA methodology.
Familiarity with Agile frameworks and regression testing is a plus.
Ability to document and troubleshoot errors.
Working knowledge of test management software (e.g. Jira).
Attention to detail.
Analytical mind and problem-solving aptitude.
Strong organizational skills.
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field is preferred.
Proven ability to handle multiple complex and demanding projects and meet deadlines.
Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work constructively within constantly changing priorities with enthusiasm.
Ability to work independently or as part of a team.
Must be a team player with a positive attitude.
Very good verbal and written communication skills.
MS Project and other PM tools skills.
Strong PowerPoint, Word, and Excel skills.
PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to do the following:
Understand and respond to a diverse population.
Coordinate multiple tasks simultaneously.
Collect, interpret, present, and/or analyze complex data and information.
Travel by car, when required.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
This position is a remote position working in a home office environment.
When traveling to client or business meeting locations, can encounter varying work environments and conditions. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, all business travel has been banned until further notice.
iWorkGlobal offers a unique workplace environment backed by years of experience and steady success, but also beginning our projected trajectory of enormous growth. We are always looking for the best of the best professionals to join us on our journey to change the world of work.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $80,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)

Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Life insurance

Referral program
Vision insurance

8 hour shift

Agile Product Development: 3 years (Required)
Business Analyst: 3 years (Required)

Project Management: 3 years (Required)

Title: Sr. Product Manager (Mobile App)
job description:
Job title: Sr. Product Manager (Mobile App)
This is a remote work as long as one can work on PST
Looking for an opportunity to move fast and make a big impact? Our client's app customers are the heart of our client’s digital growth on high impact areas that intersect mobile, omnichannel, e-commerce, advertising and IOT.
You will drive and own setting the vision, strategy and the tactics to promote, sell, fulfill and enhance our client's services to customers for the client's mobile app and will be responsible for measuring the outcomes of this work. These strategies will be key to driving customer relationship for our overall business. You’ll partner closely with various product teams, engineering, business, user experience and other cross functional groups. You’ll envision and build features and experiences for business programs that will increase the value proposition of the app. You’ll need to use data to make data informed decisions to drive and influence the work of your partners.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree
7+ years of product management experience that includes product, execution and go to market strategy
Prior experience as a mobile app product manager
Prior experience managing a P&L—being accountable for every aspect of your business, from strategy to delivery of features that scale, and responsiveness to customer needs.
Deep knowledge of digital channel selling tools (machine learning recommendations, ads, etc.)
Demonstrated ability to communicate, lead, and influence stakeholders in a matrixed organization so they understand and aligned on the product strategy and vision.
Ability to work effectively with business and engineering teams
Strong analytical skills to pull insights from quantitative and qualitative data sets to develop scalable wars to measure success and detect issues before they become risks.
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Technical acumen to partner with engineers and user experience to launch features on mobile apps and websites
Ability to own and deliver against business and financial goals
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
MBA or equivalent experience
Prior experience of acquiring millions of customers for a consumer mobile app
Experience of building digital acquisition, retention and loyalty strategies from the ground up.
Entrepreneurial mindset and outcome focused personality preferred, ability to work in an environment similar to a startup.
5+ years managing an e-commerce business, with specific experience related to marketing and site experience and optimization preferred
10+ years of product management or related experience
5+ years of customer acquisition on digital channels marketing on various channels like app-stores, paid social, paid search, content, organic, referral, email, podcasts

Title: Clinical Senior Product Manager
job description:
For over 25 years, ScienceMedia Inc has been at the forefront of delivering innovative, multimedia learning solutions aimed at improving clinical competency across all functional areas in the world's leading life sciences organizations. ScienceMedia Inc draws on its expert team of clinical writers, instructional designers, and multimedia artists to produce impactful training on the highest risk areas of a clinical trial. SMi TrialÔ mitigates clinical risk and decreases trial cost by optimizing study compliance throughout the lifetime of your clinical trial. SMi Source is a mobile-enabled, cloud-based science education library that provides 16,000+ microlearning topics and 400+ full courses covering a vast catalog of disease and therapeutic areas.
Change the conduct of clinical trials. Join ScienceMedia Inc to lead the expansion of its clinical training product, SMi Trial, which trains site personnel on the protocol with effective multimedia, clinical scenarios, and comprehension measures, resulting in fewer significant protocol deviations, higher quality data, and more evaluable subjects. SMi Trial reduces costs and shortens clinical trials. This leadership role will expand SMi Trial’s features, impact, and proof points so that this approach becomes the new normal in the conduct of clinical trials.
Essential Responsibilities:
· Define multi-year roadmap of SMi Trial based on industry needs and differentiable features. Work with software and content developers to meet roadmap, and communicate with sales, marketing, and clients the value and examples of the features
· Report to CEO who established the first phase of SMi Trial over the past four years
· Support sales meetings and interface directly with customers to communicate product value and understand requirements
· Establish thought leadership in an industry that supports product and can serve as advisors
· Articulate how roadmap translates into market share, differentiation, and specific solutions to industry problems
· Define positioning and messaging. Interface with marketing communications on execution
Required Skills/Experience:
· Must be authorized to work in the United States
· Clinical trial operations: preferably at a large site; alternatively, as CRA, MSL/CTL at a sponsor or CRO
· Product requirements gathering, interpretation, prioritization, and definition
· Strategic partnerships: evaluate potential partners that will expand the effectiveness and/or distribution of SMi Trial
· Public speaking: podium speaker for thought leadership at conferences and webinars
· Network of clinical site personnel that can be used to test and validate ideas
· Strong technical skills to demonstrate product and work with software development team
· Understanding of competitive landscape for clinical trial training and education
Benefits:
Competitive base compensation plus bonus and stock options
PTO & paid holidays
Company assisted medical and dental insurance coverage
401K
Educational Assistance for continuing education
Casual dress code
Teamwork environment
Quarterly social events

Title: Product Manager
job description:
Product Manager
Alltech Automotive LLC., a dynamic global automotive supplier, is seeking a Product Manager to support our Libertyville, IL location. They would have global responsibility for business development, product and process development covering manufacturing and sales on brakes, suspension and steering applications in the Car and Light Commercial Vehicle Industry. Alltech has a global structure covering Sales all over the World as well as Manufacturing facilities in Asia.
Responsibilities include:
Product Manager - oversee market price competitiveness and identify and coordinate the addition of new product categories to our automotive assortment. The applicant will be responsible for developing and executing product strategies, objectives, budgets and promotions for a variety of product lines throughout the product lifecycle.
Key Result Areas:
1. Product Line Development - Develop, forecast, implement and monitor product lines.
2. New Product Launches - Lead cross-functional teams in the development, design, and launch of products.
3. Market Research - Coordinate market and competitive research to identify industry needs.
Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for providing the sales team with technical expertise to enable them to sell our products.
Responsible for reviewing product data to ensure that the team is kept current on new developments regarding the companies and competitors’ products.
Act as point of first reference for all product related enquiries for the Industrial Automotive segment and work collaboratively with the team to address any issues that may arise.
Design market research projects to assess customer attitudes to current product range and new product introductions.
Liaise extensively with purchasing, quality control, engineering, merchandising and other internal departments to assist the team in managing their day-to-day business requirements.
Work closely with management to develop business plans and attainable margins to establish the viability of new product offerings.
Assist in the development and administration of regional product events and promotions.
Assemble and disseminate information to provide ongoing product knowledge to the team.
Attend industry trade shows and conduct market research to find new products.
Follow safety rules, and work in a safe and healthy manner.
Experience in hydraulic systems, brake parts and steering parts preferred.
Sharp, detail oriented, analytical and able to develop and deliver reports to track progress.
Strategize and organize multiple performance marketing efforts and generate performance reports.
Qualifications:
Five years experience in automotive aftermarket industry.
Demonstrated success defining and launching products and programs.
Product development experience strongly preferred.
Technical understanding of automotive products.
Ability to interact and communicate with all levels of the organization.
High level of proficiency in Word, Excel, Windows, and statistical software.
Excellent organization and planning skills – able to meet deadlines in a multi-task environment.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills – experience working with cross-functional teams.
Education:
Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Engineering or Business.
Benefits:
· Compensation and Benefits:
· - Full-time position
- Salary commensurate with experience
- Medical/Dental/Vison
· 401K Profit sharing plan
· Paid Vacation
Equal opportunity!
About Alltech: Alltech Automotive is a leading manufacturer of aftermarket auto parts for the United States and World markets based in Libertyville, IL. We are devoted to delivering high quality products and services to both our trade partners and end consumers. Our goal is to ensure that our customers receive a consistent supply of quality Alltech auto parts at affordable prices. We believe in our products and work continuously to meet our standards of Quality, Consistency and Price. By meeting these standards, we believe that we can make tomorrow better than today for our customers.

Title: Product Manager
job description:
Product Manager
Re-Location: No Relocation. Position can be Remote + In-person in long term as an option
Position Description
Run Across America is looking to hire a Product Manager that is described as ambitious, organized and detail-oriented. As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for creating a product vision gathering customer feedback, managing the roadmap and details of our mobile application, and creating a great customer experience. Day-to-day tasks may include developing a backlog of product features, organizing and prioritizing development sprints/releases and facilitating user feedback sessions and product vision.
Position Requirements
Required skills
Strong written communication skills
Attention to details in design and product experience
Empathy for users
Ability to refine and distill an idea into written word and mockups
2+ years of experience working with small teams and technical talent
Preferred

Run Across America is a social enterprise focused on connecting users across the country through high quality virtual races. We are a tech first team that has built technologies in a multitude of industries and put together virtual events through the use of our mobile application.
As a team, we believe in fast paced and organized development and execution.

COVID-19 is present. There is also potential to work remotely afterwards.
You’ll be working directly with a hands-on management team that has brought software to market, raised multiple rounds of financing, and seen the ups & downs of the startup game.

We are an ambitious, casual team that has fun in the office and builds each other up while working hard & creating useful tools. If you enjoy pushing yourself, collaborating, and seeing your input turn into a usable product, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Product Marketing Manager
job description:
HOURCAR, a Minnesota 501(c)(3) corporation, is the Twin Cities' and Rochester's only non-profit car-sharing provider.
In 2021, HOURCAR will launch the Twin Cities Electric Vehicle Community Mobility Network (https://bit.ly/344ZdFd), a new all-electric one-way carsharing service with a focus on service to low-wealth communities and communities of color.
Supported by a $6.7 million grant from the U.S. Department of Energy, this project represents the largest public/private investment in shared mobility in the United States, and will be the first 100% renewable transportation system in the Western Hemisphere.
HOURCAR seeks an experienced Product Marketing Manager to refine and execute HOURCAR’s go-to-market strategy for this flagship product. The Product Marketing Manager will be responsible for ensuring the product meets member acquisition goals, and will receive additional compensation based on a pre-determined incentive structure for achieving defined growth targets.
Qualified applicants will have demonstrated experience implementing marketing campaigns, with proven outcomes in generating leads and conversions. The Product Marketing Manager will collaborate closely with HOURCAR’s Community Engagement Coordinator and Member Services staff to ensure the product’s marketing and communications strategy aligns with HOURCAR’s values and overall ethos.
Responsibilities:
Marketing campaigns
Plan and implement multi-media marketing campaigns
Direct and manage graphic designers, copywriters, photographers, public relations professionals, and web developers
Direct and manage the design and production of marketing materials (digital, print, video, audio, promotional items, etc.)
Project-manage vendors, budgets, timelines, etc.
Perform market research
Develop and implement promotional campaigns (pricing discounts, special offers, etc.)
Website/App
Maintain and update HOURCAR’s existing Wordpress website (hourcar.org)
Develop and implement app download campaign for launch of HOURCAR’s new technology platform
Solicit bids, select contractor, and oversee development of new website for launch of HOURCAR’s one-way EV carsharing service
Digital Marketing
Develop and implement effective digital marketing campaigns (search, social, content marketing, email marketing, sales promotions, etc.)
Develop communications strategy for current HOURCAR members
Develop and manage marketing funnel for leads and prospective members
Create compelling content for social media
Grow social media audience and engagement through organic and paid content
Earned Media
Reintroduce HOURCAR to the local community in the leadup to the launch of the new electric vehicle service (July 1, 2021) by pitching and placing stories in a diverse range of Twin Cities publications
Identify, retain, and manage a media relations professional as needed to assist with earned media acquisition
Community Outreach/Events
Work closely with the Community Engagement Coordinator to develop and implement marketing campaigns with a focus on communities of color and low-wealth neighborhoods
Work closely with the Community Engagement Coordinator and Member Services staff to plan and execute promotional events that increase HOURCAR’s visibility in these and other communities, including member sign-up drives at community centers
Participate in community events (University of Minnesota Transportation Fair, Open Streets, etc.), organize staff and/or recruit volunteers to assist with tabling
Required Qualifications:
Excellent communication skills
Media planning and buying experience across digital and out-of-home media (radio, streaming and traditional television, podcasts, etc. a plus)
Demonstrated ability to manage projects and oversee outside vendors and consultants
Able to work within a budget
Able to be self-directed, set and keep deadlines, and work independently
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to multi-task
Ability to work with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint) and Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator)
Comfortable in a fast-paced, professional environment
Ability to work both independently and as a part of a team
Work closely with other HOURCAR staff as part of the whole team, including respecting others' identities and using correct pronouns, and respecting everyone's different styles of learning and interacting
Cordiality and respect for diverse audiences at all times, including honoring gender identities and using correct pronouns
Possess a valid driver’s license and a driving record that meets HOUCAR’s membership requirements (https://hourcar.org/membership_qualifications/)
Must have accessible transportation or the ability to use public transportation to travel to off-site meetings and events
Desired Experience:
Experience working in small, resource-constrained organizations, start-ups or non-profits
Digital marketing platforms (Google, Facebook, and Instagram ads)
Email marketing platforms (MailChimp)
Volunteer recruitment and management
Some experience with basic graphic design and web design a plus
Knowledgeable about Twin Cities geography
Multi-modal transportation, including car sharing, transit, walking and biking
Physical Requirements:
Able to sit for sustained periods of time in an indoor setting
Occasionally able to stand for long periods of time (e.g., tabling at events)
Ability to communicate verbally
Frequent use of communication devices including computer and telephone
Able to concentrate, learn and retain knowledge
Ability to lift 35 pounds
Fluent in speaking, reading and writing English
HOURCAR is an affirmative action, equal-opportunity employer. Women and people of color are especially encouraged to apply.

job description:
Scalio is a global digital product agency headquartered in San Francisco with offices in Orange County, Atlanta, and Sydney. Founded in 2011, we design, build and scale high-usability, high-performance custom software for phones, tablets, AR, wearables, connected devices, & emerging technologies.
We're cross-functional technology experts, experienced in building large-scale systems, platforms, and services for leading brands such as Google, Uber, Shell, Yahoo, Monster, Intuitive Surgical, Digg and 23andMe. We’ve partnered with numerous international organizations, think tanks, and NGOs to develop innovative technology for global markets.
We’re passionate technologists who don’t just embrace change, we create it. Over 570 projects shipped and 27 industries later—we’re just getting started.

Title: Product Manager
job description:
Join us in making roads safer by making drivers better!
The Product Manager will help shape the future of CMT's Claims Studio product, used by customers across the world. They will be an evangelist for Claims Studio, promoting it with prospects, customers, and the broader market. In addition, they will help manage the design, prioritization, and roadmap for this product. They will work closely with external customers and partners, as well as internal sales, marketing, program management, and customer success teams to understand business needs and use cases. Also, they will collaborate closely with our engineering team regarding the feature specifications and their development, testing and release. Finally, as the product expert, they will collaborate with our Product Marketing group to promote Claims Studio in the market, as well as support customers/partners with product implementations and go-to-market strategies as part of their Claims offering.

Responsibilities:
Be an evangelist for their product both internally and externally
Own and maintain a product roadmap, including long-term vision, goals and prioritization
Collect and maintain a solid understanding of their product's use cases based on input from customers, prospects, sales, and market analyses
Bring innovative, differentiating product ideas for consideration for the roadmap
Participate on customer and sales meetings to hear and better understand customer needs
Write detailed requirements for features for their product based on use cases and in some cases, create initial wireframes to illustrate them
Create JIRA Epics/Stories for communicating the requirements to engineering
Participate in sprint planning and daily standups
Define metrics for determining success of new features, track these metrics and adjust the roadmap accordingly


Requirements
7+ years of experience as a Product Manager in a B2B environment
Comfort with full-stack technology (mobile, data, cloud, web)
Desire to be hands-on and get things done
Desire to be a team player and work in a collaborative environment
Passionate about new technologies
Ability to quickly get up to speed on new technologies and systems
Excellent communication and writing skills
Bachelor's degree in Engineering or technology-related field
Benefits
Cambridge Mobile Telematics' (CMT) mission is to make the world’s roads and drivers safer. Since its first product launch in 2012 that pioneered mobile usage-based insurance, CMT has become the world’s leading telematics and analytics provider for insurers, rideshares, and fleets. CMT’s DriveWell platform uses mobile sensing and behavioral science to measure driving risk and incentivize safer driving, while its Claims Studio reduces the claims cycle time with real-time crash detection, crash reconstruction, and damage assessment using telematics and artificial intelligence. CMT has over 50 active programs with insurers and other partners, improving safety for millions of drivers every day around the world. Started based on research at MIT and backed by the SoftBank Vision Fund to fuel its rapid growth, CMT is headquartered in Cambridge MA. To learn more, visit www.cmtelematics.com and follow CMT on Twitter @cmtelematics.
Our Benefits Include:
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Retirement Plan (401k match)
Life Insurance (Basic & AD&D)
Unlimited Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Parental Leave
Short Term & Long Term Disability
Work From Home
Flexible Scheduling Options
Stock Option Plan

Title: Product Category Manager
job description:
Category Manager
Who is Gemplers?
We are a Farm and Home business that supports business and consumers across the United States. We carry some of the best brands you know (Carhartt, DeWalt, YETI) and some that you should. We have a proud of history finding commercial grade products and we love serving customers. We believe we are a phenomenal alternative to the big box / conglomerates. Customers can purchase on our website or call and talk to one our friendly midwestern customer service folks. We are very proud of our 81-Year-old heritage and are in midst of an exciting chapter as we are once again family owned and fiercely independent!
Where do we need help?
We’ve come a long way since Bill Gempler started his Monroe, Wisconsin tire business in 1939 making easy mobile repairs for farmers. We now sell over 25K items out of our warehouse in Janesville and have hundreds of thousands of customers who depend on us to deliver the goods. In January of 2019 we opened a small office in Mt Horeb. We are expanding our team and will be adding a Category Manager.
What are we looking for?
High energy person with incredible drive and relentless curiosity focused on how to grow a business. Someone who wants to be a part of creating something special. Well, not to put too fine a point on it, but a Rockstar who wants to be part of making Gemplers the best version of itself every day. No jerks allowed.
The Category Manager has ownership of the strategy and execution of a growing business and is responsible for all aspects of merchandising and inventory management. This role will lead all phases of the product lifecycle within a group of categories, from assortment selection to inventory management
Job Responsibilities:
Partner with the marketing team to develop and execute advertising plans that drive customer engagement and category growth.
Maintain website merchandising to ensure exposure of the most important products and brands.
Develop a strong understanding of competitors and industry insights to maintain competitive positioning in the market.
Hold vendor line reviews to drive constant improvement in product assortment while identifying new opportunities for growth.
Establish, maintain, and grow strong external vendor relationships, including ownership across all supplier negotiations.
Demand forecasting and fulfillment including order creation, replenishment, and inventory strategy within receipt and inventory plans.
Responsible for all critical metrics for a specific group of categories including sales, margin, and inventory.
Core Competencies
Ability to handle and prioritize multiple demands and projects
Experience working with partners from all cross functional areas in a business
Experience working with data mining and reporting tools; including Excel
Inquisitive personality driving the need to know and do further analysis
Self-Driven Motivated Individual
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or related field.
Experience working in merchandising, buying, and/or inventory roles within a retail business.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and strong knowledge of retail math
Ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced work environment while being nimble and open to change.

Title: Product Manager Software Platform
job description:
Technical Product Manager
The Technical Product manager role will be responsible for defining development efforts, making recommendations for improvements and new features, and ensuring superior functionality on high visibility projects. Work is varied, in a fast paced environment. The ideal candidate will join a small agile team in the development of a new web platform that is targeted for launch within an aggressive time-frame. We are looking for an experienced Technical Product manager who has experience with implementing SCRUM best practices and can alternate between big picture thinking and obsessing with the details, identifying risks, and being a true product owner.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
In collaboration with Engineering, define product roadmap, adjust the roadmap as needed based on key metrics, changes in market, and changes in execution resources
Drive on-time development of all roadmap deliverables
Participate in the development of wireframes and mockups of new features, in coordination with our UI/UX designers
Clarify and demonstrate new feature functionality for the software development and client services teams
Help initiate and facilitate participation in Agile software development
Participate in feature testing to verify the functional requirements on features have been met
Lead and manage the full product lifecycle; from requirements definition, to delivery, collaborating with other teams across the company
Perform in-depth market competitive analysis, gather customer insights to develop product and competitive positioning
Build a feedback gathering process that works with other product team members and key stakeholders to collect product feedback from current users, prospective users, and our internal support teams
Perform detailed customer research and synthesize feature recommendations taking into consideration customer and market insights, competitive analysis, technical capability, and internal initiatives/assets
Qualifications:
Ability to work cross-functionally with engineering, design, and management teams to deliver on the product roadmap

Title: Salesforce Product Manager
job description:
We are looking for a self-motived, passionate, collaborative, and detailed-oriented Salesforce Program Manager with a strong business acumen, and excellent problem-solving skills to work directly with various internal customers to understand the customer journey, processes, and the challenges within those processes. The Salesforce Program Manager will be responsible for identifying potential solutions to operational challenges that leverage the capabilities of the Salesforce platform, and then creating and managing a plan to execute those solutions. The successful candidate will have superb communication and project management skills, and will be able to communicate complex analytical results, both written and verbally, in a clear and easy-to-understand way. S/he will deal with highly ambiguous problems, taking full control and responsibility for finding solutions, and will drive towards simple solutions to complex problems.
What You Will Do
Seek out ways to utilize Salesforce to improve processes and productivity, and work with the CRM team to make recommendations to support an organization scaling at a rapid pace
Lead requirements gathering sessions, design prototypes, set expectations with customers/stakeholders, and drive projects to completion
Proactively identify and implement operational improvements, enhancements, and system customizations that meet business requirements
Manage a release process to test, validate and implement new applications/code, and updates to existing applications/code that support key business groups
Work with various functions and end users to identify, document, and communicate standard business processes as they relate to Salesforce
Hands on configuration and data migration experience to execute on projects
Who You Are.
2+ years previous experience implementing and configuring Salesforce.com
Solid understanding of and detailed experience with the Salesforce.com architecture
Strong attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills
Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
In-depth understanding of the capabilities and constraints of the Salesforce CRM application coupled with good understanding of business processes related to Sales, Communities, Support, etc.
Strong business acumen, business analysis, functional experience including requirements gathering, and creating/deploying solutions to end users
Experience working with large data volumes and data migrations across multiple tools and systems.
Experience developing and delivering solutions to real customer problems, preferably with an emphasis on Sales, Customer Service, Operations, and/or Manufacturing issues as a consultant or team leader.
Great To Have
Salesforce Administrator, and/or other relevant Salesforce Certifications
Exposure to Salesforce Sales/Service/Marketing/Health Clouds
Healthcare Industry Experience

job description:
Project Manager, Product Development
Our client, a growing pharmaceutical company, is looking to add a project manager to their team who will specialize in product development(pre-formulation through commercial phase solid oral dose products). Projects may be complex, spanning multiple departments as well as external clients.

Assume the role of client advocate, responsible to ensure projects are delivered on time, on budget, and to the client’s expectations.

Lead cross-functional process development project teams through the product development phases from initial business case development to product launch and commercialization.
Projects could include completely new products, product modifications, line extensions, technology transfer, or product/process scale up activities or facility expansion and upgrade activities, as required.
The PM must work successfully with a diverse group of team members, both employees and clients, and serves as the liaison between clients/customers with respect to projects and related activities.
Develop full project plans, including timeline, critical path assessment, risk assessment, contingency and mitigation planning, communication planning and full scope capture during the project planning phase.
Develop a project budget and initiate project financial tracking. Monitor the project budget and track milestones to enable accurate and appropriate invoicing and revenue recognition. Measure and report cost and schedule performance against objectives.

Experience: Minimum of six (6) years of relevant work experience in scientific or engineering product development and/or project management; Minimum of 4 years of work experience within the pharmaceutical industry; Experience managing multiple projects at various phases of the pharmaceutical development process is highly preferred.

Job Description:
George Consulting is seeking a multi-skilled individual that can help the USMC’s Cloud Broker Navy Commercial Cloud Services – Marine Corps (NCCS-MC) formerly known as the Marine Corps Managed Services Organization (MC MSO)

· Onboard Suppliers
