The Cloud Service Product Manager responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
· Roadmap their Service Offering Sets
o Identify New Services that USMC Needs
o Identify their value(s) and when their time-critical demand signal is
o Triage them for targets of Opportunity
o Obtain Senior Stakeholder (USMC CIO, USMC Acquisition and Policy Executives, and USMC Network Operations Executives) Buy-in
· Onboard Suppliers
o Build relationships with suppliers
o Walk potential suppliers through the vetting and integration process
o Vet how the supplier’s service is being combined with other services to ensure it is deliverable either as complete service packages capable of getting their subscribers their Authority to Operate (ATO) in production, or is part of a package capable of getting its subscribers an ATO
o Explain good fit/bad fit criteria so that Brokerage Application developers can automate the matching of customers to the offering
o Ensure the MSO ordering and Supplier delivery process is as fast as possible, while being trackable and repeatedly executable with little or no error or handshake failures
· Near Term
o Advise USMC on the fit of technologies to their needs

o Get a coordinated roadmap underway
o Onboard new suppliers to the NCCS-MC
o Create momentum for cloud service suppliers to want to be suppliers to Marines through NCCS-MC and to elevate their supplier status / level of integration with NCCS-MC

o Collaborate with other contractor teammates and customers on a daily basis
o Work closely with customers to ensure deliverables meet their expectations and arrive in a timely manner
o Help our brokerage platform developers scope features and processes in Pega and test the solutions they develop
o Attend and actively participate in team meetings

· Able to work closely with customers to ensure deliverables meet their expectations and arrive in a timely manner.

Title: MHP Commercial Product Manager
job description:
Marketing Statement
MetroPlus Health Plan provides the highest quality healthcare services to residents of Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens and Staten Island through a comprehensive list of products, including, but not limited to, New York State Medicaid Managed Care, Medicare, Child Health Plus, Exchange, Partnership in Care, MetroPlus Gold, Essential Plan, etc. As a wholly-owned subsidiary of NYC Health + Hospitals, the largest public health system in the United States, MetroPlus’ network includes over 27,000 primary care providers, specialists and participating clinics. For more than 30 years, MetroPlus has been committed to building strong relationships with its members and providers to enable New Yorkers to live their healthiest life.
Position Overview
Reporting to the Head of Product, the Commercial Product Manager is responsible for the development, implementation & ongoing oversight of all commercial products offered by MetroPlus Health. The Product Manager will support key analytical activities to support the Plan’s strategic position. The Product Manager will be
accountable for & own the full spectrum of product strategy & operations, remaining proactive in identifying opportunities for improvement.
Job Description
Provide oversight of plan & vendor operations as they relate to the commercial lines of business aligning outcomes to strategic goals & requirements.
Develop & track reports to track operational effectiveness.
Provide end-to-end account management support for key groups as needed to ensure products meet the diverse needs of members, and operations support an optimal customer experience.
Partner with operational departments including Claims, Customer Service, Finance, Enrollment, Vendor
Management, & Medical Management to design processes/procedures ensuring effective & efficient operations.
Support key stakeholders in driving initiatives to meet quality & customer satisfaction goals.
Maintain customer focus throughout Plan operations to ensure a seamless & excellent customer experience.
Identify & integrate operational best practices, partnering with key departments to optimize processes across the organization such as benefits administration, marketing & communications, customer experience.
Partner with internal & external stakeholders on key strategic, regulatory, & operational projects.
Partner with New York City Office of Labor Relations, relevant City unions & agencies to fully understand the New York City employee market.
Perform competitive analysis & forecasting to inform product design to achieve optimal positioning & performance, partner with Marketing & communications to develop strategies to achieve goals.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in an appropriate discipline required.
Master’s degree in business, healthcare or public administration strongly preferred.
Minimum 3 years experience at a Health Plan offering commercial insurance in a product management or compliance role.
Strong knowledge & understanding of the health insurance industry including underwriting rules & requirements, rate-setting, Flexible Spending Accounts, Labor Service Agreements, Health Savings Accounts, NYC Employee Assistance Programs, etc.
Ability to communicate & partner effectively with brokers & FMOs.
Thorough knowledge of NYC government agencies & unions.
Experience working in cross-functional teams.
Demonstrated experience developing & implementing sales & marketing strategies.
Demonstrated ability to develop workflows, policies, procedures.
Demonstrated ability to identify opportunities for improvement & implement solutions.
Excellent written & verbal communication skills.
Excellent analytical skills demonstrated by an ability to use actionable data to support decision-making, and to proactively identify opportunities.
Highly collaborative, and demonstrating good judgment in seeking consensus & input from multiple stakeholders to drive decision-making.
Ability to take initiative & think independently
Demonstrate understanding & acceptance of the MetroPlus Mission, Vision, & Values
Professional Competencies
Leadership
Results-driven
Business acumen
Systems orientation
Process improvement
Data-driven decision-making
Customer focus
Written/oral communication
Resourcefulness
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced & constantly evolving

Title: Senior Product Manager
job description:
Who we are:
Homethrive, Inc. is a technology-enabled healthcare services firm led by seasoned industry veterans with prior experience building and running multi-billion-dollar businesses. Homethrive is well-funded by leading healthcare venture capital investors 7Wire Ventures and Pitango Venture Capital.
Today, 40 million family members support aging loved ones who want to live independently at home for as long as possible. Most of these family members work and have children of their own. This creates tremendous pressure on these individuals and significantly impacts their productivity at work -- 20% of employees spend 5+ hours per week supporting aging loved ones.
Homethrive’s mission is to reduce the stress and work on family caregivers and assist their loved ones to thrive independently and with dignity at home by providing each family with supportive technology and their own dedicated social worker who provides ongoing coaching and personal assistance services. Homethrive partners with employers and insurance companies to offer its services to employees and policyholders nationwide.
Senior Product Manager:
Homethrive is looking for an ambitious and emerging senior product manager who wants to accelerate their learning and responsibility and be on the ground floor of a fast-growing business. This role will help establish, articulate, and accomplish our product vision. You will serve as an expert on one or more of Homethrive’s core customer audiences and markets, translating needs into valuable products through thoughtful research and effective cross-functional collaboration. While Homethrive is currently working remotely, this role is based in Northbrook, IL and will report to Leland Brewster, VP of Product and Business Development.
In this role, the Senior Product Manager will be responsible for:
· Immersing yourself in customer needs, the competitive landscape, and our unique business dynamics.
· Leading new product development initiatives from concept to launch, guiding a cross-functional team to meet strategic goals.
· Translating complex problems and projects into user stories and a coherent product backlog, using agile methods.
· Assessing and prioritizing opportunities, setting project milestones, aligning stakeholders, and communicating decisions throughout the company.
· Defining success metrics for new projects and tracking daily metrics for existing products to ensure all are moving towards our defined goals.
· Collaborating deeply with team members in engineering, operations, sales, and marketing, as well as any and all relevant 3rd party partners/resources.
· Continuously proposing new features and iterations aimed at improving engagement metrics.
The ideal candidate would have:
· 5+ years of product management experience on high-scale, direct to consumer digital products.
· A passion for meeting customer needs through data-driven, iterative product development and continuous optimization.
· The ability to manage multiple priorities and drive focused resolution in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
· Experience with native mobile apps and mobile-first development processes.
· The ability to lead and inspire teams to deliver on our goals.
· Excellent communication skills, from strategic vision to specific details of implementation.
· Strong analytical skills; ability to interpret data and trends, diagnose problems, and recommend effective action plans to resolve issues.

Title: Senior Project Manager
job description:

Immediate openings for experienced Project / Program Managers to lead strategic, large and complex projects/programs for ERP upgrade. Will be responsible for:
· Managing project/program team, including other project managers, internal and external resources
· Developing project plans, budgets, scope, timelines, outcomes, and deliverables using enterprise PMO tools and templates

· Conducting analyses to estimate and track project costs and budgets

Defining resource requirements and negotiate availability with resource managers

Establishing, maintaining, and updating project risk log. Resolving project issues and escalate as appropriate
Managing project change control and follow existing policies
Ensuring project-related documentation is accurate and complete
Must Have:
Thorough knowledge of project and program management theories, models, and techniques
Demonstrated success applying project management concepts and techniques across large, mission-critical projects/programs
Strong communication and presentation skills across all levels of the organization

Title: PROJECT MANAGER (NEXT GENERATION WORKFORCE PROGRAMS)
Company: Los Angeles County Metropolitan Transportation Aut...
job description:
Basic Function
To develop, manage, and administer all aspects of a project and ensure that projects are delivered on schedule and within budget. This position will engage with internal and external stakeholders to develop, manage and support the implementation of industry leading workforce development programs in the Next Generation Workforce Programs service area, which includes Transportation Gateway Programs, Veterans Programs, E3 Youth Initiative, SEED LA and Fair Change Programs.
Example Of Duties
Manages various aspects of a project which may include finances, research, design, technical support, schedules, budget compliance, planning, and agency reporting
Oversees the development of project specifications and requirement
Manages a project’s scheduling, prioritization of work, budget development, monitoring, planning, and reporting
Reviews, analyzes, and interprets contract specifications and scope of work documents of a project to ensure conformance with requirements, regulations, codes, policies, procedures and plans
Reviews, analyzes, and monitors actual project performance to ensure conformance with scope, schedule, and budget
Attends progress meetings with members of the project team to report on status
Identifies problems and recommends resolutions to budget, cost, and schedule-related activities
Prepares reports for management Participates in project outreach
Coordinates with various stakeholders
Communicates and implements safety rules, policies, and procedures in support of the agency’s safety vision and goals; and maintains accountability for the safety performance of all subordinate employees
Contributes to ensuring that the Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) policies and programs of Metro are carried out
May be required to perform other related job duties
Requirements For Employment
A combination of education and/or experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the essential functions of the position; Additional experience, as outlined below, may be substituted for required education on a year-for-year basis; A typical combination includes:
Education
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Planning, Public Administration, Political Science or a related field
Experience
Six years of relevant experience or three years of relevant supervisory-level experience in project management, project funding and financing, or project delivery
Certifications/Licenses/Special Requirements
A valid California Class C Driver License or the ability to utilize an alternative method of transportation when needed to carry out job-related essential functions
Preferred Qualifications

Preferred Qualifications (PQs) are used to identify relevant knowledge, skills, and abilities (KSAs) as determined by business necessity. These criteria are considered preferred qualifications and are not intended to serve as minimum requirements for the position. PQs will help support selection decisions throughout the recruitment. In addition, applicants who possess these PQs will not automatically be selected.

The following are the preferred qualifications:
Professional experience collaborating with government and non-governmental organizations, community-based organizations, or faith-based communities to develop quality curricula and learning resources for implementation and facilitation
Professional experience implementing and monitoring workforce development programs for youth, veterans and formally incarcerated populations
Professional experience engaging with internal and external stakeholders to develop workforce development programs impacting youth, veterans and formally incarcerated populations
Professional experience working in a project management function within a Human Capital and Development environment
Professional experience developing and implementing complex workforce development projects from inception through completion
Proficient in Microsoft Office including SharePoint, PowerPoint and other presentation software to facilitate multi-disciplinary work teams, focus groups and working committees
Knowledge:
Theories, principles, and practices of project management
Applicable local, state, and federal laws, rules, and regulations
Contract administration
Applicable business software applications
Local, state, and federal issues, including but not limited to labor, business, and environmental issues

Skills:
Exercising judgment and creativity in making decisions
Interacting professionally with various levels employees and outside representatives
Communicating effectively orally and in writing
Analyzing situations and identifying problems
Preparing comprehensive reports and correspondence
Abilities:
Provide assistance in monitoring multiple projects to ensure compliance with schedule and budget
Understand, interpret, and apply laws, rules, regulations, policies, procedures, contracts, budgets, and labor/management agreements
Recommend action plans, report on progress, review and comment on contract required documents, and respond to requests from executive management
Compile, analyze, and interpret complex data
Negotiate contract terms
Determine strategies to achieve goals
Read, write, speak, and understand English
Selection Procedure
Applicants who best meet job-related qualifications will be invited to participate in the examination process that may consist of any combination of written, performance, or oral appraisal to further evaluate job-related experience, knowledge, skills and abilities.

job description:

Title: Program Operations Specialist
job description:
Job Store Staffing is currently recruiting for a Program Operations Specialist for a non-profit faith-based organization located in the Denver metro, Colorado area. Our client strongly believes in their mission of abolishing all forms of poverty in northeast Denver. They are looking for a Program Operations Specialist that will uphold their core values and feels strongly about following their mission cause not just as a job, but a way to live out your purpose in life. The Program Operations Specialist will be a temporary-to-hire opportunity for the right candidate.
The Program Operations Specialist will be responsible for assisting the Program Director in organizing, coordinating and executing the program operations related to helping program participants, escape financial poverty and become self-sufficient. The Program Operations Specialist is responsible for coordinating the logistics and other activities of our client’s program team.
The Program Operations Specialist is responsible for the coordination and execution of the day-to-day operations including personal and professional development classes, program calendar, event logistics, data management, basic computer maintenance, and a variety of administrative tasks.
Major Areas of Responsibility
· Program Operations
· Event Management
· Data Management
Program Operations Specialist Responsibilities
· Oversee daily operations of program team
· Ensure Leader program compliance by tracking and communicating attendance, tardies,
personal days, etc. with coaches
· Manage program calendar and coordinate with relevant parties to ensure clear
communication of events and activities
· Ensure all program equipment is functioning properly
· Manage system for program supplies
· Coordinate all printing projects for the program including class handbooks and binders
· Create timely and accurate stipend reports
· Track Skill Development enrollment, attendance, financial aid, books, supplies, etc
· Oversee lessons/classes as needed
· Assist Site Ops/Program Director in tracking expense receipts and completing monthly
expense reports
· Assist Program Director in training of program team
Event Management Responsibilities
· Design, plan, coordinate, and lead the execution of logistics, operations, and
communications for Family Gathering food and setup, Ally trainings, Leader/Ally Retreats
and other special events
· Effectively plan and orchestrating 3-4 graduation ceremonies per year, including all
purchasing, designing, and communication to those involved
· Recruit, train and support volunteers to help run program events
· Coordinate closely with the staff team to support community programming, including facility
use and hours
Data Management Responsibilities
· Input data into the existing Salesforce CRM platform to inform the programmatic and
operational decision-making process
· Create and enforce policies for effective data management
· Support other program team members in the daily use of Salesforce and ensure adequacy,
accuracy and legitimacy of data
· Assist with reports and data extraction when needed
Qualifications of the Program Operations Specialist
· Bachelor degree plus 1-2 years related experience preferred
· Experienced in small event management (10-200 attendees)
· Strong written and verbal communication skills.
· Detail orientated and organized, must be excellent with follow up and follow through.
· Ability to work in a team environment.
· Ability to problem-solve, multi-task, complete work on time and work independently.
· Ability to become proficient quickly in Google G Suite and other software.
· Deep passion for the our clients faith-based mission and values.
· Employees must provide their own working laptop (PC preferred) and smartphone.
Schedule
· Monday-Friday, 8am-5pm, 40hrs per week
Compensation and Benefits
The Program Operations Specialist will be paid $20-23/hr, upon permanent hire $42,000-$48,000 annually.
· 10 days + most national and Christian holidays + week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.
· 8 sick days
· Health, dental, vision, short- and long-term disability
If you believe you are a qualified candidate please submit your resume online today!

Title: Project Manager
job description:
What does a Project Manager do?
A Project Manager leads a project team within an organization through planning, organizing and controlling a project from start to finish. This position requires the applicant to understand all the skills needed to complete a project and manage staff across departments. They also analyze potential risks, issues or changes that may take place that could impact the project’s timeline and makes changes accordingly.
Over the course of a project, the Project Manager will need to communicate with staff and clients, make decisions and monitor the progress of the project to keep it on schedule. Important duties and responsibilities for a Project Manager include:
A minimum of a bachelor’s degree in either business or management is preferred.
Creating long- and short-term plans, including setting targets for milestones, adhering to deadlines and allocating resources
Delegating tasks on the project to employees best positioned to complete them
Identifying and managing potential risks and liabilities of multiple projects
Assisting in the definition of project scope and goals
Making effective decisions when presented with multiple options for how to progress with the project
Serving as a point of contact for teams when multiple units are assigned to the same project to ensure team actions remain in synergy
Communicating with executives or the board to keep the project aligned with their goals
Performing quality control on the project throughout development to maintain the standards expected
Adjusting schedules and targets on the project as needed
Motivating people involved in the project to complete tasks on time
Here are several other skills and qualifications Project Managers should have:
Leadership qualities, such as motivation techniques and conflict-management
Computer literacy for spreadsheet and word processing software
Time management skills, especially familiarity with calendar management and goal setting
Familiarity with the work being done by each team member
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract
Pay: $28.00 - $49.00 per hour

Monday to Friday

Experience:

20-29
This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:
Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous
People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects

Achievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might fail

Title: Senior / Clinical Project Manager - Ophthalmology
job description:
About Us
At GreenLight Clinical we strongly believe that effective healthcare is enabling. Translating innovative discoveries, through clinical development, into novel and accessible medical therapies is fundamental to achieving better health outcomes for patients. We favour customised strategies, often adopting cutting edge technology-based solutions, and we thoughtfully integrate our capabilities with the existing strengths of our partners to achieve smarter, faster results. We guarantee the highest quality standards in clinical research, conducted within an ethically rigorous framework.
What you’ll deliver
Provide comprehensive project management to ensure the successful completion of assigned clinical research programs and projects.
Well managed and resourced Clinical trials, compliant with protocol, SOP’s, Local Work Instructions (LWI’s) and ICH GCP, delivered on time and in budget
Project progress reports and study budget reports as required by study sponsors
Current, well maintained internal clinical trial files and documents (eTMF)
Facilitation, management and co-ordination of start-up activities including study/site feasibility and selection, ethics submissions, budget negotiations, site initiations and Investigator meetings
Country feasibility studies
Patient recruitment and retention strategies
Development and implementation of standard operating procedures as required;
Participation in meetings as required: project and internal;
Coaching and mentoring for team members during management and execution of projects
About You
In order for you to be considered for this role, you will possess the following role requirements:
Degree in life/clinical science or health-related field
Strong experience in the project management of complex and/or global trials with a Pharmaceutical or CRO background working with multi-centre studies
Deep understanding and comprehensive practical knowledge of ICH-GCP requirements, Local (Australia, Thailand, China, Taiwan, Korea) & international Regulatory Authority Regulations
Experience in all phases of development and international trial coordination
Excellent attention to detail in written and oral communication
Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills and the ability to work individually and part of a close knit team
Proven ability to manage and delivery against contact requirements to budget and agreed timelines.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, in a growing company, contributing as required.
We Offer
The opportunity to be part of a growing organisation that values their staff
The opportunity to see your contribution on a daily basis to our global growth and be a part of this, rather than Pidgeon holed in a large global CRO
A collegial and collaborative working environment
A chance to make a difference and enable effective healthcare for individuals and the communities they live in
CBD office location, flexibility to work from home and excellent salary packages
Would You Like to Know More?
To learn more about GreenLight Clinical, please visit our website http://www.greenlightclinical.com
To obtain a copy of the position description which details more of the role accountabilities, please contact Dean Coleman, Talent Acquisition Manager
About Applying
To apply for this role, please send your application to Dean Coleman
*Applications must specify residency or work visa status, include your CV and a Cover Letter which includes responses to the role requirements (Selection Criteria) detailed above.
Greenlight Clinical is an EEO employer and values diversity. We encourage applications from people of diverse cultures, gender and ages.
The personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. We reserve the right to conduct police checks and other screening procedures prior to employment being confirmed.

Title: Project Manager
job description:
Requisition ID
req13712

Working Title
Project Manager

Position Grade
12

Position Summary
The University of New Mexico’s Project ECHO has an amazing opportunity for an IT Project Manager 1 to join the Project Management Office for the ECHO Nursing Home COVID Action Network project. The project aims to train and support nursing home staff on best practices for protecting patients, staff, and visitors from deadly coronavirus infection and spread. As the IT Project Manager, you will work across multiple teams and internal stakeholders to ensure that the grant deliverables are met using project management methods, tools and best practices.

As a successful IT Project Manager 1, you will have proven experience independently managing well-defined, medium complexity projects and be process- and systems-oriented. You will play an active role working across multiple teams and internal stakeholders and participate by:

Assisting the Program Operations Director by ensuring project teams have the support and resources that they need to achieve the project goals and objectives
Creating and maintaining project and resource plans using tools such as MS Project, Smartsheet, and Teamwork
Leading project planning sessions, status meetings and communicating with teams and stakeholders regularly
Monitoring project progress and adjusting plans or work as required
Assisting with developing data collection processes and systems for data analysis, reporting and visualization of programmatic metrics; uses Excel, business intelligence and data visualization tools, such as Power BI and Tableau
Monitoring project plans and tracking resources against planned work
Providing feedback and risk mitigation plan to stakeholders
Assisting in the planning and implementation of process improvements across the organization to optimize and improve work flows and team processes
Documenting and maintaining team policies and procedures to support team goals and project plans
Maintaining all project documentation including: project requirements, assumptions and issues logs, and project status reports to ensure that deliverables are aligned with the project goals and objectives throughout the project lifecycle
Assisting with implementing change control procedures that include setting up the Change Control Board that reviews and approves change requests and evaluates impacts to deadlines, resources and budgets

Project ECHO is a telemedicine and distance-learning program with partners all over the world. Work hours outside of normal business hours may be required. We are fortunate to have access to advanced technology, which will require some teleworking.
Project ECHO prides itself on being a values based organization. Our seven values include: Service to the Underserved, Demonopolize Knowledge, Mutual Trust and Respect, Teamwork, Excellence and Accountability, Innovation and Learning and Joy of Work. We strive to find individuals who can embrace and exemplify these values.
Project ECHO is committed to democratizing medical knowledge and getting best practice care to underserved people all over the world. We are funded in part by grants from the GE Foundation, the Helmsley Charitable Trust, the Bristol Myers Squibb Foundation, the Merck Foundation, Robert Wood and the US Government. We have received support from the NM Legislature and the New Mexico Department of Health.
Project ECHO's goal is to touch the lives of 1 billion people by 2025 and we are looking for mission-driven high performers who share similar values. Join our team and help us achieve this goal!

See the Position Description for additional information.


Conditions of Employment
Specialty licensure/certification may be required, as specified by the department.
Successful candidate may be subject to a criminal background check prior to starting work.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree; at least 6 months of experience directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified.
Higher education and/or experience that is directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified may be interchangeable on a year for year basis.

Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree; at least 2 years’ experience related to the duties and responsibilities specified
At least 2 years independently managing well-defined, medium complexity projects using standard project management methods, tools and templates; use of Waterfall or Agile methodologies
Experience using a project planning software tool such as Microsoft Projects, Smartsheets, Teamwork
Experience with data collection, analysis and reporting using Excel and business intelligence and data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, etc.

Title: Sr. Project Manager
job description:
Job Description:
Develop, execute and manage the program within the defined scope.
Manage a multitude of interrelated projects within the constraints of human and financial resources and changing priorities to ensure the successful completion of the program.
Partner with business sponsors/key stakeholders to confirm program success criteria.
Responsible for the overall program delivery consisting of large concurrent projects which are managed by multiple project managers. Establish and ensure transparent reporting of program status, issues, risks, and financials.
Key Responsibilities:
Initiate and Plan Program: Works with business and IT management to establish and gain consensus on program goals, objectives, financials and deliverables. Responsible for building the plan and resource needs to accomplish the scope.
Program Control: Assess the degree to which changes to scope, issues and risks will affect the program working with business and IT management and sponsor to gain agreement for resolution. Measure performance to assure the program is progressing as compared to original plan and budget.
Executing and Closing Program: Leads project managers and teams in developing and executing a program plan ensuring that authorized resources are obtained to make certain that all activities are performed. Gather lessons learned and obtain final program approval from sponsor and stakeholders.
Program Communication: Communicate program progress by producing program reports to provide timely and accurate program status and decision support information to project teams, business, and IT management. Makes recommendations based on current program status to resolve issues and manage risks.
Resource and Team Management: Coordinate resources to ensure program and business needs are addressed through proactive priority management with business and IT management. Motivates and mentors project managers across the program's project work streams.
Quality Management: Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and functional policies and procedures.
Decisions: Make decisions that impact program level activities. Influences or has final decision authority for program budget.
Qualifications:
Bachelor degree in Business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
Experience:
At least 3 years of demonstrated experience in managing programs.
At least 9 years experience in project management, business systems analysis, software development or deployment, with a minimum of 6 years experience managing projects.
Minimum 12 years combined experience.
Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Word and Excel skills are required.

Title: Managed Review Project Manager
job description:
Summary
This position will be responsible for managing remote based document review projects for Cobra’s clients. The Review Manager will oversee large teams of attorneys and ensure the quality of those teams' work product. Our Review Managers are expected to manage schedules, scope, cost of a project, interface directly with clients and represent the company in the most professional manner possible by providing consultative support and applying project management strategies to manage cases efficiently and effectively. This position has variable hours and requires an in depth understanding of the litigation life cycle, litigation technology, and electronic discovery.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Manage and monitor teams' progress, provide client-facing reporting, and ensure quality work product from start to finish
Use company’s communication outlets and protocols to train document review teams on the substantive legal issues relevant to each project
Create, refine, and maintain standard review project documentation, including review protocols, status reports, training guides and review workflows
Assist HR personnel in selecting appropriate candidates for projects
Ensure coordination of facility and logistic considerations for each project
Validate review attorneys’ time logging
Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the Duties and Responsibilities above satisfactorily and meet the requirements below. The requirements listed below are representative of the minimum knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Education, Experience and Skills:
Required:
Must be a licensed attorney, in good standing
Demonstrated success with former projects providing references
Able to leverage problem-solving skills to provide analytical solutions to clients
Excellent client relationship, written and communication skills
Can effectively manage multiple fast-moving projects at a given time
Strong interpersonal and organizational skills and able to work well with a team
2+ years minimum of document review management experience at a law firm, in-house legal department or consulting firm
Requires in-depth, hands on experience with server-based databases and other applications such as Relativity or other document review platforms.
Job Type: Contract
Pay: $35.00 - $40.00 per hour
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Experience:
Project Management: 2 years (Preferred)
License/Certification:
Bar License in good standing (Required)
Contract Length:
Varies
Work Location:
Multiple locations
Fully Remote
Company's website:
https://cobralegalsolutions.com/

Title: Senior Medical Equipment Project Manager
job description:
The Facilities Design & Construction mission is the implementation of the Health System’s Capital Improvement Program in keeping with the Long Range Development Plan ( LRDP). This includes the authority and responsibility to manage acute care capital improvement planning, design, and construction projects. This position has the primary responsibility for implementing and achieving the department purpose.
Job Summary
Final Filing Date : 12/1/2020 Interviews may be held at any time
Salary Range : $6,150 -$12,991.67, grade 24
Salary Frequency : Monthly
Appointment Type : Career
Percentage of Time : 1.0
Shift Hour : 08
Location : Facilities Support Srvcs Bldg
City : Sacramento
Union Representation : No
Benefits Eligible : Yes
We offer exceptional employment benefits including medical, dental, and vision plans, generous paid vacations and holidays, excellent retirement savings and investment plans, continuing education, and reduced fee and scholarship programs.
THIS IS NOT AN H1- B OPPORTUNITY
Responsibilities
The Senior Medical Equipment Project Manager (Facilities Project Manager Specialist 4) manages the planning, acquisition and installation of Medical Equipment for capital improvement and expense construction projects of the largest scope and complexity. M anages multiple projects at the same time with equipment budgets that can exceed $10 million dollars individually and $50 million in aggregate. Projects at this level have prominent significance within the campus, require Chancellor budgetary approval and involve complex coordination with client groups and multiple high level design and engineering professionals . The Senior Medical Equipment Project Manager coordinates and directs medical equipment projects from early planning through design and from construction to closeout with minimal supervision by other and is considered the technical leader for the department on medical equipment for our projects. May act as supervisor for lower level Medical Equipment Planners. Acts as a liaison between FD&C and all Customer Departments for Medical Center Hospital and Clinical Operations to ensure the goals of these departments and the specified equipment required to support those goals are carefully considering during the planning, design and construction of projects with a focus on operational efficiency, patient satisfaction and quality of care.
Required Qualifications
Advanced knowledge of the operational needs of Patient Care Services, Nurse Management, Outpatient Clinics, Radiology, Specialty Clinics and related support Staff to provide a work environment that supports the advancement of health care practice and the highest quality of patient care
Minimum of 10 years of experience in healthcare and a detailed understanding of highly technical medical equipment utilized within a hospital or clinical setting and familiarity with Hospital Equipment standards
Ability to write detailed specifications for specialized highly technical and/or customized equipment, and the contractual scope of related service agreements
Ability to read and review construction documents and schedules and work with design professionals and contractors to coordinate deliveries, move in and installation of medical equipment
Ability to gather quotes from vendors and develop medical equipment budgets using vendor contacts and system wide purchasing data bases like Vizient for large and complicated projects with equipment budgets that could exceed $10 million dollars
Experience Supervising others, conducting evaluations, navigating human resources policies and procedures, mentoring others for self-improvement and performance
Thorough knowledge of standard procurement procedures, contract service negotiation and vendors that supply medical equipment and support services
Familiarity with policies and procedures as well as state and federal regulations that impact the procurement process. Familiarity with special Funding Agency requirements that stipulate special procedures for purchases and documentation of those purchases.
Ability to respond to project and program deadlines and emergency situations
Strong analytical and mathematical skills, and ability to conduct complex quantitative and qualitative analyses utilizing spreadsheet tools like Excel. Ability to create professional reports utilizing Excel and Word to communicate with leadership
Capability to prepare and maintain fully documented files which reflect a thorough summary of transactions , deadlines, issues, and decision making which meet with established policies and procedures and University requirements
Valid CA Driver’s License
Special Requirements
Willingness to work occasional non-standard work hours including nights and weekends, as required by project schedules.This position may be subject to a criminal background investigation, drug screen, Live Scan fingerprinting, medical evaluation clearance, and functional capacity assessment.
EEO
The University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer advancing inclusive excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or other protected categories covered by the UC nondiscrimination policy.

Title: Technical Program Manager
job description:
Job Description:
With the news of COVID19 spreading, Aquent is committed to ensuring the safety and well being of our employees. This includes providing technology to support video interviews, resources and support for employees to work from home successfully, and fully covered healthcare for eligible employees. The position is remote until the stay at home order is lifted. Then you must be able to work onsite at the posted location.
Our client, a global consumer technology leader, is looking for an experienced Program Manager who is proficient with Agile environments, testing hardware/software, troubleshooting, and creating documentation for audiences of various technical abilities - specficially on consumer facing tech. This talent needs to have experience with leading projects from lauch through completion, working closely with engineering and product managers.
Overall Responsibilities:
Conceptualize, design, and implement a program which will help in driving the program. Collaborate with Engineering, Product, and UX teams to develop and launch robust, useful features to make the program successful. Troubleshoot issues and create documentation. Test hardware/software solutions and explore issues further.
Top 3 Daily Responsibilities:
Driving Projects towards Launch & Landing
Drive UX and Eng execution of defined projects in flight
Assist with xTeam Coordination, Document Key Decisions, and Drive AIs
Skill/Experience/Education:
Mandatory:
7+ years of work experience in project management roles
Ability to navigate and unblock the teams towards launches, keep track of next steps and document key decisions with strong communication verbal and written skills.
Ability to interact with technical and non-technical groups multifunctional teams (x-Org Engineering teams, Product teams, UX Designers, Analysts, Execs)
Experience in the Tech industry.
Client Description:
One thing we know is that this client, as big as it is, is still setting the standard for not only the product they’re turning out, but for the way they conduct business.
Our client is the global leader in technology, with offices in many major cities. As different as those cities are, you can expect that the personality of each office is the same. Commonalities include bringing people together in the physical work space, outlets for creativity (outside work-related exercises), and a setup for brainstorming on the fly, whenever the opportunity strikes.
What they see in your resume, if you’re selected, is your ability to be an autonomous thinker, and a team player; someone focused, and driven to push the envelope who can also let down their guard and have fun with the team while doing it; someone who has the intellectual capacity to challenge even the most innovative thinkers without the hubris that tends to accompany it. No egos here!
Here, everyone is considered a project owner, and expected to give 100%, even when the path forward isn’t necessarily clear.
Work here, and know you’re working with a Forbes #1 rated company.
Work here, and know you’re setting the pace for digital products globally.
Work here, and find the challenge of your career!
And in case you’re afraid you won’t have time for other things, you’ll be able to take advantage of:
Fitness center access
Discounts on things like dry cleaning and oil changes
Free lunches
Convenient commuter shuttles
Why work with AQUENT? Check out our awesome benefits: https://aquent.com/find-work/talent-benefits
Aquent is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Title: Senior Project Manager
job description:
Requisition ID
req13713

Working Title
Senior Project Manager

Position Grade
13

Position Summary
Do you thrive working in a fast- paced environment with an organization that wants to make a difference in the world? The University of New Mexico’s Project ECHO has an amazing opportunity for you to join our Project Management Office (PMO) as an IT Project Manager 2! You will work with the PMO office for the ECHO Nursing Home COVID Action Network. The project aims to train and support nursing home staff on best practices for protecting patients, staff, and visitors from deadly coronavirus infection and spread.
As a successful IT Project Manager 2, you will have proven experience independently managing well-defined, medium complexity projects and be process- and systems-oriented. You will be a problem solver that uses strong verbal and written communication skills, and has the ability to harmonize multiple inputs and perspectives to create a shared vision for action. You will play an active role in working across multiple teams and internal stakeholders and participating in:
Championing and advocating for the project team members and assisting in the planning and implementation of process improvements across the organization
Developing data collection processes and systems for data analysis, reporting and visualization of programmatic metrics; uses Excel, business intelligence and data visualization tools, such as Power BI and Tableau
Creating and maintaining project and resource plans using tools such as MS Project, Smartsheet, and Teamwork
Providing regular status reports for PMO and key stakeholders
Leading project planning sessions and status meetings
Maintaining up to date project requirements and track requirement changes throughout the project lifecycle
Implementing change control procedures that include setting up the Change Control Board that reviews and approves change requests and evaluates impacts to deadlines, resources and budgets
Working with project teams to ensure that approved changes are communicated and project plans modified as required
Monitoring project plans, tracking resources against planned work and providing feedback and risk mitigation plans to stakeholders
Maintaining all project documentation including: project requirements, assumptions and issues logs, and project status reports to ensure that deliverables are aligned with the project goals and objectives
Consulting and sharing common project artifacts, methods, and templates with project team members for operational efficiencies and effectiveness
Providing data analysis, reporting and visualization of programmatic metrics with project team members; looks for ways to standardize reporting

Project ECHO is a telemedicine and distance-learning program with partners all over the world. Work hours outside of normal business hours may be required. We are fortunate to have access to advanced technology, which will require some teleworking.
Project ECHO prides itself on being a values based organization. Our seven values include: Service to the Underserved, Demonopolize Knowledge, Mutual Trust and Respect, Teamwork, Excellence and Accountability, Innovation and Learning and Joy of Work. We strive to find individuals who can embrace and exemplify these values.
Project ECHO is committed to democratizing medical knowledge and getting best practice care to underserved people all over the world. We are funded in part by grants from the GE Foundation, the Helmsley Charitable Trust, the Bristol Myers Squibb Foundation, the Merck Foundation, Robert Wood and the US Government. We have received support from the NM Legislature and the New Mexico Department of Health.
Project ECHO's goal is to touch the lives of 1 billion people by 2025 and we are looking for mission-driven high performers who share similar values. Join our team and help us achieve this goal!

See the Position Description for additional information.


Conditions of Employment
Specialty licensure/certification may be required, as specified by the department.
Successful candidate may be subject to a criminal background check prior to starting work.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree; at least 1 year of progressively responsible experience directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified.
Higher education and/or experience that is directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified may be interchangeable on a year for year basis.

Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree; at least 3 years’ experience related to the duties and responsibilities specified
At least 3 years independently managing medium- to high-complexity projects using standard project management methods, tools and templates; use of Waterfall or Agile methodologies
Experience using a project planning software tool such as Microsoft Projects, Smartsheets, Teamwork
Experience with data collection, analysis and reporting using Excel and business intelligence and data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, etc.

Additional Requirements

Health Sciences Center (HSC) - Albuquerque, NM

Project ECHO (259B)

In addition, UNM offers educational benefits through the tuition remission and dependent education programs. See the Benefits home page for a more information.

Job Summary
Mesa Community College has been awarded a Title V Developing Hispanic-Serving Institutions (DHSI) grant for a 5-year period. The Students & Employees Nurtured & Developed for Academic Success (SENDAS) Project aims to enhance and integrate student support; create a robust professional development program for faculty and staff; and develop a more inclusive hiring process. This grant-funded position of Project Manager will broadly be responsible for: grant project planning, program leadership, appropriate implementation of grant activities, compliance with all Federal and MCCCD grant policies and procedures, monitoring progress toward grant goals and objectives, required performance reporting and evaluation, and effective management and utilization of resources.
At MCC, the experiences, perspectives, and contributions of all people are honored. Diversity, equity, and inclusion work is a core value of the institution. We value the contributions of each person and respect the profound ways their identity, culture, background, experience, status, abilities, and opinions enrich the college community. We continuously adapt and respond to differences with a single focus - to create a welcoming, safe, equitable and inclusive environment that ensures all students and employees have the support and knowledge to succeed and thrive. MCC is committed to building a workplace that reflects our community and student population. Our goal is that our students and employees have the knowledge and skills necessary to excel, lead, navigate, and thrive in a diverse world. We encourage you to consider joining us.
Demonstrates a commitment to service excellence, innovation, student success, integrity, and diversity in the performance of job duties. See https://www.mesacc.edu/human-resources/working-mcc/diversity-equity-inclusion.

30% Assists in developing overall project scope including the identification and establishment of project objectives, milestones, schedule and overall plan
30% Plans, implements, and coordinates activities and timelines for grant projects and objectives; assists in preparing, disseminating and communicating project-related information including, researching information and developing workshops, presentations and communication materials related to the grant.
25% Creates and maintains comprehensive project documentation including, monitoring assigned grant budgets and related expenditures, and assisting in preparing required monitoring reports

OR
Associate’s Degree from a regionally accredited institution in education, business or public administration and of four years of full-time equivalent experience providing journey level project management coordination and assistance including preparing reports, maintaining records, tracking budgets, performing research and assisting with project communication.\
OR
High School Diploma/GED and six years of full-time equivalent experience providing journey level project management coordination and assistance including preparing reports, maintaining records, tracking budgets, performing research and assisting with project communication.

Experience in gathering and analyzing data to inform programmatic outcomes
Experience conducting formative and summative evaluations
Knowledge of and experience with internal and external institutional collaboration, shared governance, instruction, and/or training
Knowledge of and experience with strategic enrollment management, student support services, academic advisement, university transfer, and/or financial literacy

Work is routinely performed in an indoor, office environment.
May require weekend/evening hours and travel.

Additional materials will not be accepted after the job posting has closed.
Missing materials or incomplete employment history will not be considered.

Three professional references, preferably current and/or former supervisors. If references are not provided in resume upon application, they will be requested at time of interview.

Applicants who currently work for any of the MCCCD campuses/locations should utilize their HCM Employee Self Service page to apply for jobs by logging in to HCM and clicking on NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Recruiting > Careers. Use the following link for instructions on how to apply: https://maricopa.learn.taleo.net/files/upload/tts/hcm/Employee_Self-Service/InternalApplicantQRG.pdf

EEO Information
Maricopa County Community College District (MCCCD) will not discriminate, nor tolerate discrimination in employment or education, against any applicant, employee, or student because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status (including document abuse), age, disability, veteran status or genetic information.
Title IX
Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, states: "No person in the United States shall, on the basis of sex, be excluded from participation in, be denied the benefits of, or be subjected to discrimination under any education program or activity receiving Federal financial assistance."
The policy of the MCCCD is to provide an educational, employment, and business environment free of gender discrimination. Incidents of misconduct should be reported to the college Title IX Coordinator, as outlined in policy, contact information is available at this link Title IX Coordinators.
Clery Act
The Clery Act is a Federal law requiring United States Colleges and Universities to disclose information about crime on and around their campuses. Crime reporting data for each of the Maricopa Community Colleges, as required under the Clery Act, is available at this link Clery Act

Title: Project Manager Sr.
Location: Colorado Springs, CO 80919 (Northwest Colorado Springs area)
job description:
Position Description:
The Senior Project Manager acts as liaison between Ent business units and the Information Technology (IT) department. This person is responsible for providing business analysis and project management support on an as-needed basis, leading the management of the project lifecycle development process from project initiation to implementation. The Senior Project Manager is also responsible for software testing and quality assurance activities related to the projects and work assigned to him/her. The Senior Project Manager assists with running the IT Change Management process; and assists with maintaining Business Support processes and procedures.
The Senior Project Manager works independently on a variety of projects, and demonstrates positive leadership skills. The Senior Project Manager has in-depth experience with and knowledge of Ent’s business units and the software systems that support business and member requirements. The Senior Project Manager is expected to have the technical and business knowledge to identify and document functional solutions to complex requirements.
Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Provide leadership in project management for projects and complex help desk requests at the request of business units or IT. Ensure project management life cycle is followed.
Provide business analysis support to facilitate process re-engineering, create process diagrams and ensure definition of project scope and requirements.
Drive and recommend improvements to Business Support Process and Procedures. Oversee creation of new documents and updates to existing documents.
Administrative duties / other duties as assigned: testing, attending seminars and classes; providing written status reports as required; attending staff meetings as required.
Minimum Formal Education Required for this Position:
Knowledge consistent with a Bachelor’s Degree in Project Management, Business Administration, Finance, or similar related field
Minimum work experience:
6+ years’ of applicable work experience related to project management
(Preferred) 4+ years’ experience with project management in a financial institution setting using Scrum methodologies
Technical or specialized knowledge/skills:
Demonstrated in-depth knowledge of financial business and functions.
Demonstrated expertise in project management techniques, processes, methodology.
Demonstrated expertise in business analysis techniques: process definition, cost/benefit analysis, proposal preparation.
Demonstrated expertise in document preparation.
Knowledge and demonstrated proficiency in use of process flow methodology and tools (MicroGraphics, Flow Charter, Visio).
Knowledge and demonstrated proficiency in use of project management tools (MS Project).
Knowledge and demonstrated proficiency in use of MS Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, Powerpoint).
(Preferred) Proficient with Symitar.
Certifications required:
Driver’s license with an acceptable driving record.
(Preferred) Scrum Master.
(Preferred) PMP/PMI-Agile.
(Preferred) Industry certifications in QA/Testing.
Environmental, physical and psychological requirements:
Must be able to sit or stand for prolonged periods of time in a climate controlled environment. Must be able to use fingers, hands, wrists for repetitive tasks such as typing, using a mouse, handling paper, and operating a telephone. Demands for visual and auditory acuity are typical of an office environment. Must be able to interact via email, telephone, or in person with diplomacy, tact, and courtesy with all members under varying circumstances. Must be able to lift up to 40 lbs. May be required to drive to off-site locations for visual inspection of project progress.
Starting salary is at $68,182.40+
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Title: Project Manager
job description:
Company Background
Infinity BiologiX (IBX) is a Next Generation Central Lab providing a range of laboratory and scientific services including biobanking, sample bioprocessing, genomic analysis, Next Generation Sequencing (NGS), study design, and kit design and manufacture to our customers. We work with clients across a wide range of Life Sciences Industries, including Government funded research, Biotech and large Pharma, Consumer Genomics, and academic institutions.
IBX, backed by Private Equity funding, acquired the business, assets and operating framework previously operating as a commercial entity within a major US research university. Since 1999, IBX has been at the forefront in advancing the science of biobanking, bioprocessing, and analytics. By utilizing a technologically advanced infrastructure and the highest quality biomaterials, our scientists work to convert precious biosamples into renewable resources thereby extending research capabilities. We understand that research goals and objectives vary from project to project so we strive to give every client individual and customized attention to ensure “best fit” service.
Position Summary
A project manager overseeing and managing projects at IBX is critical to the function and success of the organization. Oversees multiple projects for key IBX accounts from project initiation through final deliverables. Communicates with peers, lab managers, IBX Directors, and clients in reviewing project status, performance, and issue resolution on an ongoing basis and is involved in strategic planning and implementation to achieve project/program goals. A qualified candidate will be capable of working independently to ensure projects are completed within scope, deadline, and budget and will serve as a liaison between the service laboratory and the client.
This position requires a bachelor’s degree in life sciences. A minimum of two years of practical bench experience in an advanced laboratory operation setting is required. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and computer literacy are required. Demonstrated project management experience is highly desirable, preferably within an industry/service laboratory setting.
Project Management – Responsible for the day to day management of IBX grants, contracts and service agreements from an operational framework. This includes the scheduling and coordination with technical staff across IBX units and training for project specific tasks. Oversight of responsibilities for individual lab units as it pertains to project goals and timelines.
Lab Management Support – Responsible for providing support to lab units in a dynamic capacity given project deadlines. Assists management and directors in preparation of contract and grant proposals, progress reports, and developing budgeting and cost allocation information. Attends weekly and periodic management meetings (IBX unit meetings, Supervisors meetings, Project Management meetings) to discuss overall operational, management, and strategic planning that affects IBX center operations.
Data Analysis and Reporting – Responsible for data analysis and reporting of projects under direct management in this position. Requires communication with IBX senior management and Project Management Director to ensure that deadlines and grant/contract goals are met.
Quality Assurance and Key Performance Indicator (KPI) Tracking – In conjunction with the Quality Assurance department, responsible for reporting, tracking, and closing quality excursions. Responsible for determining, tracking, and reporting key performance indicators and overall project performance metrics.
The individual may encounter sophisticated analytical problems and technical challenges. These problems can be solved through systematic optimization of standard molecular biology protocols and by investigating new technology solutions. The individual may encounter application-specific problems when designing and executing experiments. These problems can be solved by working with experienced members and subject matter experts of the IBX.

Title: Program Manager with Bonus!
job description:
We are seeking a Program Manager to support a long-term contract at West Point Academy.
This is a long-term contract - (1) Base Year and (4) option years. Pay: $115,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year
In addition to a competitive salary a retention and performance bonus of up to $20,000 will be paid out throughout your first year of employment.
The Program Manager responsibilities include leading and mentoring our existing Network Support team in deployments, configuration, designs and supporting daily operations in addition to acting as a Subject Matter Expert in Network Engineering functions. This individual will also serve as the Government's point of contact and provide technical supervision and guidance for all Contractor personnel assigned to the contract.
The program/operations manager shall have experience in the following management and technical areas:
Professional level of networking certification or equivalent work experience (e.g., Cisco Certified Network Professional) is preferred as is a PMO or relevant work experience.
Demonstrated excellence in planning, directing, and managing complex IT projects and operations of a nature similar in size and scope as referenced under the PWS.
Working knowledge and experience administering and managing multiple IT tasks and substantial IT projects similar in size and scope.
Successful management and supervision of employees of various labor categories and skills in projects similar in size and scope as referenced under this PWS.
In-depth knowledge of network design and operations for heterogenous wired and wireless enclaves with multiple security zones and data sensitivity.
Technical and management leadership of task compliance with industry-accepted Government and civilian and user standards.
Knowledge of configuration management and quality assurance concepts and guidelines for example, Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL), Institute of Electrical, and Electronic Engineers (IEEE), and Software Engineering Institute (SEI) Capability Maturity Model Integration (CMMI), Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK).
Knowledge of NIST Special Publication 800-53.
Knowledge of DoD Risk Management Framework (e.g., DoD Instruction 8510.01) is preferred.
Knowledge of overall DoD contracts administration.

Oneida Technical Solutions (OTS) is a tribally-owned 8(a) certified IT Network and Telecommunications Services company, wholly owned and operated by the Oneida Nation of New York through Oneida Nation Enterprises, LLC. Headquartered in Oneida, New York, OTS is the direct parent company of Croop-LaFrance, Inc.
We offer medical, dental, vision, and prescription coverage options as well as paid time off and a generous 401K (with company matching after the first year). This role is also eligible for an annual bonus structure based on overall contract and individual performance.
Oneida Technical Solutions, LLC. is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.

Title: UTS-Temporary Project Manager
Company: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
job description:
Position Type
Temporary Staff (SHRA)

Job Title
UTS-Temporary Project Manager

Department Name
HR UTS Partnership

Vacancy ID
S017085

Position Posting Category
Research Professionals

Hiring Range
$17.00-$19.00 per hour

Full-time/Part-time
Full-Time Temporary

If part-time, how many hours per week?

Work Schedule
M-F 40 hours per week


Proposed Start Date

Estimated Duration of Appointment
6 months not to exceed 11 months

Posting Open Date
11/10/2020

Posting Close Date
11/21/2020

Description of Work
The unit has experienced a large increase in demand for services related to COVID research sample processing, and this position will help the Core increase capacity to maintain and shorten turnaround for research samples. The shortened turnaround is critical due to the nature of the projects. The unit’s research, quick turn-around time is needed to assist in contact-tracing, drug efficacy in patients, and tracking viral mutations within the population. In addition, the unit is also tasked with assisting researchers with projects designated mission critical by the Vice Chancellor for Research, and this position will also assist processing samples for those critical projects.
This growth and the sudden resignation of a current project manager is requiring us to see new staff. The candidate will be the project manager and primary contact for all external contracts and Lineberger Cancer Center Studies entering the facility. He/she will collaborate on experimental design, implementation, and new methods development with the associated Principal Investigator and leadership/staff. The selected candidate will be responsible for coordinating data processing and management for these projects. This individual will provide input into strategic planning of sample processing and protocol development.
The Associate Project Manager will be responsible for ensuring that:
(1) All study concerns are addressed
(2) Sample processing moves efficiently through the unit and all deadlines are met for the final data delivery. They will act the key contact person for processing group concerns
(3) Managing databases that record the scope of work (sample shipment and arrival/sample processing history/sample storage/ Sample returns to the study/ resubmissions as required and data delivery)
(4) Samples received from the studies meet the standard to move forward with processing
(5) Libraries from the library preparation division meet the unit’s quality needs for sequencing
(6) Sequencing data aligns with expected required results as agreed upon prior to the onset of the study
When deficient, the individual will conduct troubleshooting to determine the issues and the possible resolutions. This will include running scientific assays
(1) for sample and product quality assessment (such as but exclusive to: Lapchip/ Tapestation/ Pico green assays)
(2) data analysis ( preset and custom data analysis pipelines)
It is the responsibility of the individual to assist with the TracSeq database development on behalf of the study: shipment, submission and drop off check in, confirm completion of submitted work. This may include updates. But more often, it will be the development of entirely new features/ tracking /interactive screens for staff to meet new technologies as they become necessary. New technologies are introduced on a regular basis. It is the goal to offer studies cutting edge technologies to better answer the study needs. Initially, as pilots for proof of theory and then to adopt as standard processing pipeline for studies. This will require working closely with leadership. Monthly / weekly reports will need to be generated for projects as preset prior to the initiation of the study and will be made available a prescheduled bi weekly or monthly study update meetings. Additional reports will be generated for the staff as demanded for the efficient processing of materials. As part of the reporting aspect, the individual will need to run data analyses on the library preparation, library QAQC, sequencing data/ QAQC to confirm that agreed standards are met for the study. This was noted above in greater detail. When standards are not met, issue will need to be brought to the leadership attention, resolutions determined and confirmed with the study as deemed necessary


Education and Experience
4 year degree


Special Physical and Mental Requirements

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, race, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or status as a protected veteran.
