Title: Library PMO Project Delivery Manager
job description:
Current employees: Please apply through the employee portal to be considered for this opportunity.
Pay Range:
$77,458.20 - $116,186.30 Annual
Department:
Department of County Assets (DCA)
Job Type:
Regular Non-Represented
Exemption Status:
United States of America (Exempt)
Closing Date (Open Until Filled if No Date Specified):
November 24, 2020

The Opportunity:
Overview
This work matters...
Do you pride yourself on being "in the know" of overseeing client construction projects, meeting deadlines on time and having exceptional customer service? Well look no further, we have the job for you.
Multnomah County is looking for a Library Project Delivery Manager who oversees all aspects of the construction portion of the Multnomah Library Bond Program, working closely with the Library PMO and it’s governance structure, establishing project management best practices for the bond program. This position requires the promotion of a collaborative approach to project delivery and conflict resolution and the expertise to provide high-level oversight of the design and construction of new commercial building construction projects, with accountability for budget, schedule, scope, and risk mitigation.
Essential Job Functions:
Project Management Team Performance and Oversight:
Supervise, plan and organize the work of the Library Bond PMO Construction Project Managers to deliver professional project management services. Develop and mentor teams to manage the planning, design and construction of commercial building construction projects.
Develop and enforce consistent project management best practice and procedures. Provide direction and assess project delivery success of Library Bond PMO Construction Project Managers.
Establish and ensure administrative, budgetary and scope-related controls for project delivery and their implementation across all projects.
Create, implement and monitor performance measures to report impact and effectiveness of projects and recommend process improvements.
Ensure project processes and outcomes support County equity and sustainability goals.
Take corrective action as necessary to resolve complaints and/or lack of performance. Escalate issues to the appropriate level when necessary.
Work with leadership of external contractors to ensure appropriate delivery of quality services. Assess service needs by collaborating with stakeholders.
Be proactive, anticipate and seek solutions and opportunities to improve project delivery.
Implement and assist in the development of program policies, procedures, and business practices.
Ensure that all projects meet the requirements of the project labor agreement(s).
Staff Supervision and Development:
Supervise and motivate staff to work effectively; assess and recommend training opportunities: create succession plans; resolve conflicts and maintain a safe, collaborative and equitable work environment.
Direct and approve, through subordinate supervisors, and lead workers the planning, prioritizing, assigning, supervising, training, and review of the work of a diverse workforce; advise on the more complex and sensitive concerns and issues.
Direct, recommend and assist staff in the implementation of goals and objectives; establish schedules and methods for projects; implement policies and procedures; and offer necessary training and resources needed to perform duties.
Recruit staff and implement disciplinary procedures as needed.
To Qualify
We will consider any combination of relevant work experience, volunteering, education, and transferable skills as qualifying unless an item or section is labeled required. Please be clear and specific about how your background is relevant.
Minimum Qualifications/Transferable Skills*:
Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university in a related field or equivalent practical and relevant experience.
Six years to eight (6-8) years experience managing the delivery of simultaneous, complex construction projects in a campus-type environment or in multiple locations. Ten (10) years of current experience managing capital construction projects, strongly preferred .
Demonstrated experience managing multiple levels of capital construction project managers as well as project vendors (AEs, GMGCs, Owner’s Reps).
Demonstrated experience managing projects in a mixed Union/non-Union environment.
Demonstrated knowledge and skills related to Project Management Best Practices for construction projects.
Ability to work in a fast paced, high pressure, and highly political environment.
Ability to work under pressure and maintain a calm project work environment.
Ability to pass a criminal records check
Must have a valid driver license
Preferred Qualifications/Transferable Skills*: You do not need to have the following preferred qualifications/transferable skills to qualify however keep in mind we may consider some or all of the following when identifying the most qualified candidates. Please clearly explain on your application how you meet any of the following preferred qualifications/transferable skills.
Management of Library construction project(s) and the related technology.
Management of bond-funded constructions projects.
*Transferable skills: Your transferable skills are any skills you have gained through education, work experience (including the military) or life experiences that are relevant for this position. Be sure to describe any transferable skills on your application and clearly explain how they apply to this position.
Screening and Evaluation
The Application Packet:
A completed online application.
A resume and Cover Letter covering relevant experience and education. Please be sure your resume includes the following for each employer: name of employer, location, dates of employment, your title, a brief summary of your responsibilities, the number of employees under your supervision.
Note : The application, resume and cover letter should demonstrate your work experience/skills and how it is related to those shown in the Overview and To Qualify sections of the job announcement . Please be thorough, as these materials will be scored and determine your eligibility for an interview.
The Selection Process: For details about how we typically screen applications, review our overview of the selection process page. We expect to evaluate candidates for this recruitment as follows:
Initial review of minimum qualifications : We may do an additional preferred review and/or send out additional supplemental questions to identify those highest qualified.
Consideration of top candidates: We will consider qualified candidates in order of rank and score from the list of eligible candidates. This may include panel interview(s), a hiring interview, and/or additional testing to determine the best candidates for a position.
Background check and reference checks: All finalists must pass a thorough criminal records check and reference check.
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
This recruitment may be used to fill full-time, part-time, temporary, limited duration and on-call positions.
Type of Position: This Salary, unclassified executive position is not eligible overtime.
Location: 501 SE Hawthorne Blvd. Suite 400
Schedule: Monday - Friday 8:00am - 4:30pm. There is some flexibility with the start and end times.

Diversity and Inclusion: At Multnomah County, we don't just accept difference; we value it and support it to create a culture of dignity and respect for our employees.
We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran or protected veteran status, genetic information and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available for your reference. Multnomah County is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor. We request priority protected veteran referrals.
Veterans’ Preference: Under Oregon Law, qualifying veterans may apply for veterans’ preference. Review our veterans’ preference page for details about eligibility and how to apply.
Accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act: We gladly provide reasonable accommodation to anyone whose specific disability prevents them from completing an application or participating in this recruitment process. Please contact the recruiter below in advance to request assistance. Individuals with hearing or speech impairments may contact the recruiter through the Telecommunications Relay Service by dialing 711.
Questions?

Title: Infrastructure Project Manager
job description:
Position: Project Manager - Senior
Location: Raleigh, NC
Duration: 7 Months
The Infrastructure Project Manager position is responsible for leading medium to large complex technical projects from inception to closing. This position also has responsibilities for planning, executing, and finalizing infrastructure projects according to a strict deadline, within budget. This position must have strong project management experience with enterprise-wide HW/SW installation, field deployment standup data center infrastructure to support customers' requirements and applications development teams. Must be a team player with good negotiation skills and have a take charge mindset.
Primary responsibilities for this position include but are not limited to the following:
Coordinate all activities related to a project and be the focal point for all communications, status, and schedules for multiple concurrent IT projects.
Manage projects of all sizes through intake, initiation, planning, manage and monitor, execution and closing while managing the constraints of cost, time, resources, scope, and quality.
Lead the planning and implementation of cloud migrations and related projects for multiple project teams.
Oversee the overall planning, coordination, execution, and completion of assigned projects and strategic initiatives.
Effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion.
Define, develop, and execute project plans specifying goals, strategy, resources, scheduling, identification of risks, contingency plans according in collaboration with the PMO methodology and process, ensuring project goals are met on time and on budget.
Manage and negotiate all requests for change order.
Work with stakeholders to gather and manage the business requirements migrations from on-premise data center to cloud environment.
Data center infrastructure project experience (from SOW/initiation, through execution & closing - including testing & DR familiarity)
Cloud, preferably for Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Amazon Managed Services (AMS) project experience
Managed projects for the migration of data from on-prem to cloud environments like AWS or Azure
Familiarity with Active Directory (AD), software licenses & certifications, and Domain Name System (DNS)
Understands information security concepts (antivirus, encryption, SSO, MFA)
Experienced managing risks, issues and reporting
Uses project management methodology, practices good documentation and note taking.
Possess strong work ethic, shows self-management, dedication, and teamwork
Knowledge of: Data center fundamentals to include on-premise servers, VMWare, storage, networking, and wireless networking fundamentals to include WANs, LANS technologies (i.e. routers, switches, access points, etc.); AZURE and/or AWS; network infrastructure; data center operations; and business applications development and support.
Skills in: managing and coordinating work between operations and development teams; communicating effectively orally and in written form; negotiation; presentation; large scale network migration projects; data center infrastructure migration to AZURE and AWS; and Microsoft Project, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio.
Ability to: be a technical leader that can drive project processes and technical projects to meet time sensitive deadlines; work with minimal assistance; establish and maintain a good working relationship within and outside the Infrastructure teams; manage multiple projects, activities, and tasks under time constraints within a fast-paced environment; effectively communicate project scope, status, and issues to internal and external stakeholders; manage multiple concurrent projects efforts of various sizes; build comprehensive projects schedules with critical path; manage project scope, costs, and timelines; and handle risk and issue management, mitigation, and escalation.
Job Type: Contract
Pay: $53.00 - $60.00 per hour
Ability to Commute/Relocate:
Raleigh, NC (Required)
Experience:
Cloud, preferably for Azure, AWS or AMS: 7 years (Preferred)
Familiarity with Active Directory (AD), software licenses: 7 years (Preferred)
Data center project from initiation to Execution: 8 years (Required)
risk management analysis; managing projects and teams: 8 years (Required)
managing risks, issues and reporting: 8 years (Required)
SharePoint/ PMP Certification: 4 years (Preferred)

Title: Project Coordinator

Project Coordinator

Academic Transfer Credit Solutions is currently seeking a highly-motivated and energetic Project Coordinator. This candidate works closely and collaboratively with stakeholders to plan, direct, organize, update, and execute against project requirements; identifies and acquires necessary resources and coordinates efforts by all parties to ensure timely delivery of project outcomes in accordance with project timelines and partnering units. A successful candidate will be confident presenting, organizing and maintaining reports, and managing projects.

Essential Duties

Responsible for managing the integration of the Transfer Guide and me3, in collaboration with Academic Transfer Credit Solutions, EdPlus, and University Technology Office
Plans, develops, implements, and manages projects to complete task definitions and work requirement identification and assignments

Prepares and maintains all project status reports and schedules; tracks milestones/deliverables, budget, quarterly reports, metrics, and updates

Models University Core Expectations:

Trustworthy, Adheres to Ethics and Compliance Standards
Collaborative, Team-oriented
Productive, Commitment to ASU
Flexible, Adaptable
Respectful Communicator
Resourceful, Committed to Sustainability

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree. 2 years related experience; 1 of which is in project management, OR any equivalent combination of experience and/or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved.

Desired Qualifications

Experience in coordinating project activities and execution of projects.
Evidence of effective written and oral communication skills.
Experience in noticing, interpreting and anticipating concerns and potential team and/or sponsorship conflict; escalates as appropriate.
Demonstrated knowledge of project management applications/software for use in effective project management.
Experience in identifying opportunities to use as solutions to improve efficiency and reduce errors.
Experience in developing and maintaining cooperative and collaborative working relationships among all project team members.

Subject to extended periods of sitting, keyboarding and manipulating a computer mouse (75%);
Required to stand for varying lengths of time and walk moderate distances to perform work (10%);
Frequent bending, reaching, lifting, pushing and pulling up to 25 pounds (15%)
Regular activities require ability to quickly change priorities, which may include and/or are subject to resolution of conflicts
Ability to clearly communicate to perform essential functions
Receives regular review of completed tasks for achievement of established objectives.

Department Statement

The Academic Transfer Credit Solutions team under the University Provost supports student success by developing, standardizing and evaluating transfer curriculum activities and processes. Academic Transfer Credit Solutions works directly with academic units and departments across the university and external agencies to provide exemplary service to students and staff. Academic Transfer Credit Solutions seeks detail- and service-oriented team members to join a positive environment focused on collaborative problem solving. Through employee feedback a team culture has developed that values a growth mindset, being the best, and collaboration.

ASU Statement

Arizona State University is a new model for American higher education, an unprecedented combination of academic excellence, entrepreneurial energy and broad access. This New American University is a single, unified institution comprising four differentiated campuses positively impacting the economic, social, cultural and environmental health of the communities it serves. Its research is inspired by real world application blurring the boundaries that traditionally separate academic disciplines. ASU serves more than 80,000 students in metropolitan Phoenix, Arizona, the nation's fifth largest city. ASU champions intellectual and cultural diversity, and welcomes students from all fifty states and more than one hundred nations across the globe.

ASU is a tobacco-free university. For details visit www.asu.edu/tobaccofree

AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, and other national service alumni are encouraged to apply.

Arizona State University is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor and an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by law.

You may request a hard copy of the report by contacting the ASU Police Department at 480-965-3456.

Relocation Assistance – For information about schools, housing child resources, neighborhoods, hospitals, community events, and taxes, visit https://cfo.asu.edu/relocation-services.

Background Check Statement

ASU conducts pre-employment screening for all positions which includes a criminal background check, verification of work history, academic credentials, licenses, and certifications. Employment is contingent upon successful passing of the background check.

Title: Residential Construction Project Manager
job description:
PLEASE NOTE - WE ARE ONLY SEEKING CANDIDATES WITH EXPERIENCE AS A CONSTRUCTION/REMODELING PROJECT MANAGER. THANK YOU!
Residential Construction Project Manager for High End Construction & Remodeling Firm
Proyecto, a rapidly growing residential construction & remodeling company in Oakland, is looking to add an adept Project Manager to the team. The position is full time, and will entail medium to large projects the East Bay, with some work in San Francisco.
This is an excellent opportunity for someone who likes to be on the move and engaging with customers. We are looking for someone who knows how to turn any situation into an opportunity to make the client feel taken care of, happy, and well informed. Home construction is a stressful prospect for most customers. At Proyecto we aim to provide a high-quality product with concierge service through shopping to construction. We are looking for a candidate who is attentive and calm while managing difficulties as they arise.
Job duties include:
-Compose and maintain project schedules
-Track and manage RFIs, COs to subcontractors and clients
- Schedule and conduct OAC on-site meetings
-Weekly emails and calls to clients utilizing high level customer service and detailed site reports
- Management and tracking of all meetings pertaining to managed projects.
- Monitor project milestones and ensuring that they're hit on time
-Monitor projects actively for change of scope/cost
- Coordinate with Proyecto team, subcontractors and vendors
Compensation and Benefits
- Competitive Salary
- Sick time accrued per year.
- Paid federal holidays.
- Annual evaluation for raise and opportunities for growth.
Preferred Qualifications
- 2 year or 4 year degree.
- Experience creating estimates and change orders.
- 5+ years of experience in the construction management.
-Outstanding skills in the field of Customer Service, especially conflict resolution.
Please follow-up with resume (pdf), references and two mornings you are available to interview. Interview will be held at the Proyecto office Jack London. Thank you for your interest! We very much look forward to hearing from you.
Proyecto is an equal opportunity employer. We seek to build and maintain a diverse staff with regard to race, culture, ethnicity, class, religion, physical ability, age, gender and sexual orientation. We strongly encourage candidates from all communities to apply.
Thank you - we're looking forward to learning more about you.
check us out at proyectobuild.com

Title: Quarantine Project Manager
job description:
QUARANTINE PROJECT MANAGER
In the world of COVID-19 crewing up fishing-vessels requires more hospitality work than ever before! American Seafoods is looking for a talented person to join our team to manage this new capability. The responsibility of this role will be to help design, schedule, negotiate, and execute quarantine/pre-departure housing, hospitality, transportation, testing, security, medical care for pre- boarding operations as well as for post infection exposure. This position will work closely with the Quarantine Program Manager and report to the Director of Human Resources.
Job Duties:
Coordinate with fleet operations teams to align quarantine start dates with vessel port dates.
Plan master schedule and passenger manifests for crews between Seattle, Washington and Dutch Harbor, Alaska.
Book commercial / private air and ground transport and act as person-in-charge for day of travel issues and in accordance with social distancing and capacity protocols.
Assist with organizing and executing appropriate testing schedules for SARS-CoV-2.
Coordinate with medical wellness and claims on the status of contact tracing and testing data.
Maintain master vendor list and points of contact.
Reconcile vendor timesheets and invoices for accuracy.
Assist with managing security, medical, and logistics support on-site as needed.
Manage reservations for crew members arriving to mid-travel quarantine locations and from Dutch Harbor on crew transfers between vessels.
Work with HR and Recruiting teams to inform crew about quarantine protocols and standards.
Maintain Quarantine Master Control sheets with information regarding crew testing and wellness check information.
Assist Program Manager with crew communications regarding departures and schedule changes.
During isolation events, drive communications between insurance adjusters, medical teams, crew members, and public health to ensure all parties have access to updated information.
Skills Required:
Extremely well organized and experienced with remote management of assigned projects.
Experienced in working on large value contracts and reporting against metrics and service level agreements (SLAs)
Familiarity with hotel and transportation systems and reservations with corporate travel and room blocks.
Experienced with working directly with a variety of cultures and backgrounds.
Experience working in a customer facing role in small groups.
Comfortable operating in PHE (Personal Health Equipment) for extended durations of time.
Adept at communicating directly and influencing others at all levels of the company.
Able to:
Travel up to 40% of the time to quarantine locations in Washington and Alaska.
Comfortable in traveling on small aircraft, as required.
Valid US drivers license and able to be insured by the company.
Work in isolation and quarantine facilities with potential exposure to infectious diseases.
Seattle/Anchorage Based. Up to 12-month assignment, eligible for health benefits. Must provide own transportation in home city, with local travel required.

Title: Project Manager (IT)
job description:
Working under minimal supervision of the Manager, Technical Services Operations, referring only exceptional problems and issues for management review or approval, the Project Manager manages small to large complex projects for customers, as well as multi-disciplinary projects. The Project Manager assesses and develops business requirements, develops functional specifications, integrates with back office systems, and identifies business tasks, UAT, and implementation. Project Manager can be assigned to large scale roll out projects with in the configuration center to insure projects are being completed by specified service level agreements. Manages the SharePoint sites for project onboarding design, production, depot and R&D and develops standard operating procedures (SOPs) in accordance with PMI standards for the different teams. Provides Project Management leadership to the assigned teams.

Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree or the equivalent combination of education and work experience
Project Management or similar major
PMP or project management certificate or the equivalent combination of education and work experience
Minimum of 4 year(s) of work experience in progressively responsible roles in project or program management
General proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite with experience or the ability to quickly learn the product.
Microsoft Project
Status reporting tools
Time tracking and reporting tools
Use case development
Scrum project management
Agile development
Burn down charting
Advanced knowledge of SharePoint with ability to manage multiple sites
Possesses strong planning and negotiation skills.
Possesses strong facilitation and meeting management skills.
Advanced Project Management skills with ability to perform project initiation, development, implementation, scope management, status reporting and implementation.
Ability to analyze informational requirements and needs, identify problems, provide technical advice and consultation, and ensure efficient computer systems utilization; analyze data and develop logical solutions to problems; interface effectively and cooperatively with computer system users to maintain efficient system utilization; monitor system utilization and recommend appropriate revisions to processes, procedures, and operations.
Understanding of the complexities of scheduling in a matrix organization
Business acumen with the ability to develop an understanding of PC Connection, the direct sales of computer products, and the company's strategies and an understanding of the organization's customers, their behaviors and preferences.
Good interpersonal skills with the ability to quickly build and sustain positive relationships with individuals and to develop strong business relationships within the organization.
Strong team leader with ability to support a team to accomplish objectives by serving, motivating and collaborating with, and focusing on the needs of team members: attention to team dynamics and goals.
Demonstrated capacity to learn, comprehend and have the ability to clearly and concisely present information verbally and in writing.
Effective time management and organizational skills with ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities with competing deadlines in a fast paced environment.
Good listening skills with ability to receive information completely and understand what is being said.
Reliable with ability to complete consistent, quality work and to follow through on commitments.
Detail oriented with item by item focus, meticulous attention to detail with ability to proofread for accuracy.
Self-motivated with ability to work well on a team or independently.
Judgment with ability to formulate opinions, compare and decide with good sense.
Project management certification preferred.
Prior experience in similar industry preferred.



About Connection:

Connection is a Fortune 1000 Global Solutions Provider that connects people with technology to enhance growth, elevate productivity, and empower innovation. Founded in 1982, Connection delivers valuable IT services and advanced technology solutions to business, government, education, and healthcare markets. Today, we serve our customers through our staff of highly trained Account Managers, our team of on-staff experts, and our efficient procurement websites. We are also proud to offer custom-configured computer systems from a ISO 9001:2015 certified technical configuration lab at our distribution center in Wilmington, OH. Our company has over 2,500 technical certifications that ensure our experts can solve any customer need, no matter how complex. Additionally, our GlobalServe offering delivers global procurement solutions through our network of 500 suppliers in 174 countries.The Connection brand includes Connection® Business Solutions, Connection® Enterprise Solutions, and Connection® Public Sector Solutions. Through these three companies we provide customer-centric IT solutions and services to small- to medium-sized businesses, enterprise, and public sector markets, respectively.Twice recognized by Forbes as one of “America’s Most Trustworthy Companies,” Connection has made it our mission to provide customers with expert guidance, state-of-the-art tools, and exceptional knowledge to solve their technology challenges. Throughout our community, we strive to inspire success and increase the value of IT investments.

Title: Marketing Project Manager
job description:
Who We Are
We are a fast-growing full-service marketing agency located in Southeast Missouri, with clients located throughout the country in a variety of different industries. Our difference is that we aren’t a cookie-cutter, suit-and-tie firm, and we are focused solely on creating a relationship that helps our clients grow. We’re made up of experienced creatives, strategic planners, out-of-the-box thinkers, and hard workers who thrive when shattering expectations.

Position Overview
We are seeking a motivated and energetic team member to join our company as a Marketing Project Manager. As an arm of our client success team, you will oversee the timely creation and implementation of marketing campaigns that involved a variety of assets, including video content, graphic design items, and digital strategy. You will work with a larger team of creative professionals, supporting company goals and media initiatives, meaning that a collaborative mindset is an absolute must. Our ideal candidate is an expert in the digital marketing sphere, and also has a deep knowledge of other marketing fields such as graphic design, content creation, and video production.

This person is someone with a passion for helping businesses grow by expanding their marketing efforts. The ideal candidate must have a strong internal motivation and be confident when taking initiative. They must be a quick learner, a risk-taker, a goal-setter, and a problem-solver that is comfortable producing innovative products.

Creative Edge’s work environment will provide you with unlimited opportunities to learn and grow in your career, while also giving you the ability to provide creative insight into other areas. Teamwork is essential at Creative Edge! On top of that – a competitive wage, an attractive benefits package, and a flexible working environment make Creative Edge a great place to work.

Marketing Project Manager Responsibilities
Provide end-to-end project management for marketing campaigns
Be knowledgeable of digital marketing, graphic design, and video production workflows
Scope project requirements as well as prepare budget estimates
Develop a detailed project plan and monitor progress
Collaborate with internal teams to design, develop and implement a variety of projects
Prioritize task workload based on the size, scope, and timeliness of projects
Deliver projects on time ensuring quality standards are met
Maintain support documentation including creative and project briefs
Communicate with the team and ensure all members are on board with delegated tasks
Highlight potential risks or malfunctions and act proactively to resolve issues
Perform quality control on assets developed for a marketing campaign
Seek opportunities for improvement and suggest new practices

Experience Expectations
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or Communications (or a related field) is preferred, but not required
Proven experience in project management is essential; agency experience is preferred
Knowledge in our core areas of service is paramount: Digital Marketing (Facebook Ads, Google Ads, social media marketing, messenger marketing), Custom Video Production, Graphic Design, Content Creation
Ability and confidence in communicating and articulating marketing concepts, value, and data insights
Possess excellent judgment & deep understanding of workflow organization principles and practices
Able to work with minimal supervision while maintaining focus and productivity, but knows when to ask for help when needed

Characteristics of a Creative Edge Team Member
Strong Communicator
Organized & Detailed
Ability to Plan Ahead
Ability to Adapt & Change Quickly
Self-Motivated
Team Player
Dedicated to Growth & Achieving Results

Title: Nutrition Services Program Manager
job description:
Public Health is recruiting for a Nutrition Services Program Manager.

Under direction, performs a variety of professional program activities in the planning, organizing and administering of operations in support of designated nutrition services programs, including the Women, Infants and Children (WIC) Program; provides leadership and administrative support in the review, analysis, development and implementation of nutrition services programs; collaborates with governmental agencies, other departments and community organizations to supplement services to program participants and does other related duties as assigned.

Typical Tasks and Representative Duties
(Not in order of importance)
Perform a variety of professional program activities in the organizing and administering of operations in support of designated public health nutrition programs; establish and maintain timelines and priorities; provide technical information, assistance or direction in the administration of public health nutrition program activities, needs and issues.
Provide leadership and administrative support in the analysis, development, and improvement of designated public health nutrition programs; participate in or lead the development and implementation of policies and programs for assigned area; assure activities comply with established rules, regulations, ordinances, and procedures; review pending legislation and analyze operations to identify and implement policy or procedure changes as appropriate.
Perform outreach and advocacy for services; coordinate, facilitate and participate in a variety of meetings; serve on committees and review boards; communicate with staff and various outside agencies to exchange information, coordinate activities and resolve issues; enlist the support of diverse agencies and community organizations and individuals as appropriate.
Coordinate program activities to assure organizational effectiveness; collaborate with others to assure programs align with departmental and County-wide goals and objectives; provide consultation and recommendations to administrators and stakeholders concerning nutrition programs and related functions; respond to inquiries, resolve issues and conflicts.
Supervise, train and evaluate the performance of designated personnel as assigned; interview and select employees and recommend transfers, reassignment, termination and disciplinary actions; assign employee duties and review work for accuracy, completeness and compliance with established requirements.
Prepare and maintain a variety of reports and documentation related to program activities, project scheduling, requests for proposal, and related activities; develop, prepare, analyze and review program budgets, grant proposals, quarterly and annual summary as required; respond to audit reports and inquiries; maintain research analysis summaries, trend review reports, charts, memorandums and other documentation as needed for effective program administration, research and policy implementation.
Click here for the full job description.
The Ideal Candidate
Knowledge of:
Principles and technical aspects of public health nutrition programs
Principles and practices in the science of public health nutrition
Nutritional requirements through the life cycle and the impact of various medical conditions upon nutritional status
Educational methods used in training clients and other stakeholders
Applicable local, State and Federal rules, regulations and laws
Techniques and methods of research, analysis, and report writing
Community outreach techniques and basic public relations techniques
Effective oral and written communication skills
Interpersonal skills using tact, patience and courtesy
Principles and practices of program planning, monitoring and evaluation
Principles and practices of budget planning, monitoring and administration
Principles and practices of management, administration, supervision and training
Principles of grant writing
Health Agency organization, procedures and standards as well as strategic direction and goals
Current developments and industry trends in public health nutrition
Ability to:
Communicate effectively both orally and in writing
Interpret, apply and explain rules, regulations, policies, procedures and legislation
Supervise and evaluate the performance of assigned staff
Embrace and follow the Health Agency’s policies, goals, guiding principles and Mission – Vision – Values Statement
Develop and maintain positive working relationships; communicate and work effectively with others
Foster a spirit of teamwork and support when interacting with staff and others
Analyze research data and prepare reports, summaries and recommendations
Plan own work and work of others for successful results
Operate standard office equipment including a computer and assigned software
Maintain a safe and orderly work area
Minimum Qualifications:

Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with a bachelor's degree in nutrition, dietetics or a closely related field. In addition, 3 years of progressively responsible professional level public health nutrition experience.

Title: Program Manager: Food Services
job description:
Sonoma Valley Unified School District
An Equal Opportunity - Affirmative Action Employer
The Department of Human Resources Announces An Opening For:
PROGRAM MANAGER: FOOD SERVICES
Food Service Department
8.0 Hours per Day - 225 Work Days
SALARY: Program Manager, Management Salary Schedule ($80,518.89 - $83,299.84 annually, depending on experience).
DUTIES:
Under the supervision of the Associate Superintendent: Business Services, the Food Service Manager will direct, plan and organize the district-wide Food Service Program in conformance with district policy and regulations. Develops and recommends changes or improvements in Food Service Program policies including application processing and meal ticket or token handling procedures under the free and reduced price mail program; develops and implements standards for the operation of an efficient, sanitary and high quality food service program; develops specifications, orders, and maintains inventories for food-related supplies and food service equipment; orders USDA donated food when available; tests food and other products prior to and after purchase; develops and tests menus and recipes and works with sites in evaluation of food served; works with vendors regarding new products and/or problems; plans and recommends meetings and workshops to provide training on food preparation and service, sanitation and nutrition, and kitchen management; in consultation with the Associate Superintendent: Business Services and Director of Human Resources selects, assigns, transfers, evaluated, and recommends discipline regarding food service personnel; performs related duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Knowledge of: Federal and state regulations governing child nutrition programs, free and reduced meals, USDA donated food usage, and competitive food sales; principles of good nutrition and their application to school food service; knowledge of food sanitation principles, food testing procedures, quality food preparation, service, storage; purchasing ethics, cost accounting, inventory control; schedules work, staffing formulas, and work production standards
Ability to: Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with school personnel, employees, parents, students, and the general public; supervise employees for maximum productivity and morale; to use, or willingness to learn, computer terminal/PC for work associated with duties
Desirable: Graduation from high school and post high school training in food handling, nutrition, and/or related fields. 3 years experience in school food service, supervisory or otherwise. Bilingual preferred. In possession of
Food Handlers Certificate or willingness to be certified within 12 months of hire date.
Fingerprints and TB test required upon initial employment.

Title: Construction Project Manager
job description:
Alyeska Builders, LLC is looking to add another great project manager to our team!
This position is open to the following applicants:
1. Experienced project manager / superintendent. If you have prior job experience managing construction projects, we would love to visit with you about this opportunity!
2. Journeyman carpenters looking to advance in to a management position. Must have extensive understanding of construction industry, processes, vendors and be confident in managing others.
POSITION REQUIREMENTS
- Minimum 8 years in construction industry.
- Use of computers / company software is required. Alyeska Builders will provide training on company software, however, applicants must have basic computer skills such as: ability to utilize email, safari, typing skills (30WPM or greater).
- Must be willing & able to pass a drug test.
- Valid driver's license (driving record without major violations, suspensions within last 5 years).
JOB DESCRIPTION, DUTIES:
- Oversee day to day operations on projects assigned.
- Review daily job reports.
- Communicate with trade partners / subcontractors.
- Communicate with vendors, place & track material orders.
- Complete site meetings / inspections with clients when necessary.
- Communicate with clients & build team.
- Prepare & submit change orders when applicable.
- Complete scheduling for your team, review weekly, daily.
- Quality assurance. Project manager must have ability to review work completed, and enforce corrections when work completed is not to Alyeska Builders standard.
- Problem solving.
- Leadership, mentoring.
- Oversee employee time entries.
- Project Estimating.
- Individual must be extremely organized, and able to multi-task effectively.
All of the above tasks require use of our project management system. Strong computer skills will be needed to effectively fill this position.
This position will primarily entail residential projects & clients.
Example project types applicant would be responsible for overseeing:
- New construction, residential home builds.
- Residential remodels. (i.e. kitchen, bath, full homes)
- Home inspection repairs.
- Light commercial remodels and / or repairs.
Applicant should possess the knowledge to oversee and lead above work scopes. Applicant should be able to walk through a project site in these areas, and be able to notice errors / items needing attention.
BENEFITS PACKAGE
Group life insurance, premiums paid by company.
Retirement with company sponsored match (after applicable waiting period with Alyeska Builders).
Fitness membership discount/incentive.
Health insurance plan, after applicable waiting period with Alyeska Builders.
Travel bonus, after applicable waiting period.
SCHEDULE DETAILS
Our crew works year round - ability to work overtime is required.
Monday - Friday is standard, however, Saturdays are common based on work load on any given week. Summer season especially, Saturdays are common. We do take long holiday weekends, and our team members rotate taking time off to enjoy our Alaskan summers!
To learn more about what we do (and who we are) - visit our website: www.alyeskabuilders.com
We appreciate you taking the time to review our position, reach out any time with questions.
Thank you,
Alyeska Builders, LLC

Title: Project Manager
job description:
At GTO, we live by a central tenet – imagination. It’s what questions everything and produces work that’s unlike anything else. It’s what makes us wake up and ask “What if?” It’s what leads us to smarter solutions, stronger strategies, and significant impacts.
As an independent agency, how we drive innovation is up to us. The clients we choose, the tactics we create, and the initiatives we take are all our own. That’s why we’re looking for people who put curiosity over conformity, who aren’t scared of their passions, and who create the futures they want to see.
If this sounds like you, become even greater at Greater Than One.
ROLE:
We’re seeking a passionate Project Manager who loves working in an exciting setting collaborating on building comprehensive digital experiences. You will be responsible for managing client projects and ensuring all deliverables are provided to our client’s specifications, on time and on budget. You will be responsible for working with clients and our account teams to understand the business requirements and scope of projects. You will lead strategy, creative teams and development resources through the project life cycle, developing timelines, running status meetings, identifying risks, developing mitigation plans, and providing burn reports for utilization and resourcing.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage the scope, resources, budget, and project schedule
Oversee maintenance of the project plan with status updates
Work closely with Account Executives, Strategy, Creative, and Technology teams to understand and execute client requests & develop business requirements and implementation plans.
Promote teamwork and coordination across team members.
Ensure ability to track project progress in coordination with project financials.
Manage efficient internal meetings – coordinate effective responses from the team.
Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects
Set expectations for deliverables, ensuring that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget
Assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders
Identify resource availability and allocation
Develop a detailed project plan to monitor and track progress
Manage changes to the project scope, project schedule, and project costs using appropriate verification techniques
Perform risk management to minimize project risks
Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendors
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation
Requirements
2 years of experience in a project management environment
Strong understanding of all aspects of digital development and production
Ability to manage complex, competing requests and resolve conflict
Working knowledge of project management software like Microsoft Project, or Smartsheets
Exposure to analytical concepts and data management
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Strong attention to detail
Extremely creative, resourceful, and adaptable to support multiple initiatives
Motivation to grow within the position and take on more responsibilities
Experience in a highly collaborative agency business
Proficient skills with Microsoft Office (Excel/Word/PowerPoint/Outlook)
Proven working experience in project management in the pharma, marketing, design or information technology sector
Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience with web technologies
Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Solid organizational skills, including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
Self-running and motivated
Manages own time efficiently – finds solutions to problems by coordinating effectively

Title: Project Manager
job description:
Project Manager
Position Overview
The Project Manager is responsible managing a book of business of up to $4.5M and up to 12-16 projects at any one time. The PM is also responsible for managing multiple subcontractors on each project. PMs will manage up to four in house crews that report directly to you. PMs are also responsible for their meeting budget, day to day HR issues, safety and the experience they give to the client.
How you will make an impact:
Project Management
Work with the designer to ensure Foreman’s plans meet discussed budget for each project
Owns the project and communication with the client
Regularly review blueprints, grading plans, construction drawings, contracts, codes and regulations, proposals, Gnatt charts
Update Design Build team on timelines, change orders, and any other project related issues
Create schedule for all crews managed
Maintain strict construction schedule and make changes as necessary to ensure deadlines and budgets are met
Develop comprehensive project plans including schedules and purchase orders for all projects assigned
Manage Lifescape crews and subcontractors to ensure LAI standards are upheld
Ensure crews operate safely and in congruence with Lifescape practices
Act at primary point of contact with clients through during of construction project
Maintain communication with client as to the status of the project, at minimum, weekly updates
Manage change orders
Collaborate with the designer to ensure project feasibility
Negotiate with vendors, suppliers and subcontractors to ensure the best outcome for Lifescape and the client
Track project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of every phase of the project in terms of both man hours and costs
Meet budgetary objectives and make adjustments to project constraints based on metric analysis
Use and continually develop leadership skills
Ensure that each crew has the tools and equipment needed for the day’s tasks
Work with field personnel to handle project issues as they arise
Build a strong team by cultivating relationships between each crew and illustrating how individual team members affect the success of the entire project
Crew Management
Manage up to four foreman and theirs crews for ongoing projects
Manage, develop, teach, train, coach, and discipline the foreman
Ensure crew safety and report and worksite injuries immediately
Organize and present training classes as needed
Attend and participate in weekly meetings
Subcontractor Management:
Consistently create and nurture new subcontractor relationships
Accurately communicate project plans, quality expectations, and scope of work
Manage change orders

Title: Program Manager
job description:
Requisition ID
req13634

Working Title
Program Manager

Position Grade
13

Position Summary
The Transdisciplinary Research, Equity and Engagement Center for Advancing Behavioral Health (TREE Center) seeks a highly motivated team player with a commitment to multi-disciplinary team collaboration. The TREE Center bridges several colleges and departments on main campus and the health sciences center and has a budget of $1.4 million per year (total of $7.2 Million from October 1, 2017-June 20, 2022, National Institute on Minority Health and Health Disparities/National Institutes of Health). The TREE Center has three Cores (Administrative, Community Engagement Dissemination and Investigator Development), two research projects and pilot research projects. This Center’s leadership emphasizes inclusion, equity, diversity and community engagement in advancing the pipeline of under-represented minority researchers and multi-level behavioral health research. The TREE Center’s research leadership and larger community of practice are rooted in culturally centered knowledge that is complemented with academic science.

This is a full-time Term position. This position is dependent upon funding awarded through NIH and will be evaluated for a Term renewal via a competitive national application process in 2022. This position is located within 2 miles of main campus.
Duties and Responsibilities
1. Plans and coordinates the daily administrative components of a university research center with a statewide, regional and national reach. Oversees fiscal, operational, administrative, and human resources management of the program(s). Maintains responsibility of the appropriate use of programmatic funds within the parameters of the contract(s)/grant(s), up to approximately $1.5 million per fiscal year.

2. Strategic representation, communication and collaborative via direct or virtual interaction with a wide range of high-level internal and external constituencies.

3. Leads in developing structured protocols, processes and tools for building synergistic linkages between the TREE Center’s interconnected components (Cores, Research Projects, Community Scientific Advisory Committee and larger community of practice). This involves cross campus integrated program planning, management and support for faculty, staff and students across Colleges, Departments, Institutes and Centers and requires a high level of management and communication skills.

4. Designs and implements systems to assess, collect, maintain, and analyze grants management data;
generates interim progress reports, final reports, evaluation, human subjects research protocol and other information related to the Center’s operations.

5. Establishes and implements short- and long-range goals, objectives, policies, and operating procedures; monitors and evaluates operational effectiveness and effects changes required for improvement.

6. Administration of integrated operating policies and standards, and management systems including federal/state/university regulations related to COVID-19.

7. Designs, establishes and maintains staffing and an organizational structure to effectively accomplish the Center’s function. Provides leadership/guidance to staff and/or students.

8. Administers and implements funded contracts and grants to ensure compliance with the funding agency, university, tribal, state, and federal requirements and guidelines. Leads the Center’s administrative team meetings and participates in other meetings, working groups and strategic planning/evaluation retreats.

9. Supports the Center’s community outreach and communication’s activities that includes interfacing with external and internal stakeholders.

10. Engages in the development of professional services contracts, subawards and student contracts.

11. Oversees the social media, web and communications and marketing programming of students and/or staff and/or consultants.

12. Plans and co-develops strategies with the Center’s leadership for generating resources and/or revenues for the project; assist in preparing contract and/or grant proposals as well as annual NIH reports.

13. Recommends, participates in the development of, and establishes pre-and post- award policies and procedures.

14. Acts as a liaison between main campus and HSC fiscal management teams related to contracts and
grants procurement activities.

15. Leads in developing grants applications and proposals and handles the complexities of the budget, protocols, application forms and more in collaboration with cross campus faculty and statewide and national partners.

16. Performs miscellaneous job-‐related duties as assigned.
See the Position Description for additional information.


Conditions of Employment

Minimum Qualifications
High school diploma or GED; at least 6 years of experience 2 of which are management level experience directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified.
Completed degree(s) from an accredited institution that are above the minimum education requirement may be substituted for experience on a year for year basis.

Preferred Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
Ability to perceive, control, reflect and evaluate personal and interpersonal relationships and dynamics with a fair and balanced approach to one’s work environment (i.e. self-awareness, self-regulation, motivation, empathy, and social skills).
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.
Experience managing information technology and online communications platforms (i.e. Zoom, online team collaboration and program management applications). Including experience with scheduling, coordinating, and managing technology for meetings.
Ability to develop and maintain record keeping systems, procedures and research protocols.
Skill in the use of computers, preferably in a PC and/or MAC, Windows-based operating environment and required budget and grants management software.
Ability to schedule and plan events in both virtual and in-person environments.
Experience organizing programs and activities in alignment with goals and objectives.
Skill in budget preparation, fiscal management and procedures. Preferably, acquisition and sound management of a Purchase card in a university setting.
Knowledge of contracts and grants preparation and post-award management.
Demonstrate confidence in leading the management and communications of TREE Center program strategies, activities and operational tasks.
Excellent written and oral communication skills both via emails, zoom and one on one.

Title: Project Coordinator 1
job description:
The State Accounting Office (SAO) provides accounting and financial reporting expertise for the State and is responsible for statewide financial reporting, oversight and management of the State’s Peoplesoft Financial and Human Capital Management system, accounting policy business process improvement recommendations, and management of the SAO Shared Service Center.

Position Description:

The entry\training level Project Coordinator position is responsible for coordinating meetings and developing strategies to see projects through from beginning to completion. This may include attending meetings and recording minutes, receiving project documents and compiling a summary that includes a project plan, target date, and list of responsibilities and responsible person.

Project Coordinators also perform various administrative tasks which include creating and updating project documents, creating and maintaining project schedules, creating responsibility lists for those who are involved in the project, and compiling summaries for those who were involved. Incumbents at this level may require additional training or experience to gain full proficiency in some of the job responsibilities.

Project Coordinator 1 – ITP110
Pay Grade: K
Salary range: $36,268.09 - $51,811.56

Primary Duties & Responsibilities:

Coordinate and attend meetings
Record, track, and file meeting minutes - as well as action items, risks, issues training needs, change requests, lessons learned, change management, etc.
Coordinate and facilitate lessons learned sessions
Develop strategies for projects, client relationships, etc.
Ensure project documents are complete, current, and stored in the project repository
Work with customers to define scope of projects and ensure appropriate resources are assigned
Create project schedule; develop, articulate, and ensure project milestones are met; identify and evaluate lessons learned during projects
Plan/Facilitate SAO Project Review Committee (SPRC) meetings
Identify, track, monitor, and communicate project-related issues, scope changes, variances and contingencies that may arise during the implementation of SAO projects
Facilitate amicable solutions with the appropriate customer
Maintain effective communication and working relationships with customers and project team members
Create and build upon existing project documentation, methodology, process, procedures, and workflows

Skills and Competencies:

Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to communicate to management, business, and technical personnel
Strong organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Ability to multi-task
Attention to detail

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND One year of experience involving IT projects AND eligibility to sit for Project Management Professional (PMP) certification.

Preferred Qualifications:

Preference may be given to applicants who, in addition to meeting the Minimum Qualifications, possess the following:

Peoplesoft experience
Georgia state government experience
Project Management Professional Certification
General understanding of System Development Life Cycle
Experience using Microsoft Office Project, Outlook, Visio and Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)

Application/Resume must clearly describe relevant qualifications and experience.

NOTE: The State Accounting Office conducts background checks on all final candidates. Hiring of applicants is contingent upon satisfactory results of criminal background\records check, employment and education verification, employment reference checks, credit evaluation and professional license checks (where applicable).

Because of the volume of applications received, we are unable to provide information on application status by phone or e-mail. All qualified applicants will be considered but may not necessarily receive an interview. Selected applicants will be contacted by the hiring agency for next steps in the selection process. Applicants who are not selected will not receive notification. This posting may close at any time prior to the published closing date, once a suitable applicant pool is identified.

The State Accounting Office is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND One year of experience involving IT projects AND eligibility to sit for Project Management Professional (PMP) certification.

Title: Sr Program Manager
job description:
Requisition ID
req13920

Working Title
Sr Program Manager

Position Grade
14

Position Summary
The University of New Mexico’s Project ECHO has an excellent opportunity for a Sr. Program Manager to join our team! This position will lead several international programs in development and meet grant deliverables of various awards and subawards addressing multiple diseases, topics, and issues. We are looking for an individual who possesses outstanding communication and independent working skills to effectively communicate and collaborate with a wide range of individuals and constituents of varying cultures.
As a Sr. Program Manager, you will support Project ECHO’s Strategic Support Manager and participate in:
Collaborating with the International Projects team to establish and implement a robust project management framework to meet the deliverables of multiple international awards and subawards outlining key elements and timelines, dependencies, and resources required to successfully execute each program
Providing guidance with regards to ECHO hub team development, scheduling and coordination of project launches
Assembling relevant background materials to aid decision‐making about project development, including identification of successful models and best practices
Leading the work of several different programs and projects, and creating a system for reporting, and refining the strategy as needed throughout the course of each of the projects
Overseeing program documentation, dissemination, and sustainability efforts
Building a strong collaborative environment to work with each team to compile reports for each of the programs assigned
Participating in stakeholder meetings, meeting with governmental agencies such as the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and USAID and other funding partners
Overseeing the day to day activity of the team, including staffing, hiring, and development of the team members
Creating objectives and goals for the team to build an energetic working environment to foster innovation and teamwork
Overseeing the work of the team, to work with the replication team and virtual immersion team
This role requires strong interpersonal skills and extraordinary competency in verbal and written communication strategies. This position requires flexibility and excellent prioritization skills; one who performs well with minimal supervision with the ability to thrive and problem solve in a fast-paced working environment with competing deadlines.
Project ECHO is a telemedicine and distance-learning program with partners all over the world. Work hours outside of normal business hours may be required. We are fortunate to have access to advanced technology, which will require some teleworking.
Project ECHO prides itself on being a values-based organization. Our seven values include: Service to the Underserved, Demonopolize Knowledge, Mutual Trust and Respect, Teamwork, Excellence and Accountability, Innovation and Learning and Joy of Work. We strive to find individuals who can embrace and exemplify these values.
Project ECHO is committed to democratizing medical knowledge and getting best practice care to underserved people all over the world. We are funded in part by grants from the GE Foundation, the Helmsley Charitable Trust, the Bristol Myers Squibb Foundation, the Merck Foundation, Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, and the US Government. We have received support from the NM Legislature and the New Mexico Department of Health.
Project ECHO's goal is to touch the lives of 1 billion people by 2025 and we are looking for mission-driven high performers who share similar values to join our team and achieve this goal.
See the Position Description for additional information.


Conditions of Employment

Minimum Qualifications
High school diploma or GED; at least 7 years of experience directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified; two of which are management level experience.
Completed degree(s) from an accredited institution that are above the minimum education requirement may be substituted for experience on a year for year basis.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience working internationally, with multicultural teams and on projects based overseas
Project Management experience
Additional language skills besides English: French, Portuguese, Spanish, Swahili

Title: Project Manager Restoration
job description:
Do you have a passion for positively Impacting Lives in their time of need? Are you looking for an edifying and supportive team environment? Our company is expanding, and we have an opportunity for an experienced, action-oriented, outcome-driven Project Manager, with an established track record of success, to join our growing team. We strive to acquire talent that is passionate, outgoing, motivated, goal-oriented, organized, customer-focused problem solvers who have great communication skills and a passion to deliver at the highest levels of quality in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Concraft Inc, an Emergency Water and Fire Damage Restoration company is currently searching for a Project Manager to join our fast-paced, growing organization in Auburn Hills, MI., that believes in, and lives our Core Values.
Trustworthy - Be consistently dependable
Empathy - Show others we care, be humble and kind
Always - Communicate, listen and look for ways to improve
Make It Happen - Go above and beyond

This role will oversee the planning and delivery of restoration and renovation projects. As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for managing the overall project flow, focusing on efficiency, timeliness, quality, safety, and profitability of the project, while ensuring a positive customer experience through completion.
Compensation:
$65,000 - $85,000 Annual range ,plus commissions
Responsibilities:
Oversee and manage all phases of projects in a systematic manner...determined that projects are executed on time, to budget, and of high quality.
Assure a consistent working environment to enable your project teams' success.
Coordinate and schedule staff to maximize costs.
Responsible for closing the sale and obtaining signed work authorizations from property owners.
Negotiate agreed price with insurance adjusters or property owners.
Communicate regularly and effectively with customers, employees, and subcontractors.
Create budgets, schedules, material lists and equipment authorizations to assure delivery.
Convincing in the manner you Build and maintain relationships with all project stakeholders; clients, adjusters, property managers, subcontractors, and internal project team.
Document activities and communications in company software/systems; MS Outlook, Xactimate, Dash, and Encircle.
Ability to be On-Call after hours for emergency calls; participate in a rotational schedule with other Project Managers for after-hours availability.
Qualifications:
Have a minimum of 2 years of Project Management experience.
Have a minimum of 2 years of experience in Construction.
Excellent communication skills; both oral and written.
Experience providing exceptional customer service.
Proven attention to detail, organization, and problem-solving skills.
Bachelor's degree, Associate's degree, or equivalent work experience.
MS Outlook- E-Mail & Calendar proficiency.
Familiar with Xactimate, Dash, and Encircle is a plus.
About Company
Since 1986, the proven professionals from Concraft have been Restoring Properties and Rebuilding Lives for homeowners and business owners in the Greater Detroit Metro Area, and throughout Southeast Michigan. Concraft provides a 24/7/365 emergency response to our customers, whether in need of disaster restoration or commercial renovation.

The Concraft Team thanks you for your consideration to join our family ... and the potential of Being of Service together to our Clients and each other.

Title: UTS-Temporary Project Coordinator
Company: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
job description:
Position Type
Temporary Staff (SHRA)

Job Title
UTS-Temporary Project Coordinator

Department Name
HR UTS Partnership

Vacancy ID
S017084

Position Posting Category
Research Professionals

Hiring Range
$16.00-$18.00 per hour

Full-time/Part-time
Full-Time Temporary

If part-time, how many hours per week?

Work Schedule
M-F 40 hours per week


Proposed Start Date

Estimated Duration of Appointment
6 months not to exceed 11 months

Posting Open Date
11/10/2020

Posting Close Date
11/21/2020

Description of Work
The candidate will be the project coordinator and primary contact for studies entering the HTSF facility. The responsibility of the individual to assist with the drop off check in process, field phone calls and emails and answer issues or direct them to a better resource within the unit. This will require to work closely with all lab managers and leadership. The candidate will review material submitted and processed and deliver the result to the study for approve to continue processing. They will additionally send notifications for project status updates, review and approve submission, generated quotes, pulling reports as need by staff and studies and make submission processing updates in the databases (Tracseq and LIMS). A portion of time will be spent assisting the Tracseq IT staff to improve the customer interaction with the submission website. Including the addition of new features as new technologies and services are introduced by the unit..
A part of study coordination, the candidate will maintain the storage system for all materials entering. The unit has thousands of samples it needs to train accurately in it’s freezer storage system. Samples are expensive to generate but can be irreplaceable and need to be care for properly. It will be their responsibility to maintain the freezer storage system’s accuracy, pull biannual reports to post check accuracy, and to return all samples 2+years to the study’s PI. This all is tracked n the processing databases system, LIMS.
The candidate will act as workshop and seminar coordinator. One of the goals of the unit is training and education. This staff member will coordinate with staff and non UNC vendors to publicize educational events, schedule catering and reserve rooms for sponsored events. Duties will also include updating the website to include event information, updates to include new technologies for review by the users. As the key study contact, they will send all email blasts about training events, workshops, seminars, updates for new services or key updates for the users, PIs, departmental heads.


Education and Experience
4 year degree


Special Physical and Mental Requirements

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, race, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or status as a protected veteran.

No

Title: Technical Project Manager/Systems Support Technician
job description:
Technical Project Manager/Systems Support Technician
EMPLOYER: Green Up IT, Inc.
DATE POSTED: 11/10/2020
CLOSING DATE: 12/15/2020
LOCATION: Helena, MT
HOURS: Full-Time
WAGE/SALARY: $25-$30 Per Hour (depending upon qualifications)
JOB PROFILE: Technical Project Manager/Systems Support Technician:
Project Manager Duties include:
Establish and implement training processes and strategies for all technical personnel. Analyze, plan and develop requirements and standards in reference to scheduled projects. Using existing ConnectWise PSA to assign and oversee the daily tickets and tasks of technical personnel while ensuring all subordinates are actively working toward established milestones. Hold regular technical team meetings to determine progress and address any questions or challenges regarding projects. Determine and define clear deliverables, roles and responsibilities for staff members required for specific projects or initiatives.
Support Technician Duties include:
Meeting with business owners, managers and employees to identify their current and future IT needs and providing and implementing solutions using IT industry best practices. Use technical knowledge and vendor technical support to diagnose and resolve Microsoft Windows®, Android™ and Apple® OS device issues. Support is performed remotely and onsite.
Require excellent listening, written and verbal communication, time management and people skills, including the ability to speak very well in basic professional situations and present technical data in a logical manner that is easy to understand (which include communication via telephone, in person, and presenting to small groups). Ability to write moderately complex documents (which include emails, memos, procedures, presentations). Communicates with a wide variety of individuals (employees and managers) throughout the organization and outside of the organization (i.e. clients, vendors). Possesses a sound working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Access, Excel, and Outlook), Basic IP networking skills, entry level knowledge of Microsoft® Active Directory and Server administration, knowledge of Project Planning and Implementation and the phases of Business Analysis. Ability to do online research, analyze organizational data and interview staff to arrive at the best systems recommendation. Requires lifting and carrying computers, printers and servers. Have a valid U.S. driver’s license and a vehicle. Self- motivated and entrepreneurial spirit required.
EDUCATION:
Degree in Business/Project Management or related technical field required. Opportunities for educational advancement are provided by employer. Talent and Passion for Business Technology are critical.
BENEFITS:
We provide career growth and development, a competitive compensation and benefits package which includes medical, tuition reimbursement program and retirement. Green Up IT is an equal opportunity, drug-free employer, founded on Christian ethics, and committed to diversity in the workplace.
APPLICATIONS:
Please send an updated resume' and examples of Customer Service, Business and/or IT projects and Volunteer Work. Green Up IT offers an ethical, challenging, diverse, rewarding, and fun work experience where enthusiastic, responsible people use their energy, talent and dedication to make a difference in the world.
