Title: Senior Project Manager
job description:
Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) is the national umbrella organization for the nation’s leading network of women’s health care providers, educators, and advocates, serving women, men, teens and families. Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) is the advocacy and political arm of PPFA. For over 100 years, Planned Parenthood has done more than any other organization in the United States to improve women’s health and safety, prevent unintended pregnancies, and advance the right and ability of individuals and families to make informed and responsible health care decisions.

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) and Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) seek a dynamic and effective Senior Project Manager. This job reports to the Chief Human Resources Officer in the Human Resources department of PPFA. The Human Resources division is a critical partner focused on delivering a progressive people agenda that attracts, develops, and retains top talent and provides them with a great place to work.
Purpose
This job is responsible for owning and managing the planning, execution and measurement of multiple complex and multidimensional HR projects and assisting in driving ongoing strategic priorities within the Human Resources department.
Delivery
Synthesize big ideas, gather disparate information and determine the best path forward in both, day-to-day and crisis situations.
Anticipate actions for ongoing work and connect the dots when it comes to emerging themes and issues.
Strong HR point of view with respect to workforce dynamics, with an ability to lead with influence within HR and in your work with cross departmental colleagues.
Lead the annual budgeting and forecasting process for the department; manage all budget updates to Finance.
Build a project management practice within HR and mentor team members on the best in class practices.
Manage the planning of complex project activities starting with defining long and short-range goals and supporting the team in successfully executing them.
Build in diversity, equity & inclusion goals and change management principles at all project life-cycle stages and identify risks, success measures and mitigation strategies.
Connect HR strategy to staff needs and feedback and creatively message this for all HR projects.
Build strong relationships with HR colleagues and especially the HR Leadership Team.
Provide sound data-driven and market-tested guidance to the HR Leadership team in implementing progressive HR solutions for staff.
Assist the CHRO in driving ongoing strategic priorities within the HR team and continuously further the team’s culture and cohesiveness to position us for the next 5 years.
Enhance the brand of HR; learn the work at a level that you can explain and defend it as needed; champion the HR staff and their contributions internally and externally.
Engagement
Be a trusted advisor to the CHRO. This job works closely with HR colleagues and staff at all levels throughout the organization and leads with influence.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs)
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent with at least 5 years of related, progressively responsible HR experience with strong project management experience
Experience working with and supporting senior leaders
Detail-oriented with the ability to handle multiple projects and tasks, often in a fast-paced environment
Ability to see, understand and communicate the big picture as well as translate into actionable next steps
A strong preference for action while retaining the ability to pivot and being pragmatic about the best-laid plans
Ability to thrive in dynamic and unpredictable situations to find the best way forward
Ability to lead with authenticity and build trust along the way without formal authority
Ability to continuously think, question and reason even while being in the weeds
Demonstrated competence in managing budgets
Better than average written communication skills and presentation skills
Team player with strong interpersonal skills
TRAVEL
0-25% (May require minimal travel)
Starting Salary: 120k

LI-KM1

Final offers for this job will be based on capabilities and will be made within the parameters of the PPFA compensation program. Total offer package to include generous vacation + sick leave + paid holidays, individual/family provided medical, dental and vision benefits effective day 1, life insurance, short/long term disability, paid family leave and 401k. We also offer voluntary opt in for Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Transportation/Commuter accounts.

Title: Project Manager
job description:
Duties
Summary
The purpose of the position is to serve as a project manager within OFAC with duties dealing with project and/or program management responsibilities related to OFAC’s mission and programs. The will serve as a project management expert with the goal of increasing OFAC’s organizational performance, efficiency, and effectiveness.

Responsibilities
As a Project Manager, you will:
- Plan, assign, direct, and review the work of employees and contractors assigned to their project(s). Independently or as a group leader, exercise project management responsibility for complex engagements and studies related to analyzing and improving Treasury-wide level programs and processes, including but not limited to business processes, program/policy processes, and/or systems processes in light of long- and short-range organizational goals. Engagements include understanding requirements, current processes, risk management, communications planning, data and root cause analysis, and potential implementation of prototype processes. Engagements will sometimes include the expansion of program/process improvements to similar or related areas of application.
Participate actively as a key advisor to one or several Departmental officials in evaluating management efficiency and effectiveness in the direction of significant operating programs and in planning and implementing new and or improved methods of operation and management control.
Research and investigate new or improved business and management practices for application to agency programs or operations.
Develop potential solutions through coordination with affected organizations and officials at all levels throughout the Department.
Design, develop, and coordinate approval of policy documents, procedures, and other guidance.
Travel Required
Occasional travel - Minimal
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
15

Requirements

Click "Print Preview" to review the entire announcement before applying.
Must be U.S. Citizens or U.S. Nationals
The experience may have been gained in either the public, private sector or volunteer service. One year of experience refers to full-time work; part-time work is considered on a prorated basis. To ensure full credit for your work experience, please indicate dates of employment by month/day/year, and indicate number of hours worked per week on your resume.
Qualifications
You must meet the following requirements within 30 days of the closing date of this announcement.

Specialized experience for the GS-15: You must have one year of specialized experience at a level of difficulty and responsibility equivalent to the GS-14 grade level in the Federal service. Specialized experience for this position includes:
Providing assistance to managers or directors on issues such as problems with and or deficiencies in current operations; AND
Working on a team that applies concepts, practices, and methodologies to manage project plans reflecting experience in areas such as planning, scheduling, budgeting, estimating, cost analysis/control, tracking, reporting or forecasting; AND
Assisting in developing and/or providing input in an organization's strategic plan, workforce plan, project management plans, and/or employee development plans; AND
Working on projects or performing studies that are related to long-range planning and performance improvement. These projects or studies may be in areas such as planning, scheduling, budgeting, estimating, cost analysis/control, tracking, reporting and/or forecasting.
In addition to the above requirements, you must meet the following time-in-grade requirement, if applicable:
For the GS-15, you must have been at the GS-14 level for 52 weeks.
Education

Required Documents
A complete application includes 1. A resume, 2. Vacancy question responses, and 3. Submission of any required documents. Please note that if you do not provide all required information, as specified in this announcement, you may not be considered for this position (or may not receive the special consideration for which you may be eligible).

All applicants are required to submit a resume either by creating one in USAJOBS or uploading one of their own choosing. (Cover letters are optional.) To receive full credit for relevant experience, please list the month/date/year and number of hours worked for experience listed on your resume. We suggest that you preview the online questions, as you may need to customize your resume to ensure that it supports your responses to these questions. Please view resume tips.

CURRENT AND FORMER FEDERAL EMPLOYEES - Documentation Relating to Your Federal Employment:
You must submit a copy of your SF-50, Notification of Personnel Action, which shows your current (or most recent) grade and competitive service status. (The “position occupied” block on the SF-50 should show a “1” and your “tenure” block should show a “1” or “2”.)
If you are currently on a Veterans Recruitment Appointment (VRA), you must submit a copy of an SF-50 showing that. Also, you must submit a copy of your DD214 or other documentation showing dates of service and type of discharge (Member 4) and any other applicable documents such as SF-15, VA letters, etc.
Indicate on your application the highest permanent grade you have held; if this grade is different from your current grade, you must submit a copy of an additional SF-50 showing this grade.

Land Management Eligibles must provide all required documentation to verify eligibility, prior performance, and qualifications for the target position. You can find information on the Land Management Workforce Flexibility Act and eligibility HERE. Land Management Eligibles must compete under competitive merit promotion procedures and meet all applicable requirements as such (time-in-grade restrictions do not apply).

CAREER TRANSITION ASSISTANCE PLAN (CTAP) OR INTERAGENCY CAREER TRANSITION ASSISTANCE PLAN (ICTAP) DOCUMENTATION: If you are a displaced or surplus Federal employee, click CTAP/ICTAP for eligibility and a detailed list of required documents you must submit in order to be eligible.

If you are applying under a special hiring authority (e.g. Military Spouses, Interchange Agreement, VEOA, VRA, Schedule A Disability, etc.), please see applicant guide for required documentation. In order to be eligible under one of these authorities, you must submit all required documentation as outlined in the applicant guide.
If you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:
Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.
Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.

Benefits
A career with the U.S. Government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. As a federal employee, you and your family will have access to a range of benefits that are designed to make your federal career very rewarding. Learn more about federal benefits.
Our comprehensive benefits are very generous. Our benefits package includes:
Challenging work, opportunities for advancement, competitive salaries, bonuses and incentive awards.
Ten paid holidays, 13 days of sick leave, and 13 to 26 days of vacation time each year.
Access to insurance programs that may be continued after you retire.
A wide choice of health insurance plans, coverage for pre-existing conditions, and no waiting periods. We pay a substantial amount (up to 75%) of the health insurance premiums.
A retirement program which includes employer-matching contributions.
Learn more about Federal benefits programs at: https://help.usajobs.gov/index.php/Pay_and_Benefits
Eligibility for benefits depends on the type of position you hold and whether your position is full-time, part-time, or intermittent. Contact the hiring agency for more information on the specific benefits offered.

Title: Project Manager
job description:
Project Manager
Summary:
Under general direction of the Project Management Office Director, the Project Manager will oversee complex projects and communicate with staff, customers, and vendors, make decisions, and monitor the progress of the project to keep it on schedule.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Responsible for planning, overseeing and leading projects from start to finish in a manner that meets business needs, follows best practice PMO, Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) IT Service Management and Agile methodologies to ensure successful execution.
Leading project planning sessions
Consistently use the organization-wide adoption of Project Management Book of Knowledge (PMBOK) and Agile methodologies, standards, tools, systems, processes and continuous improvement activities that align with business needs.
Coordinating staff and internal resources
Managing project progress and adapt work as required
Ensuring projects meet deadlines
Managing relationships with clients and stakeholders
Overseeing all incoming and outgoing project documentation
Participating in tender process i.e. design, submission and review
Designing risk mitigation plan
Conducting project review and creating detailed reports for executive staff
Optimizing and improving processes and the overall approach where necessary
Helps to identify and resolve conflicts of priority or of resource contention
Demonstrated Competencies:
Written and verbal communication skills
Ability to multi-task and manage various project elements simultaneously
Leadership skills
Big-picture thinking and vision
Attention to detail
Conflict resolution skills
Experience with Project Management Book of Knowledge (PMBOK) and Agile methodologies
Deep understanding of Project Management tools
Knowledge of IT Service Management and ITIL in particular
Minimum Education & Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Administration, Engineering, Nursing, Health Information Technology, or related field of study is required.
Five or more years’ experience as a project manager. PMP or Agile certification or willingness to gain within 18 months of joining the team.
Preferred Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree, 5 years experience as Project Manager and Certification, or Master’s Degree, 3 years experience as a Project Manager.
Previous experience in health information technology organization
Agile and ITIL experience.

Title: Scrum Master/Project Manager
job description:
SCRUM MASTER/PROJECT MANAGER
SUMMARY:
The Scrum Master / Project Manager will manage multiple, cross-functional, strategic IT projects and be responsible for Scrum team leadership, daily project management, and administration.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Facilitates and supports all scrum events: Sprint Planning, Daily Scrum, Sprint Review, and Sprint Retrospective.
Acts as a leader who coaches and supports Agile teams assigned to mainly Business as Usual (BAU) work and to a lesser degree, important department initiatives and applicable portions of corporate projects and initiatives.
Develops and improves Agile processes, prioritizes development and improvements, and works alongside key stakeholders to implement.
Guides and coaches the Scrum team on how to use Agile practices and principles to deliver high quality products and services to our customers.
Gets team to a high performing level by recognizing areas of strength and improvement and employing appropriate coaching and development techniques.
Responsible for ensuring Scrum is understood and the team adheres to Scrum theory, practice, and guidelines.
Coaches the Scrum team in self-organization, cross-functional skillset, domain knowledge and communicates effectively, both internally and externally working within the Scrum team.
Works with Scrum team, as well as internal and external stakeholders, to influence and drive decision making and support organizational project or product teams.
Resolves team impediments with other Scrum Masters to increase the effectiveness of the application of Scrum in the organization.
Works with Agile coaches and other Scrum Masters to grow within the role.
Contributes to the advancement and improvement of Agile practices within the organization.
Responsible for leading some waterfall method projects as appropriate.
Consults with leadership and key stakeholders to clarify and define project requirements
Update project scorecards and present project status as required.
Escalates project issues and roadblocks to management for resolution as appropriate.
Ensures projects are completed by the defined schedules.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key third-party vendors as stakeholders in project completion.
Other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Ability To:
Exemplify and promote Agile values and principles
Outstanding communication, facilitation, negotiation, and coaching skills
Knowledge of an agile framework or method (i.e. Scrum, Kanban), or understanding of software development life cycle models as well as in-depth knowledge of traditional project management principles and practices
Adept at refinement, story splitting, estimation, velocity, retrospection, and other Scrum techniques
Planning and problem solving with product management and delivery teams
Manage projects or initiatives from initiation through implementation
Manage large-scale initiatives including stakeholders across business and technical teams
Ability to execute in a fast paced, high demand, environment while balancing multiple priorities
Lead, organize and execute with little or no direction, deliver commitments on time, and to work on a team within a fast pace environment
Work effectively in a team environment and across all organizational levels, where flexibility, collaboration, and adaptability are important
Influence and collaborate at all internal organizational levels
Negotiate, influence, and collaborate to build successful relationships
Effectively communicate up, down and across the organization
Analyze and draw conclusions and make recommendations from data
Clearly and concisely communicate verbally and in writing
Knowledge Of:
Credit Union policies and procedures and products and services offered by the Credit Union
Financial Services digital delivery systems and channels with strong member/customer service experience
Agile project management methodology
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s Degree
Minimum of five years related experience
Demonstrated experience facilitating meetings at multiple levels of an organization and an understanding of facilitation techniques
COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:
Pay Range: $71,200-$106,700
Health, Dental & Vision Benefits
Bonus opportunity
401(k) with match and profit sharing
Paid Time Off

Title: Project Manager
job description:
Position: Project Manager
Location: Atlanta, Georgia (Ability to work Remote)
Travel: 10 – 15%
Position Overview:
The primary duties of this position include successful leadership of multiple projects and key client relationships for projects in our Energy, Transmission and Distribution group
The Project Manager will manage, direct and take ownership of projects (i.e. performance, safety, quality, schedule, and budget) and project management team (i.e. Project Manager, Project Engineer, APM, Superintendent and all field personnel).
This person will be responsible for contract administration, project planning, labor and equipment and resource management. Project Managers will oversee project management team to achieve the best possible outcomes.
The Project Manager is responsible for establishing and maintaining a professional and satisfactory relationship with the Owners, subcontractors, regulatory agencies and other project stakeholders.
Ability to work remote but will require 10 -15% travel to project site for reporting on project milestones, performance, safety, quality, and budget.
Specific Responsibilities:
Manage project successfully from initiation, through estimate, pre-construction, execution, commissioning and closeout.
Ensure project contractual agreements are met and project is performed safely within agreed budget and timeframe
Manage project financial health, approve invoicing and billings, track variance, productivity and report financial performance to executive leadership
Ensure safety, quality and productivity is maintained
Lead negotiate contracts with vendors and approvals when required
Ensure that contracts are fit for purpose, cost effective and incorporate appropriate Service Level Agreements
Assist project manager with establishment of project execution plan and assist project management team with scheduling and coordination for each project.
Work closely with construction management and all field related personnel
Negotiate change orders or commercial agreements that deviate from contact
Source and qualify subcontractors
Identify project risk or potential impacts. Develop recovery plan to mitigate
Assist project manager with client coordination, strategic planning, master scope management, budget finances, subcontracting, project staffing, environmental compliance, facility support and schedule attainment.
Maintain ongoing client satisfaction and identify new business opportunities
Work collaboratively with the Project Controls team to ensure project schedules and costs are managed and tracking to plan
Assist with internal project financials’, staffing, legal coordination, risk management, change management, and human resource issues.
Qualifications:
BS with 12 years of prior relevant experience or MS with 8 – 10 years of prior relevant experience preferred.
Professional Engineering (PE) or Project Management Professional (PMP) or Program Management Professional (PgMP) certification preferred.
Experience with Government, Technical and/or Infrastructural construction project management experience preferred
Excellent written & verbal communication skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work remote
Valid driver's license required.

Title: Project Manager III - IV (14245575)
job description:
The Texas Workforce Commission (TWC), a Family Friendly Certified Workplace, is seeking a Project Manager III-IV to join the IT Planning and Project Management Department located at 1411 Brazos Street, Austin, Texas.
HOW TO APPLY:
To be considered, please complete a State of Texas Application for Employment and submit apply online https://www.workintexas.com (Preferred Method)
Remember, to Apply to any TWC positions - you must apply by choosing the State of Texas Job Application method.
Benefits to working for TWC include:
- Competitive starting salary: $7,000.00 - $8,750.00/month
- Defined Retirement Benefit Plan
- Optional 401(k) and 457 accounts
- Medical Insurance - Currently, the state pays 100% of the health plan premium for eligible full-time employees and 50% of the premium for their eligible dependents. Eligible part-time employees get a 50% state contribution for themselves and 25% for their dependents. Employees pay the remainder of the premium by paycheck deduction before taxes are withheld.
- Optional Benefits such as dental, vision, and life insurance
- 8 hours sick leave per month
- 8 hours vacation leave per month with potential to earn more with longevity
- Employee Assistance Program (EAP) services
- Additional benefits for active employees: https://www.ers.texas.gov/Active-Employees/Health-Benefits.
The Project Manager performs complex (journey-level) to advanced (senior-level) project management work. Work involves coordinating the planning and initiation of projects at various levels of completion; monitoring the progress and schedule of projects; and communicating with project stakeholders, management, and other relevant parties. May assign duties and responsibilities and coordinate the work of project staff. Works under general to limited supervision, with moderate to extensive latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.
This position is eligible for telecommuting. Qualified candidates must have a secure, dedicated work space with Internet service, ability to maintain a reliable consistent work schedule and be available for weekly meetings and group collaboration via Microsoft Teams and other applications during regular business hours. Position may require team members to come into the office for scheduled meetings, and there may be unscheduled request with 72-hour notice for any TWC business need.
GENERAL DUTIES:
- Performs project and contract management work including; detailed project planning, oversight and tracking, contractor procurement including state procurement processes, invoicing and budget tracking.
- Manages software development projects through the full Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
- Follows all applicable contracting, procurement and project management practices to ensure quality of deliverables.
- Ensures project tasks and products follow the development process and quality guidelines while meeting both functional and contractual requirements.
- Works with staff and contractors throughout the organization to coordinate, plan, assign, supervise, and evaluate the work of the project staff in a matrixed organization structure.
- Manages deliverable content expectations, review processes, and acceptance criteria.
- Assists with IT Investment Management process and related meeting materials; may facilitate meetings.
- May facilitate and oversee preparation of project proposals and change requests to ensure good information for decision makers; coordinate as needed within the IT Division for cost estimation and impact assessment.
- Provides guidance on and promote use of agency project management practices.
- Develops and manage project budgets, schedules, work plans, resource requirements, and cost estimates and projections.
- Communicates with the project stakeholders, management, and other relevant parties.
- Ensures all project managers and project team members understand the project standards and be able resolve challenges with the quality of any party's work products.
- Mentors project managers and ensure proper project management practices are used on projects.
- Assist project managers with troubleshooting project issues.
- May develop Deliverable Based Information Technology (DBITS) Statement of Work (SOW), Requests for Offers (RFO) and/or staff augmentation requests.
- Prepares and oversees all phases of Texas Project Delivery Framework documentation.
- Monitors and evaluates third-party vendor and contractor performance.
- Performs related work as assigned.
PREFERRED QUAILIFICATIONS:
- Eight years' experience in managing large, complex projects throughout all development phases, vendor procurement, and contract management with a minimum of two years in a progressive growth, leadership-responsible position(s).
- Experience in systems analysis, design, and requirements gathering.
- Ability to analyze complex information and develop plans to address identified issues.
- Negotiation and facilitation skills.
- Experience in structured design and development process, scope control, project estimation, risk mitigation, and preventive and corrective actions for overruns.
- Strong leadership, communication, and organization skills with attention to detail.
- Project Management Professional (PMP) or formal project management training and/or certification.
REQUIRED Important: Formal Certified Texas Contract Manager (CTCM) certification and Certified Texas Contract Developer (CTCD) certification or must obtain certification within one year of employment and maintain throughout employment.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Project Manager III: Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university plus four years of full-time experience in project management work, business analysis, or project administration; or four years of full-time experience in the oversight of an agency program; or in strategic planning and policy implementation.
Project Manager IV: Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university plus five years of full-time experience in project management work, business analysis, or project administration; or five years of full-time experience in the oversight of an agency program or in strategic planning and policy implementation.
Substitutions for Both: Twelve semester hours of graduate study from an accredited college or university may be substituted for each year of the required qualifying experience with a maximum substitution of three years.
A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university may be substituted for the required qualifying experience with a maximum substitution of three years.
One additional year of full-time qualifying experience may be substituted for each year (30 semester hours) of the required education.
VETERANS:
Use your military skills to qualify for this position or other jobs! Go to www.texasskillstowork.com to translate your military work experience and training courses into civilian job terms, qualifications and skill sets. Also, you can compare this position to military occupations (MOS) at the Texas State Auditor's Office by pasting this link into your browser: www.hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_ProgramManagement.pdf
HOW TO APPLY:
To be considered, please complete a State of Texas Application for Employment and submit apply online https://www.workintexas.com (Preferred Method)
Remember, to Apply to any TWC positions - you must apply by choosing the State of Texas Job Application method.
TWC is not considering applications from persons who require sponsorship for an employment visa.
A position utilizing this classification will be designated as security sensitive according to the Texas Labor Code, Section 301.042.

Title: Project Manager - FULL TIME
job description:
Holey Cream, an NYC staple in dessert and confections is seeking a Full Time Project Manager.
The correct candidate should have some experience working in a fast-paced restaurant environment, in any position (Front of House, or Back of House both acceptable).
We are seeking someone to not only work in the stores as part of the workforce, but also contribute to a revamp of our social media presence, in store presentation materials, training procedures, and scripted daily operating protocols for all levels of employee.
The right candidate should be eager to contribute to improving the brand and stores, as well as willing to learn the current business model. A positive attitude, critical thinking skills, and a desire to grow in the industry are all a must.
This is an opportunity to learn the ins and outs of a successful delivery heavy operation, a skill that is now more profitable and desired than ever before, due to the current industry restrictions. The chosen candidate will be expected to spend approximately 20 to 30 hours a week in the stores and can expect to have an addition 10 to 20 hours a week of administrative, marketing, and management training related tasks.
Serious applications will be considered, and video interviews will be set up with all qualified candidates.

Title: Project Manager
job description:
For The Record (FTR) provides transformational digital solutions to justice partners across the globe, centered on the production of accurate and timely court records. We already provide digital recording systems to thousands of courts in all 50 US states and over 60 countries. Over the last several months, COVID has forced justice to rethink every established norm in the wake of physical closures. We are currently experiencing a monumental shift in technology adoption and have an extremely compelling suite of SaaS offerings to attack this challenge.
Our solutions can reduce the time for an appeal, minimize wrongful convictions, increase transparency, provide access and reveal inherit biases in the legal systems. If you’re motivated to meaningfully evolve justice in your community, the US and the globe, you’ll find a group of like-minded individuals at For The Record.
Our global headquarters are in the US, with development teams in the US and Australia. In the US, we are a dynamic team that wear many hats, with backgrounds in consultancy, law, tech, courts, audio and more.
The Project Manager will be responsible for managing multiple, concurrent projects with key client deliverables utilizing proven project management methodology. To be successful in this role you will develop and execute on a documented project plan, tracking and coordinating all aspects of complex client installations to deliver on-time and within budget. The project manager will exceed customer expectations, delivering timely and successful installations to customer sites, underpinned with exceptional communication.
The Project Manager will:
Be the primary contact for external clients with successful management of customer and stakeholder relationships with the ability to work in harmony with the customer and their staff to achieve the desired outcome
Assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility
Develop a detailed project plan to monitor and track progress
Manage changes to the project scope, project schedule, and project costs using appropriate verification techniques
Implement and verify compliance of change management procedures and expediting client approved Variation Orders as a result of changes to baseline schedules and budgets
Register proposed changes, the accurate costing and scheduling of changes, updating current schedules and budgets for approved changes
Ensure resource availability and allocation
Measure project performance using appropriate tools and techniques
Report and escalate to senior management as needed
Perform risk management to minimize project risks and maintain risk registers for all projects
Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendors
Customer Service
Deliver outcomes in a timely manner that meet objectives
Ensure accurate, timely and informative responses, reports & deliverables to customer enquiries
Promote a customer focused culture that is aligned to the FTR business requirements and values
Teamwork/Communication
Collaboration across all business units to ensure timely delivery in accordance with customer expectations
Demonstration of willingness to support teams
Flexibility to meet deadlines and deal with competing priorities
Responsible for monitoring and assessing potential hazardous or unsafe situations and developing measures to assure personal safety
Other duties as required
Essential Work Experience, Qualifications and Skills
8-10 years of proven experience as a Project Manager
Prior experience using project management software
PMP Certification
Proven working experience in project management in the information technology/ audio technology sector
Prior experience with commercial technical installations
Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills
Excellent time management skills
Excellent business writing and verbal communication skills
Solid organizational skills
Refined attention to detail
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office
Excellent negotiation skills
Proven ability to manage deadlines and budgetary limitations
Ability to work calmly under pressure, multitask and prioritize

Ability to build strong and effective working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders across different cultures
Desirable work experience, qualifications and skills
Legal industry/Court services experience
Technical knowledge of AV Implementations

Interstate and/or International travel will be required

Eanes ISD is currently seeking a Bond Project Manager! We offer great pay and benefits!!!

Knowledge of using project management software.
Knowledge of established OSHA laws and safety requirements.
Ability to read and understand blue prints.

Manage day-to-day operational aspects of multiple, concurrent projects including the facilitation of client/team meetings, communication of status, change control process and problem resolution/escalation.

Establish and maintain regular written and face-to-face communication; develop and maintain technical documentation related to assigned functions and responsibilities.

Title: Electrical Control Testing Engineer
job description:
Job Title: Electrical Control Testing Engineer
Type: Contract to hire
Location: Alpharetta, GA
Pay Rate: $50-55/hour
SUMMARY:
As a Testing Engineer you will assist the assembly and design team in all phases of the manufacturing of control panels and cabinets from proposals, design, engineering, assembly, testing, and commissioning. Your main responsibility will be testing equipment before customer Factory Acceptance Test (FAT).
RESPONSIBILITIES:
· Ensure safety and reliability items are adhered to during all phases of the project
· Ensure testing is completed according to testing documentation
· Verify that the engineering logic is consistent with the control narrative and flowcharts
· Complete necessary quality control documentation to confirm completed parts meet customer specifications
· Review design logic in coordination with other engineers
· Identify manufactured defects through testing and review with production team
· Develop or modify testing procedures with the Testing Lead to ensure inspection is proficient and effective
· Perform FAT testing for the customer
· Learn various HMI used within the organization
· Integrated testing of hardware and application software; software in a simulated environment to validate process flow and integrity
· Issue final test reports and share with the team
QUALIFICATIONS:
· Associate’s degree in related technical field or 10 years of professional engineering experience
· Oil and Gas or Electrical Generation experience
· Siemens Step7, Siemens TIA Portal, Wonderware, and GE PLC’s programming and logic troubleshooting
· Ability to perform loop checks
· Read and understand P&ID drawings and electrical wiring drawings
· Experience with various control systems including PLC programming and troubleshooting (Siemens, Allen Bradley), HMI programming (Siemens, Wonderware)
· Knowledge of Modbus, OPC, Data Highway +
· General understanding of gas turbines and compressor processes
· In-depth understanding of pressure switches and transmitters, control valves, flukes, motor control circuits, and intrinsic isolators
ADDITIONAL PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
· Triconex
· Dresser Rand (DR) HMI
· Rolls Royce Gas Turbines
· Compressor operations knowledge
ABOUT NES:
Established in 1978, NES Global Talent is an award-winning manpower specialist that provides candidates across the Oil & Gas, Power, Construction & Infrastructure, Life Sciences, Manufacturing, Chemicals, Mining and IT sectors worldwide. We provide guaranteed staffing solutions, sourced from a global talent pool by a dedicated, discipline specific team of over 500 consultants.

Title: Technical Support Specialist Senior
job description:
Job Ad
Gainesville Regional Utilities' Water/Wastewater Engineering Department has an opening for a Technical Support Specialist, Senior. The Water/Wastewater Engineering Department is seeking a results-driven leader who enjoys complex water and wastewater treatment facility construction administration and inspection work to join our team. This position will primarily oversee the field activities for the MSWRF Capacity and Renewal Upgrade with other projects as assigned.

Typical duties will include but not be limited to:
Become familiar with GRU W/WW treatment facility standards relating to the installation and maintenance of water/wastewater treatment facility infrastructure
Manage contractor performance and confirm conformance with project requirements, and understand construction contract provisions
Have knowledge of electrical, instrumentation, controls, and SCADA systems in a wastewater treatment facility
Have knowledge of structural concrete, reinforcement, asphalt pavement, site drainage, building and architectural drawing review and construction methods
Construction inspection services for site civil, structure, mechanical, electrical, and controls disciplines.
Maintaining records and databases related to inspection reports
Read and review pay applications, requests for information, requests for quotation, clarifications, and change orders.
Read and understand Construction Standards Institute (CSI) Master Format Specifications.
Review and provide feedback on design and construction deliverables.
Work with others to coordinate Water and Wastewater record documents including mapping and drawing markup
Have knowledge of wastewater treatment facilities and how they operate, and utilize the knowledge to participate in construction sequencing discussions.
Troubleshoot issues related to construction activities at water and wastewater treatment facilities. These troubleshooting activities include issues with piping, pumps, rotating mechanical equipment, electrical equipment, and computer and controls equipment.
Work and coordinate with contractors, GRU personnel, engineers, and others to produce effective project results
Work under pressure in emergency response situation.
Start-up and commissioning activities for transfer of constructed facilities to long term operation.
Support construction administration tasks for Project Manager and other team members
Attends work on a continuous and regular basis
A valid Florida Driver's License is required and must be maintained throughout employment in this position
Other duties as directed

Preference will be given to those candidates who have extensive experience with in Water/Wastewater treatment facilities contracting, design, and construction activities. This candidate would be experienced and effective in facilitating facility training and start-up. Ideal candidate will be a self-motivated leader, customer-oriented, have good communication skills, both orally and written, and have the ability to stay calm during difficult situations.

To be considered for the Technical Support Specialist, Senior position you must have:
An Associate degree from an accredited college or university or vocational school with major course work in an technical or engineering specialty, and six (6) years of experience in engineering or technical support relevant to the needs of the department that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities, (2) two years of which were at the Technical Support Specialist 3 level, or;
Graduation from high school or possession of an acceptable equivalency diploma, and eight (8) years of experience in engineering or technical support relevant to the needs of the department that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities, (2) two years of which at the Technical Support Specialist 3 level, or
An equivalent combination of education, training and experience which provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities

NOTES:

Work requires use of personal protection equipment including hearing protection, eye protection, foot protection, hand protection, and head protection. Work may require exposure to prolonged high noise levels, inclement weather, hazardous conditions and noxious chemicals, climbing in high places and working in confined spaces.
**May fill multiple positions.**
**May establish an eligibility list for future hiring.**
**May underfill position.**
**May require additional assessments to fill the position.**

Job Description
SUMMARY
This is highly skilled and complex technical, administrative, and related work supporting the activities of engineers in project design, mathematical/statistical work, contract support and other business-related tasks.
Positions allocated to this classification report to a designated supervisor or engineer and work under limited supervision. Work in this class is distinguished by its lack of direct supervisory responsibilities and by its responsibility for the most complex technical support assignments, as well as its lead worker/coordinator role related to assigned technical and administrative duties. Individuals assigned to this classification have a high degree of technical expertise and have considerable latitude in making decisions.
EXAMPLES OF WORK*
This section of the job description is not intended to be a comprehensive list of duties and responsibilities of the position. The omission of a specific job function does not absolve an employee from being required to perform additional tasks incidental to or inherent in the job. Performance of lower level duties may be required.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Depending on area of assignment:
Designs and prepares highly technical and complex plans, systems, routes, specifications, and cost estimates for changes, additions, and deletions to engineering projects in accordance with acceptable engineering standards, procedures and methods established for the area of assignment. Prepares supporting documents related to engineering surveys and projects.
Prepares complex technical specifications for engineering drawings, maps, and documents. Prepares "as built" drawings on new and established services or facilities. Prepares detailed finished design drawings.
Reviews private development and/or city plans for conformance to codes and standards; monitors developer extensions to completion; coordinates with appropriate personnel to insure that standards are met before city or utility acceptance of constructed facilities.
Prepares complex construction drawings, sketches, cost estimates, and work orders and works with customers, contractors, and developers on facilities' plans.
Provides administrative and technical support on complex construction, maintenance, and repair projects.
Assists with revision of plans for contracted improvement projects by consulting engineering firms.
Coordinates with other technical staff and engineers to design, develop and maintain databases for drawings, manuals, records, work order management, billing activities, fee calculations, research, Stormwater management, and photos. Develops and coordinates preparation of appropriate reports from database.
Compiles engineering statistics, calculates trends, rates of change, and other complex and technical mathematical functions.
Evaluates materials for conformance to technical specifications and investigates causes of material failures.
Prepares engineering analysis of modest difficulty and writes specifications and reports.
Prepares complex forecasts, studies, technical reports and related items.
Conducts field inspections of complex construction work and ensures projects are in compliance with all standards and regulations established for projects. Assists in resolving issues of non-compliance.
Coordinates with other technical staff to verify information and permits for utility, public works, and transportation service applications. Serves as the representative of the city or the utility to respond to public inquiries.
Coordinates, designs, and delivers technical training and/or mentoring to other technical employees and/or interns.
Responds to reports of pollutants; investigates, identifies and traces to source. Coordinates clean-up of hazardous incidents.
Provides technical guidance, assistance and/or interpretation to others. May provide limited supervision or coordination of work of one or more technicians, and other support personnel who assist in specific discipline.
Prepares, maintains, updates, and issues technical publications, standards, manuals, and guides used by employees, vendors, and contractors.
Coordinates activities with contractors, city departments and state and federal regulatory agencies.
Responds to public inquiries on complex projects and provides technical information to other agencies.
Under general direction, may contribute to the preparation of long- and short-range master plan studies.
Maintains currency in work processes and procedures, computer software and hardware, and other tools used in the routine accomplishment of work tasks.
Responsible for training lower level Technical Support Specialists.
Prepares field surveys and notes regarding customer/citizen property, equipment and facilities.
Monitors and documents new construction progress, in writing and photographically.
Works with engineers and other higher-level personnel to prepare cost estimates for equipment, materials, and labor. Incumbents are expected to provide high-level but preliminary design work in support of the budget process.
Calculates statistical information related to engineering projects, statistical trends, rates of change, percentages, etc. and tabulates plots and formats the results.
Directs and reviews the work of contractors or vendors.
Attends work on a continuous and regular basis.
NON-ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Depending on area of assignment:
Contributes to the preparation of the annual budget.
Coordinates drawing transmittal/receipt from outside engineering firms and contractors.
Assembles electronically produced bid packages for department.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job function satisfactorily. Below are the required education, experience, knowledge, skills and abilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Associate degree from an accredited college or university or vocational school with major course work in an technical or engineering specialty relevant to the needs of the hiring department, and six (6) years of experience in engineering or technical support relevant to the needs of the department that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities, (2) two years of which were at the Technical Support Specialist 3 level, or
Graduation from high school or possession of an acceptable equivalency diploma, and eight (8) years of experience in engineering or technical support relevant to the needs of the department that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities, (2) two years of which at the Technical Support Specialist 3 level,
or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience which provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
CERTIFICATIONS OR LICENSES
Licenses
Valid Florida Driver's License required.

Certifications
None.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Depending on area of assignment:
Thorough knowledge of principles and practices of related specialty.
Thorough knowledge of mathematics through trigonometry and its application to engineering computations.
Thorough knowledge and associated skills used with Computer Aided Design (CAD) software, equipment and materials, and ability to produce professional quality finished engineering drawings, sketches, and charts. Specific software may vary depending on area of assignment.
Thorough knowledge of rules, regulations, policies, and procedures applicable to utilities, public works, and/or transportation.
Thorough knowledge of federal, state and local laws, codes, ordinances and standards incidental to municipal and utility engineering and development.
Thorough knowledge of real property, legal descriptions, and right-of-way acquisitions.
Thorough knowledge of construction standards and specifications, methods and materials used to construct and operate electric, water, or wastewater utility systems, stormwater systems, and roads and highways.
Thorough knowledge of Geographic Information and Mapping Systems (GIS) as it is utilized within assigned division or department.
Thorough knowledge of databases, spreadsheets, word processing and computer utilities and operating systems.
Ability to perform complex technical engineering computations, analyze technical data, and complete complex technical assignments.
Ability to interpret and utilize legal descriptions in routine completion of work.
Ability to perform work substantially on own with minimal supervision.
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with superiors, subordinates, contractors, engineers, property owners and the general public.
PHYSICAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL REQUIREMENTS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must possess certain physical abilities and be able to withstand work related environmental conditions.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Depending on area of assignment:
Work may require physical strength, agility and dexterity to safely perform all essential job functions including the ability to lift, carry, push, or pull 50 pounds without assistance and to stand, kneel and stoop.
Ability to climb and descend stairs and ladders.
Must communicate orally, see physical surroundings, listen, hear others, respond to oral commands, and demonstrate good communication skills.
Must be able to perform sedentary work on an uninterrupted basis.
On call work outside of business hours is required.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Depending on area of assignment:
Work may require exposure to hazardous conditions and noxious chemicals.
Work may require performance of duties in extreme heat and confined areas.
Work may require performance of tasks outdoors under varying climatic conditions
Work is performed in an office environment with moderate noise levels.
May be required to attend designated training either on-the-job or course-work.

Title: Electromechanical Manufacturing Engineer II
job description:
Electromechanical Manufacturing Engineer II
Location: Tucson, AZ USA
Phocos is a global manufacturer of solar components and solutions for off-grid power supplies. With the one of the widest global sales, engineering and production networks in the Solar PV Industry, Phocos provides high-quality solutions that bring reliable light and electricity Anywhere, Any Time, Any-GridTM. With over 1 billion people in the world living without access to reliable energy, we have work to do, and we want you to join our team to help us reduce that number substantially.
Phocos is currently seeking an Electromechanical Manufacturing Engineer II to support our global R&D and Supply Chain teams.
Reporting to the Head of Engineering, the Electromechanical Manufacturing Engineer II is an integral part of the Product Engineering team. They are responsible for preparing, compiling and maintaining all production engineering documentation for Phocos-designed products and support our global manufacturing sites through relevant mechanical assembly drawings for box-build, packaging and labelling. In addition, this position will implement and operate a global ISO9001 Quality Management System (“QMS”) for the Phocos Group as part of its core functions. The Electromechanical Manufacturing Engineer II also acts as the primary intermediary between Phocos’ core electronics design team and its various global manufacturing sites, managing continual improvement processes as well as design for manufacture (“DFM”) initiatives.
Responsibilities:
Prepares, compiles and maintains detailed manufacturing build specifications, drawings, bill of materials and other related production documentation for all Phocos-designed products to aid production.
Creates 3D CAD models, drawings, part lists and other relevant documentation to aid production of Phocos products at outsourced manufacturing sites.
Oversees and executes the testing of prototype, trial production and mass production builds, evaluates and clearly documents test results and makes recommendations to R&D and Production sites.
Implements and operates global QMS according to latest ISO9001 and other relevant quality standards.
Collaborates with core R&D team to implement design changes to continuously improve manufacturability of Phocos-designed products and prepares clear, thorough engineering change reports to aid production sites.
Serves as primary Engineering contact for NRTL certification processes for Phocos-designed products.
Assists Management and Supply Chain with qualification of new assembly sub-contractors to support Phocos’ global manufacturing strategy.
Knowledge/Skills/Competencies
Strong experience with electromechanical manufacturing process with emphasis on quality control and preparation of production build materials for box-build assemblies.
Previous experience with production power electronics, low-voltage devices desired.
Proficient in developing 3D CAD models using latest CAD modeling software platforms.
Previous experience with Autodesk Fusion360 desired.
Previous success with implementing, and/or executing internal ISO9001 QMS in an electronics manufacturing environment which included SCAR, NCR, CPAR and CAPA.
Deep understanding of relevant electronics quality standards including ISO9001, IPC-A-610, IPC-A-620.
Previous experience with PPAP procedures with emphasis on PFMEA, DFMEA, control plans, PFD, and process capability studies.
Demonstrated aptitude in managing multiple concurrent projects via effective time- and project-management techniques.
Thorough record-keeping and documentation skills.
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with a wide variety of internal and external stakeholders.
Self-motivated, team player.
Able to work effectively cross-functionally and with other global offices to achieve objectives.
Occasional overnight travel is required up to 20%
COVID-19 DISCLAIMER: As of the posting date of this position, all company-related travel is postponed until further notice from Phocos management to protect the safety of all Phocos employees and combat the spread of COVID-19.
Required Experience:
5+ years of experience in a production-support Engineering role.
5+ years with 3D CAD modelling.
Previous experience with full-box electromechanical assemblies.
Previous experience with implementing and/or executing an internal ISO9001 QMS.
Previous experience working with colleagues and sub-contractors in an international setting.
Fluent in English (Spanish, Mandarin, Cantonese, and/or German a plus)
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Engineering, Systems Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Electrical Engineering.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
Experience:
Manufacturing: 5 years (Required)
Quality management: 5 years (Required)
Engineering: 5 years (Required)
Autodesk Fusion360: 1 year (Preferred)
CAD: 3 years (Preferred)
Language:
English (Required)
Spanish (Preferred)
Mandarin (Preferred)
German (Preferred)

www.phocos.com

Yes, temporarily due to COVID-19

Personal protective equipment provided or required
Social distancing guidelines in place

Title: ELECTRICAL ENGINEER
Company: US Department of the Air Force
job description:
Duties
Summary
Click on "" button below to view Eligibilities being considered and other IMPORTANT information.

The primary purpose of this position is to serve as a professional electrical engineer, performing design, project programming and construction management/monitoring duties in support of a military installation.
Responsibilities
Performs planning and design work for substantial multi-phase new construction, renovations, and improvement projects for real property facilities, including utility systems, utilizing a professional knowledge of electrical engineering.
Manages projects for construction and improvements to real property facilities and maintains surveillance over contractors using knowledge of engineering and architecture disciplines to ensure compliance with contracted specifications.
Plans, programs, budgets, and executes required projects in support of assigned programs.
Performs work in facilities operations and maintenance (O/M) functions.
Provides consulting services and project coordination.
Collects data and evaluates factors which affect the application of concepts, principles, theories, and methods required to observe, examine, measure, analyze, map, and describe physical and technical features and phenomena.
Complies with health, safety, and environmental rules and procedures and performs work in a manner that enhances the safety of the work environment.
Travel Required
Occasional travel - May be required to travel by military and/or commercial aircraft to perform temporary duty assignments.
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
12
Job family (Series)
0850 Electrical Engineering
Similar jobs
Electrical Engineers
Engineers, Electrical
Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
U.S. Citizenship Required
Males must be registered for Selective Service, see www.sss.gov
A SECRET security clearance may be required
Recruitment incentives may/may not be authorized
This position is subject to provisions of the DoD Priority Placement Program
Position may be subject to pre-employment and random drug testing
Employee must maintain current certifications
Disclosure of Political Appointments
Work may occasionally require travel away from the normal duty station on military and commercial aircraft.
The work may require the employee to drive a motor vehicle. An appropriate, valid driver?s license may be required for the position.
May act as project liaison with the Army Corps of Engineers or other design agencies as required.
May be required to serve on A/E selection boards.
Must meet the Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act (DAWIA) requirements applicable to the duties of the position. The selectee will have up to 24 months to meet the applicable mandatory experience, education, and training requirements.
Qualifications
In order to qualify, you must meet the specialized experience requirements described in the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Qualification Standards for General Schedule Positions, Standard for Professional and Scientific Positions.

BASIC REQUIREMENT OR INDIVIDUAL OCCUPATIONAL REQUIREMENT:

https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/0800/files/all-professional-engineering-positions-0800.pdf

In addition to meeting the basic requirement above, to qualify for this position you must also meet the qualification requirements listed below:

SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE: Applicants must have at least one (1) year of specialized experience at the next lower grade GS-11, or equivalent in other pay systems. Examples of specialized experience includes preparing, developing, or reviewing design calculations, cost estimates, schedules, underlying analysis, technical drawings, and specifications related to a wide variety of projects to include electrical distribution
systems, interior electrical systems, cathodic protection, airfield, street, parking and facility lighting, Industrial Internet Control Systems (IICS) and other systems of major size and complexity for use on airfields in multi-story office buildings, large utility plants, hospitals, hangars, flight simulators, and similar structures. Evaluating design objectives and identifying most economical and efficient procedures for building and electrical distribution design and performance, considering all functional and aesthetic requirements. Applying standard electrical engineering theory and practices to create engineering solutions without technical instruction or guidance and identifying limits of the problems involved.

FEDERAL TIME-IN-GRADE (TIG) REQUIREMENT FOR GENERAL SCHEDULE (GS) POSITIONS: Merit promotion applicants must meet applicable time-in-grade requirements to be considered eligible. One year at the GS-11 level is required to meet the time-in-grade requirements for the GS-12 level. TIG applies if you are in a current GS position or held a GS position within the previous 52 weeks. NOTE: Applicants applying as VEOA candidates who are current GS civil service employees or are prior GS civil service employees within the past 52 weeks must also meet time-in-grade requirements.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (KSAs): Your qualifications will be evaluated on the basis of your level of knowledge, skills, abilities and/or competencies in the following areas:

1. Professional knowledge of electrical engineering concepts, principles, and practices and familiarity with
architectural and other engineering disciplines.

2. Knowledge of a broad range of engineering and construction standards, methods, practices, and techniques, materials, and equipment to determine compliance with federal, state, and local codes and regulations; of standard contracting regulations, practices, and procedures as it relates to facilities engineering; knowledge of health, safety, and environmental requirements as outlined in applicable standards, regulations, and/or technical orders; of environmental principles, practices, procedures, laws, regulations, and current legislative issues; of work classifications and the regulatory and statutory restrictions on the expenditures of appropriated and non-appropriated funds.

3. Knowledge of automated data processing concepts, systems capabilities, and economic usage to effectively accomplish assigned functions; and knowledge of program planning and budgeting cycles, financial control and budget systems and management.

4. Knowledge of aesthetic and functional design techniques and skill in preparing project documentation, to include preliminary drawings, sketches, and construction drawings; and technique / skill in drafting sufficient to convey design concepts and ideas and formulate working drawings.

5. Ability to plan, conduct and record site/facilities surveys and inspection; to analyze, interpret, and apply results, rules, regulations, and procedures in a variety of situations and recommend timely and economical solutions.

6. Ability to plan and organize work and coordinate with other engineering disciplines and architects; and
communicate effectively both orally and in writing and maintain good working relationships.

PART-TIME OR UNPAID EXPERIENCE: Credit will be given for appropriate unpaid and or part-time work. You must clearly identify the duties and responsibilities in each position held and the total number of hours per week.

VOLUNTEER WORK EXPERIENCE: Refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service Programs (i.e., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student and social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge and skills that can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.
Education
IF USING EDUCATION TO QUALIFY: If position has a positive degree requirement or education forms the basis for qualifications, you MUST submit transcriptswith the application. Official transcripts are not required at the time of application; however, if position has a positive degree requirement, qualifying based on education alone or in combination with experience, transcripts must be verified prior to appointment. An accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education must accredit education. Click here to check accreditation.

FOREIGN EDUCATION: Education completed in foreign colleges or universities may be used to meet the requirements. You must show proof the education credentials have been deemed to be at least equivalent to that gained in conventional U.S. education program. It is your responsibility to provide such evidence when applying.
Additional information
Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP): For information on how to apply as an ICTAP eligible click here. To be best qualified and exercise selection priority for this vacancy, displaced Federal employees must be rated 90 or above for this position. You must submit a copy of the agency notice, your most recent performance rating, and your most recent SF-50 noting position, grade level, and duty location.

Employed Annuitants (Reemployed Annuitants): Applicants in receipt of an annuity based on civilian employment in the Federal Service are subject to the DoD Policy on The Employment of Annuitants. Click here for more information.

120-Day Register: This announcement may result in a 120-day register that may be used to fill like vacancies for 120 days after the closing date. Applicants may be referred for consideration as vacancies occur.

Military Spouse Preference (MSP) Eligible: MPS applicants, if determined best qualified, must be selected at the full performance level and placed at the full performance level. You must include a copy of the Military Spouse PPP Self-Certification Checklist dated within 30 days along with the documents identified on the checklist to verify your eligibility for MSP. Click here to obtain a copy of the Military Spouse PPP Self-Certification Checklist.

Direct Deposit: All federal employees are required to have direct deposit.

If you have questions regarding this announcement and have hearing or speech difficulties click here.

Tax Law Impact for PCS: On 22-Dec-2017, Public Law 115-97 - the "Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017" suspended qualified moving expense deductions along with the exclusion for employer reimbursements and payments of moving expenses effective 01-Jan-2018 for tax years 2018 through 2025. The law made taxable certain reimbursements and other payments, including driving mileage, airfare and lodging expenses, en-route travel to the new duty station, and temporary storage of those items. The Federal Travel Regulation Bulletin (FTR) 18-05 issued by General Services Administration (GSA) has authorized agencies to use the Withholding Tax Allowance (WTA) and Relocation Income Tax Allowance (RITA) to pay for "substantially all" of the increased tax liability resulting from the "2018 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act" for certain eligible individuals. For additional information on WTA/RITA allowances and eligibilities please click here. Subsequently, FTR Bulletin 20-04 issued by GSA, provides further information regarding NDAA FY2020, Public Law 116-92, and the expansion of eligibility beyond "transferred" for WTA/RITA allowances. For additional information, please click here.

How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
Your application package (resume, supporting documents, and responses to the questionnaire) will be used to determine your eligibility, qualifications, and quality ranking for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your rating or consideration for employment.

The resume/documents you submit must support your responses to the online questionnaire. If your application contradicts or does not support your questionnaire responses, you will receive a rating of "not qualified" or "insufficient information" and you will not receive further consideration for this job.

For additional information on what to include in your resume, click here.

Applicants who meet the requirements for and apply as a non-competitive eligible that meet minimal qualifications and other requirements of this position, will be given consideration as a non-competitive candidate and will be referred unless blocked by an individual with priority/preference.

APPRAISALS/AWARDS: Hiring Managers use objective methods and consider previous performance appraisals and awards in the selection process. Current Federal Civilian employees should list any relevant performance related rating and/or awards in your resume.

Applicants who disqualify themselves will not be evaluated further.
Background checks and security clearance
Security clearance
Secret
Drug test required
Yes
Required Documents
Required Documents
The following documents are required and must be provided with your application. Applicants who do not submit required documentation to determine eligibility and qualifications will be eliminated from consideration. Other documents may be required based on the eligibility/eligibilities you are claiming. Click here to view the AF Civilian Employment Eligibility Guide and the required documents you must submit to substantiate the eligibilities you are claiming.
Online Application: Questionnaire
Resume: For qualification determinations your resume must contain hours worked per week (if part-time) and dates of employment (i.e., month/year to month/year or month/year to present). If your resume does not contain this information, your application may be marked as insufficient and you will not receive consideration for this position. If you are a current Federal employee or previous Federal employee, provide your pay plan, series and grade, i.e. GS-0301-09. Current Federal Civilian Employees should list any relevant performance related rating (given within the last three years) and/or incentive awards in your resume. Do NOT include photographs (or links to social media such as LinkedIn), inappropriate material, inappropriate content, nor personal information such as age, gender, religion, social security number, etc., on your resume.
Transcripts/Registration/License: If qualifying on education/position requires education, you must submit copies of your transcripts and if required for the position, submit an active, current registration/license.
Veterans: If claiming VEOA, VRA or 30% Disabled Veteran - Submit VOW certification memo or copy of the official DD-Form 214, which must include the character of service (i.e., with an honorable or general discharge). This will be annotated in block 24 on member copy 2, 4, or 7 of the DD-Form 214. If claiming 30% Disabled Veteran, you must also submit a VA Letter or a disability determination from a branch of the Armed Forces. NOTE: All veterans claiming 10-point preference must also submit a SF-15.
Current or Former Federal Civilian Employees (includes current Air Force employees): You must submit a legible copy of your most recent SF-50, Notification of Personnel Action. The SF-50, block 24 must contain "1" or "2" AND block 34 must be a "1". Employees eligible under an OPM approved interchange agreement, block 34 may contain a "1" or "2".
Promotion Consideration: If you wish to be considered as a promotion candidate and your SF-50 has an effective date within the past year, it may not clearly demonstrate you meet the one-year time-in-grade requirements. You will need to provide additional SF-50s which clearly demonstrates you meet the time-in-grade requirements (examples of appropriate SF-50s include Promotions, Within-Grade, Grade/Range Increases, and SF-50s with an effective date more than one year old).
ACTIVE DUTY SERVICE MEMBERS: The VOW Act requires federal agencies to treat an eligible active duty service member as a veteran, disabled veteran, and preference eligible (as applicable) when applying for civil service positions before the effective release or discharge date. Appointment of military members before the release or discharge date is permissible if the member is on terminal leave. At the time the active duty member applies for a civil position, he or she must submit a "certification" memo in lieu of a DD-Form 214, Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty. Active duty members applying for a civil service position without submitting a valid certification memo or DD-Form 214 with their application will render the member ineligible for the position. The certification memo must originate from the member's military service branch on official letterhead and contain the following:
Name/Rank/Grade of Service Member
Branch of Armed Forces
Dates of Active Service (Start and End Date(s)
Expected Date of Discharge/Release from Active Duty
Terminal leave start date (if applicable)
Expected character of service/discharge and type of separation (i.e. separation or retirement)
Must be certified within 120 days of anticipated discharge
Signature by, or by direction of the adjutant, personnel office, unit commander, or higher headquarters commander.
Note: The VOW Act provides tentative preference. If appointed, a DD Form-214 must be submitted upon receipt.

OPTIONAL DOCUMENTS:
Performance Appraisals for Current Federal Civilian Employees - Most recent performance appraisals (dated within last 3 years) showing the official rating of record, signed by a supervisor, or statement why the performance appraisal is unavailable.
Awards for Current Federal Civilian employees - List any awards received within the last 3 years on the resume.
Note: Applicant must not submit award SF50s-Notification of Personnel Actions (SF50s).
If you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:
Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.
Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.
